data.title: How Do I Add / Edit Bills On A Project?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to add and edit bills on a project.
data.body:
Creating bills for a project is a great way to keep track of all bills associated to that project. FieldFlō's bill tracking capabilities makes this process easy. This article will walk you through exactly how to add and edit bills on a project!
​

Required

In order to add or edit Bills, you must have the following roles enabled:
​
• View All Projects or View Assigned Projects
• Add Bill


Here are the steps to add a Bill to a Project:

  1. Click Projects on the left main menu.

  2. You can Search for your project using the Project Name / Project Number, or scroll to find your project. Once you find the project you need, click on it to open it up.

  3. Click the 3 Dots on the top right, then click Billing.

  4. Click + New Bill.

  5. You will have some Mandatory and Optional fields to fill out. Each field that is marked with a * is required. Below is a guide to what each field means:

    Bill Name/Number * - This is the label of this bill. Enter a Name and/or Number.


    Bill Amount * - This is the bill's cost. Enter a dollar amount.

    Client * - Select a Client from the drop-down option. This is depicting who the bill is for.

    Project Type - (optional) This field is depicting which type of project this is for. Select a Project Type from the drop-down.

    Bill To - (optional) Enter the following information.
    Contact Name, Email, Street Address, City, State, ZIP Code.
    Note - You can select Save Edits to Project Details to update this Project's Details with this client's information.

    Project Scope - (optional) Enter any Scope of Work that you would like you or the client to see. This can be included or excluded from the client's view.


    ​

data.title: How Do I Use Item Form Tagging?
data.description: This article will cover how to use Item Form Tagging on a custom built form in FieldFlō.
data.body:
Item form tagging is a great tool to use that will log each time an Inventory item is entered on a form. This article will walk you through how to utilize this feature!
​

Required

• In order to set up Item Form Tagging in Form Builder, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled.

• In order to view which forms an inventory item is tagged on, you must have the Add Item role enabled

Information

The ​INVENTORY LOOKUP FIELD is the only data object that will allow this feature.


Here are the steps on how to use Item Form Tagging:

  1. Navigate to Form Builder by clicking Admin, then select Form Builder.

  2. If you need to add this feature to an existing form, use the Name field to search for the form, or scroll to find your form. If you need to create a new form, click + Add New Form. Click directly on the form to start working on it.

  3. Find the INVENTORY LOOKUP FIELD data object and click the Gear icon to the right of it.

  4. Once the settings open, select the Radio button next to Tag Inventory Item/Form to the inventory item details, then click Save.

  5. Now when an inventory item's name is entered on this form, the form will show up when clicking into the item's profile, and selecting EMPLOYEE FORM TAGGING.
    ​
    ​​Note: You can jump directly to the form by clicking on the form name!

data.title: How Do I Use Employee Form Tagging?
data.description: This article will cover how to use Employee Form Tagging on a custom built form in FieldFlō.
data.body:
Employee form tagging is a useful tool to help you log each time an employee's name is entered on a form. This article will walk you through exactly what this does, and how to use it!

Required

  • In order to set up employee form tagging, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled.
    ​

  • In order to view which forms an employee is tagged on, you must have the Edit Employee role enabled

Information

Employee Form Tagging is set up in Form Builder. The following data objects will allow this feature:
​
​• TIMESHEET EMPLOYEE POPULATE
• PERSON SELECTOR


Here are the steps on how to use Employee Form Tagging:

  1. Navigate to Form Builder by clicking Admin, then select Form Builder.

  2. If you need to add this feature to an existing form, use the Name field to search for the form, or scroll to find your form. If you need to create a new form, click + Add New Form. Click directly on the form to start working on it.

  3. Find the TIMESHEET EMPLOYEE POPULATE or PERSON SELECTOR data object, and click the Gear icon to the right of it.

  4. Once the settings open, select the Radio button next to Tag Employee/Form to the employees details, then click Save.

  5. Now when an employee's name is entered on this form, the form will show up when clicking into their employee profile, and selecting EMPLOYEE FORM TAGGING.
    ​
    ​​Note: You can jump directly to the form by clicking on the form name!

data.title: How Do I Complete A Daily Timesheet?
data.description: This article will guide you through the steps on how to complete a Daily Timesheet.
data.body:
Completing a Daily Timesheet on a project each day will allow you to keep track of all employees work time on that project. This article will walk you through exactly how to do this!

Required

In order to complete a Daily Timesheet, you must have the following roles enabled:
​
• View All Projects or View Assigned Projects

• Add / Edit Open Forms

Information

Employees clock in using a Position, which has a labor cost associated to it. Daily Timesheets will update your projects Job Costing with each employee's total labor cost.


Here are the steps on how to complete a Daily Timesheet:

  1. Navigate to the project you're working on by clicking Projects on the left hand side.

  2. Scroll to find your project, or use the search field on the top to search by Project Name or Project Number. Once you find the project, click on the project to open it's dashboard.

  3. Add the Daily Timesheet by clicking Start Day which will drop in all mandatory forms for that day. Or click + Add Form, select the Daily Timesheet, then click Save.

  4. Click on the Daily Timesheet to open it up.

  5. As the Supervisor, select your name from the Foreman / Superintendent Signature drop-down and click the blue Add to timesheet hyperlink.

  6. (Optional) By clicking the 3 dots on the top right, you have the following options to easily populate this timesheet.
    ​
    ​Same As Previous Day - This will allow you to pick a previous timesheet to copy over to this timesheet. This is a big time saver.
    ​
    ​Pull from Scheduling - This will pull all employees from this project's schedule, and they will be automatically be added to this timesheet.

  7. Once you're added to the Timesheet, click + Employee on the top right, select each employee that needs to be added, then click Save.

  8. After all employees are added, make sure each employee is assigned a position under their Position drop-down.
    ​
    ​Note: If you see a Phase, Prevailing Wage, or Union Skill Level drop-down for each employee, make sure to select an option from those drop-downs.

  9. Start time for everyone on the timesheet by selecting the Radio Button on the top left of all the employees (this will select all employees), then click the green Start button at the top.
    ​
    ​Note: To start time for only one employee, select their individual radio button, then select the Start button.


    ​Button Guide:
    ​
    ​ - Clicking this button will allow you to select start times, end times, and break times without actually starting the timesheet. Doing this will affect all employees that are selected.
    ​
    ​ - Clicking this button will allow you to assign the same position to all employees at once.
    ​

    - Clicking this button will delete the employee from the timesheet. This can only be done per employee.

  10. You know the employee's time is running if their name turns Green. To stop time for all employees, select the radio button to the top left of all the employees, then click Stop.

  11. Now the employees will be Yellow, indicating that their time needs to be verified. Verify time for all employees by selecting that radio button on the top left of all employees, after this selection you have the following options:
    ​
    • Verify for all employees by clicking the Verify yellow button on the top.


    • Employees can verify using their own phones via text. To send this text, select the SMS phone icon on the top right (or bottom left).


    • Employees can verify on the Supervisor's device by clicking their individual Verify yellow button. This will have to be done one employee at a time.

  12. When the employees turn Black, this indicates that their time is stopped and verified. If you don't need to add Notes or Images, this Timesheet can now be closed.

  13. Close this form by clicking End Day (this will close all forms that are white), or click the Close Form icon to the right of the form.

Information

• You can now find this Daily Timesheet in the Closed Forms section of the project.
​
• The Job Costing of this project will be affected as soon as this form is closed.
​
• You can run a report of these hours after the fact using our Payroll Exports module.

data.title: How Do I Add FieldFlō To My Home Screen? (Spanish)
data.description: Este artículo te guiará a través de los pasos sobre cómo agregar FieldFlō a la pantalla de inicio de tu dispositivo. Este artículo cubrirá dispositivos Android, iPhones/iPads y computadoras.
data.body:
Agregar FieldFlō a tu pantalla de inicio ahorra tiempo. Esto te permite hacer clic en un ícono en tu pantalla de inicio para acceder a FieldFlō, en lugar de escribir el URL de tu empresa en un navegador cada vez que inicias sesión. ¡Este artículo te guiará a través de los pasos exactos para lograrlo!


Aquí están los pasos para agregar FieldFlō a la pantalla de inicio de un dispositivo Android:

  1. Abra su plataforma de FieldFlo en Chrome para Android e inicie sesión.

  2. Toca el botón de menú junto a la barra de direcciones. --->

  3. Luego seleccionará Agregar a la pantalla de inicio.

  4. El icono de FieldFlo aparecerá en su pantalla de inicio como cualquier otra aplicación. Siéntase libre de moverlo. Cuando la seleccione, FieldFlo se abrirá en pantalla completa.


    ​

    Aquí están los pasos para agregar FieldFlō a la pantalla de inicio de un iPhone/iPad:

    1. Abra su plataforma de FieldFlo en Safari e inicie sesión.

    2. Toque el botón de compartir en la parte inferior de la pantalla --->

    3. Luego seleccionará Agregar a la pantalla de inicio.

    4. El icono de FieldFlo aparecerá en su pantalla de inicio como cualquier otra aplicación. Siéntase libre de moverlo. Cuando la seleccione, FieldFlo se abrirá en pantalla completa.


    ​


    ​

    Aquí están los pasos para agregar FieldFlō a la pantalla de inicio de una computadora:

    1. Abre FieldFlō en el navegador web Google Chrome e inicia sesión.

    2. Resalta la URL de FieldFlō en la barra de búsqueda y luego arrástrala y suéltala directamente en tu pantalla principal.

    3. Una vez que FieldFlō esté en tu pantalla principal, puedes cambiar el nombre de este acceso directo haciendo clic derecho sobre el ícono y seleccionando Renombrar.

data.title: How Do I Add FieldFlō To My Home Screen? (English)
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps o how to add FieldFlō to your device's home screen. This article will cover Android devices, iPhones/iPads, and computers.
data.body:
Adding FieldFlō to your home screen is a time saver. This allows you to click an icon on your home screen to access FieldFlō, instead of typing in your company's URL into a browser each time you log in. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to accomplish this!

Here are the steps on how to add FieldFlō to an Android's home screen:

  1. Open your FieldFlo platform in Chrome for Android, and log in.

  2. Tap the menu button next to the address bar --->

  3. Click Add to Home screen.

  4. The FieldFlo icon will appear on your home screen just like any other app. Feel free to move it around. When you tap it, FieldFlo will open in full screen.


    ​

    Here are the steps on how to add FieldFlō to an iPhone/iPad's home screen:

    1. Open your FieldFlo platform in Safari, and log in.

    2. Tap the share button at the bottom of the screen --->

    3. Select Add to Home Screen.

    4. The FieldFlo icon will appear on your home screen just like any other app. Feel free to move it around. When you tap it, FieldFlo will open in full screen.


    ​


Here are the steps on how to add FieldFlō to a computer's home screen:


1. Open up FieldFlo on Google Chrome web browser and log in.

2. Highlight FieldFlo's URL on your search bar, then drag and drop the URL directly to your desktop.

3. Once FieldFlo is on your desktop, you can rename this shortcut by right clicking the icon and click Rename.

data.title: How Do I Use The Project Details Read Only Data Object While Building Proposals?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Projects Details Read Only data object while building proposals in FieldFlō's CRM module.
data.body:
The Projects Details Read Only data object is a great way to display basic project information on your proposal. This article will show you the exact steps on how to use this!

Required

In order to build proposals, you must have the following roles enabled:
​
​• View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads
• Can Add Leads

Here are the steps to use the Project Details Read Only data object while building proposals:

  1. Drag and drop the Projects Details Read Only data object to the center of your proposal.

  2. Once your Projects Details Read Only data object is dropped, you have the following PROJECT DETAILS DATA SETTINGS to configure and click Save:
    ​

    • Font Size - Select a font size from the drop-down. This will depict the overall size of the project's details.
    ​
    • Justify - Select the radio button next to Left, Center, or Right to choose where you want the project details to be displayed.
    ​
    • Color - Select a color from the drop-down. This will be the color of the project details data.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the following options:
    ​
    ​ - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​
    ​ - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Link Assets To An Employee For Scheduling?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to link assets to an employee.
data.body:
Linking assets to an employee will allow you to schedule the employee and asset at the same time easily. This article will show you exactly how to do this!

Required

In order to link assets to an employee, you must have the Add Item inventory permission.

Information

Multiple assets can be linked to one employee, but only one employee can be linked to an asset


Here are the steps on how to link assets to an employee for scheduling:

  1. On your left main menu, click Inventory.

  2. Find your inventory item by scrolling, using the search field, or use Filters to narrow down the inventory list. Once you've found the item, click on it to open up the details.

  3. Underneath Add To Employee, choose the employee that you need this item linked to and click Save.

  4. Now when scheduling this employee, you have the option to link the schedule to this asset as well!

data.title: How Do I Use The Bid - Line Item Data Object While Building Proposals?
data.description: This article will show you the steps on how to use the Bid - Line Item data object while building proposals in FieldFlō's CRM module.
data.body:
The Bid - Line Item data object is a great way to display a detailed bid amount for any type of budgeted work on a proposal.

Required

In order to build proposals, you must have the following roles enabled:
​
​• View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads
• Can Add Leads


Here are the steps on how to use the Bid - Line Item data object while building proposals:

  1. Drag and drop the Bid - Line Item data object to the center of your proposal.

  2. Once it's dropped, the BID LINE details will appear. Configure the following information about this bid and click Save:


    • Type - Select the type of bid item from the drop-down. Once a type is selected, enter the additional data that appears.
    • Qty - Enter the quantity of this bid item in the text field.
    • Unit Cost - Enter the cost of one unit.
    • Description - Enter a brief description of your bid item.
    • Mark Up - Enter the Markup price in the text field.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the following options:
    ​

    - Click this icon to edit the bid line item's settings.
    ​

    - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Signature Data Object While Building Proposals?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to use the Signature data object while building proposals in FieldFlō's CRM module.
data.body:
The Signature data object is a great tool to use to capture signatures on your proposals, this creates a signature line for clients to sign off on. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to add this to your proposal!

Required

In order to build Proposals, you must have the following roles enabled:
​
​• View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads
• Can Add Leads

Here are the steps to use the Signature data object while building proposals:

  1. Drag and drop the Signature data object to the center of your proposal.

  2. Once it's dropped, the SIGNATURE SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and click Save:


    • Title - Enter a title in the text field. This is the title that will appear above the signature lines.
    ​
    • Under Text Title - Enter a description or information in the text field. This will appear in between the title and signature lines.
    ​
    • Name, Signature, Date - Select the radio button next to each option to include it in the proposal. If an option is selected, it will create a signature line for that data to be entered.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the following options:
    ​

    - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​

    - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Insert PDF Data Object While Building Proposals?
data.description: This article will show you on how to use the Insert PDF data object while building proposals in FieldFlō's CRM module.
data.body:
The Insert PDF data object is a great way to display PDF documents on your proposals. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to use this!

Required

In order to build Proposals, you must have the following roles enabled:
​
​• View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads
• Can Add Leads

Here are the steps on how to use the Insert PDF data object while building proposals:

  1. Drag and drop the Insert PDF data object to the desired spot in the center of your proposal.

  2. Once the data object is dropped, upload your PDF by clicking Upload File, choose your PDF, then click Save.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the following options:
    ​

    - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​

    - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Graphic Data Object While Building Proposals?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Graphic data object while building proposals in FieldFlō's CRM module.
data.body:
The Graphic data object is a simple tool which allows you to add images to view on your proposals. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to use this!

Required

In order to build Proposals, you must have the following roles enabled:
​
​• View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads
• Can Add Leads

Here are the steps to use the Graphic data object while building proposals:

  1. Drag and drop the Graphic data object to the desired spot in the center of your proposal.

  2. Once it's dropped, the GRAPHIC SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and click Save:
    ​
    • Graphic - Click Upload Image and attach the image you need to display.
    ​
    • Justify - Select the radio button next to Left, Center, or Right to choose where you want this image to be displayed.
    ​
    • Width - Select the radio button next to Max, 75%, or 50% to depict how much of the page this image will take up.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the following options:
    ​

    - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​

    - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Paragraph Advanced Data Object While Building Proposals?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Paragraph Advanced data object while building proposals in FieldFlō's CRM module.
data.body:
The Paragraph Advanced data object is an easy tool that allows you to display paragraphs of text on your proposals. It will allow for many customizations to be applied to your text. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to use this!

Required

In order to build Proposals, you must have the following roles enabled:
​
​• View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads
• Can Add Leads

Here are the steps to use the Paragraph Advanced data object while building proposals:

  1. Drag and drop the Paragraph Advanced data object to the desired area in the center of your screen.

  2. Once your data object is dropped, you have the following PARAGRAPH SETTINGS to configure and click Save:
    ​
    • Paragraph - Select Pre Built or New. If Pre Built is selected, choose your pre built paragraph from the drop-down.
    ​
    • Content - If a new paragraph needs to be written, type your paragraph in this text field. You can use the options on top to customize your paragraph.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the following options:
    ​

    - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​

    - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.description: This article will show you how to use the Paragraph data object while building proposals in FieldFlō's CRM module.

data.title: How Do I Use The Title & Breakline Data Objects While Building Proposals?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Title and Breakline data objects in FieldFlo's Proposal Builder.
data.body:
The Title and Breakline data objects are great tools that are used to section your proposals and make a titles. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do use these tools!

Required

In order to build Proposals, you must have the following roles enabled:
​
​• View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads
• Can Add Leads

Here are the steps to use the Title data object:

  1. Drag and drop the Title data object to the desired area in the center of your screen.

  2. Once it's dropped, the TITLE SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and click Save:

    • Title Name - Enter a name in the text field. This will be the name of the title.
    ​
    • Font Size - Select a font size from the drop-down. This will depict the overall size of this title.


    • Justify - Select the radio button next to Left, Center, or Right to choose where you want this title to be displayed.


    • Color - Select a color from the drop-down. This will be the color of your breakline.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the the following options:
    ​
    ​ - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​
    ​ - Click this icon to delete the data object.

Here are the steps to use the Breakline data object:

  1. Drag and Drop the Breakline data object to the desired area in the center of your screen.

  2. Once it's dropped, the BREAKLINE SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and click Save:

    • Size - Select the radio button next to SM, MED, or LG to choose the thickness of the breakline.
    ​
    • Width - Select the radio button next to Max, 90%, 80%, or 70% to depict how wide this breakline will be.
    ​
    • Color - Select a color from the drop-down. This will be the color of your breakline.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the following options:
    ​
    ​ - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​
    ​ - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Crew View While Scheduling?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Crew view to schedule employees and assets.
data.body:
The Crew scheduling view allows you to view all employees/assets at once while configuring hours for each. This article will walk you through the steps on how to use this view!

Required

In order to use the Scheduling module, you must have the Full Scheduling Access role enabled.

Here are the steps to use the Crew view while scheduling:

  1. Once you navigate to the Weekly Scheduling module, click the Crew tab.

  2. Find the employee or asset you need to schedule by scrolling, or you can use the Employee Filters or Asset Filters on the right hand side to quickly search and narrow down your list.

  3. Once you are ready to schedule, click the white space to the right of the employee/asset to start configuring hours.

  4. After selecting employees or assets to schedule, set their hours, break times, and add notes using the guide below:


    • Start - For each day, select the start time in this field.


    • End - For each day, select the end time in this field.
    ​
    • Break Time - For each day, select their break duration in this field.
    ​
    • Same As - Select a day from the drop-down to copy its hours to the current day.
    ​
    • Scheduling Notes - Enter any notes you'd like the employees to see in their scheduling confirmation text.
    ​
    • Employee Notes - If employees enter notes in their confirmation text for this week, they will appear here. Click Clear Notifications to acknowledge and clear the alert. Click Clear to permanently delete the note.

  5. Below is a guide explaining each option that is available while configuring these hours:
    ​
    ​ - This button completely deletes this weeks schedule for this employee(s) or asset(s).
    ​
    ​ - Click this button to redo this schedule. This will clear any hours that are already entered.

    - This button resets the hours to the Default Scheduling Hours. The Default Scheduling Hours are configured in Scheduling Settings.

    or - These options appear on each day of the week. Select either of these buttons to clear the hours for that day only.
    ​
    ​ - This option appears above each day of the week. Select this + button to separate hours for that day. This is useful if employees leave the job, then return at a later time.
    ​​Example: Start 7am - End 10am / Start 1pm - End 3pm

  6. Once all hours are entered, click Save.

    Could not display content

  7. (Optional) Once the hours are saved, you have some additional options to adjust hours:
    ​
    ​ - You can make adjustments by clicking Details. This will take you back to the screen to configure hours.

    - For additional adjustments, select the employee or assets hours box. You can select the hours from a single day, multiple days, or click to include everything. Then make changes using the icons.
    ​

    - Click this icon to cancel all selections.
    ​
    ​ - Click this icon to acknowledge any scheduling notes and clear the notification.
    ​

    - This icon copies the selected hours to another employee or asset.
    ​

    - This icon moves the selected employee(s)/asset(s) hours to a different project.

    - If one day's hours is selected, you can click this icon to copy those hours to another day.
    ​

    - This icon deletes the selected hours.
    ​
    ​Note: To use these icons, you must select which employees or assets hours will be effected by making sure their Hours are clicked and highlighted green. These icons will only effect the hours that are selected.
    ​Example:

  8. (Optional) You can send a confirmation text to employees individually by selecting the Radio buttons next to their name, and click the icon.
    ​
    ​Note: While using the icon, a text will send to all employees that are selected.
    ​Example:

  9. (Optional) You can send a confirmation text to all employees who are scheduled by clicking Ready SMS, Send Schedule, then click Yes.
    ​
    ​Note: Clicking Ready SMS will send a text to ALL EMPLOYEES who are scheduled across ALL PROJECTS.

data.title: How Do I Use The All Projects View While Scheduling?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to use the All Projects view to schedule Employees and Assets.
data.body:
The All Projects view allows you to schedule Employees and Assets while being able to easily view other project schedules. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to utilize this view!

Required

In order to use the Scheduling module, you must have the Full Scheduling Access role enabled.


Here are the steps to use the All Projects view while scheduling:

  1. Once you navigate to the Weekly Scheduling module, click the All Projects tab.

  2. To start scheduling, click on the project that you need to schedule.
    ​
    ​Note: You can search for projects and narrow down projects to choose from by clicking Project Filters.

  3. Once you click the project that you need to schedule, click an Employee or Asset to schedule on the right hand side.
    ​
    ​Note: Click Select Multiple to choose several employees at once. Multi-select each employee you want to schedule, then click Schedule Selected to apply hours. Use Employee Filters or Asset Filters to quickly search and narrow down your list.
    ​
    ​Additional Note: If using employee scheduling groups, click the Groups tab to schedule a group. You can also click Group Filters to search for specific groups.

  4. After selecting employees or assets to schedule, set their hours, break times, and add notes using the guide below:


    • Start - For each day, select the start time in this field.


    • End - For each day, select the end time in this field.
    ​
    • Break Time - For each day, select their break duration in this field.
    ​
    • Same As - Select a day from the drop-down to copy its hours to the current day.
    ​
    • Scheduling Notes - Enter any notes you'd like the employees to see in their scheduling confirmation text.
    ​
    • Employee Notes - If employees enter notes in their confirmation text for this week, they will appear here. Click Clear Notifications to acknowledge and clear the alert. Click Clear to permanently delete the note.

  5. Below is a guide explaining each option that is available while configuring these hours:
    ​

    - This button completely deletes this weeks schedule for this employee(s) or asset(s).
    ​

    - Click this button to redo this schedule. This will clear any hours that are already entered.

    - This button resets the hours to the Default Scheduling Hours. The Default Scheduling Hours are configured in Scheduling Settings.

    or - These options appear on each day of the week. Select either of these buttons to clear the hours for that day only.
    ​

    - This option appears above each day of the week. Select this + button to separate hours for that day. This is useful if employees leave the job, then return at a later time.
    ​​Example: Start 7am - End 10am / Start 1pm - End 3pm

  6. Once all hours are entered, click Save.

  7. (Optional) Once the hours are saved, you have some additional options:
    ​

    - Click this icon to delete the schedule for this project only.
    ​

    - This option will highlight this project green on the right hand side. This is a visual to mark which projects have already been scheduled.

    - Click these options to view either Scope of Work or Scheduling Notes.
    ​

    - You can make adjustments by clicking Details. This will take you back to the screen to configure hours.
    ​

    - For additional adjustments, select the employee or assets hours box. You can select the hours from a single day, multiple days, or click to include everything. Then make changes using the icons.
    ​

    - Click this icon to cancel all selections.
    ​

  8. (Optional) After you select which hours you need to change, you have the following icons to adjust time:
    ​
    ​ - This icon copies the selected hours to another employee or asset.
    ​
    ​ - This icon moves the selected employee(s)/asset(s) hours to a different project.

    - If one day's hours is selected, you can click this icon to copy those hours to another day.
    ​
    ​ - This icon deletes the selected hours.
    ​
    ​Note: To use these icons, you must select which employees or assets hours will be effected by making sure their Hours are clicked and highlighted green. These icons will only effect the hours that are selected.
    ​Example:

  9. (Optional) Once your schedule is ready, you can send a confirmation text to all employees who are scheduled by clicking Ready SMS, Send Schedule, then click Yes.
    ​
    ​NOTE: Clicking Ready SMS will send a text to ALL EMPLOYEES who are scheduled across ALL PROJECTS.

data.title: How Do I Add A Lead?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to add a Lead to FieldFlo's CRM module.
data.body:
Creating Leads is made simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add new Leads, you must have the Can Add Leads role enabled.

Here are the steps to add a Lead:

  1. On your left main menu, click CRM, then click Leads.

  2. On the top right, click + Add Lead.

  3. The ADD LEAD pop-out will appear. Enter the following information for your new Lead and click Save:
    ​

    • Lead Number - You can type a new Lead number in the text field, or follow click the icons below:
    ​

    ​ - Click this to auto increment the Lead Number from the last Lead that was entered.

    - Click this to copy the last Lead Number that was entered.

    • Lead Name - Enter the name of this Lead.

  4. Project Template (Optional) - Choose a Project Template from the drop-down. This will control what information is entered in the Project Details when this Lead turns into a Project.

  5. Once you click Save, you can find your Lead by using the search field within the main Leads screen.

data.title: How Do I Use The Project View While Scheduling?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Project view to schedule employees and assets.
data.body:
The Project view is a great way to schedule employees or assets one project at a time. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to use this view!

Required

In order to use the Scheduling module, you must have the Full Scheduling Access role enabled.

Here are the steps to use the Project view while scheduling:

  1. Once you navigate to the Weekly Scheduling module, click the Project tab.

  2. To start scheduling a project, click on the specific project from the PROJECTS section on the right hand side.
    ​
    ​Note: You can search for projects and narrow down projects to choose from by clicking Project Filters.

  3. Once you choose a project, click an Employee or Asset to schedule on the right hand side.
    ​
    ​Note: Click Select Multiple to choose several employees at once. Multi-select each employee you want to schedule, then click Schedule Selected to apply hours. Use Employee Filters or Asset Filters to quickly search and narrow down your list.
    ​
    ​Additional Note: If using employee scheduling groups, click the Groups tab to schedule a group. You can also click Group Filters to search for specific groups.

  4. After selecting employees or assets to schedule, set their hours, break times, and add notes using the guide below:


    • Start - For each day, select the start time in this field.


    • End - For each day, select the end time in this field.
    ​
    • Break Time - For each day, select their break duration in this field.
    ​
    • Same As - Select a day from the drop-down to copy its hours to the current day.
    ​
    • Scheduling Notes - Enter any notes you'd like the employees to see in their scheduling confirmation text.
    ​
    • Employee Notes - If employees enter notes in their confirmation text for this week, they will appear here. Click Clear Notifications to acknowledge and clear the alert. Click Clear to permanently delete the note.

  5. Below is a guide explaining each option that is available while configuring these hours:
    ​
    ​ - This button completely deletes this weeks schedule for this employee(s) or asset(s).
    ​
    ​ - Click this button to redo this schedule. This will clear any hours that are already entered.

    - This button resets the hours to the Default Scheduling Hours. The Default Scheduling Hours are configured in Scheduling Settings.

    or - These options appear on each day of the week. Select either of these buttons to clear the hours for that day only.
    ​
    ​ - This option appears above each day of the week. Select this + button to separate hours for that day. This is useful if employees leave the job, then return at a later time.
    ​​Example: Start 7am - End 10am / Start 1pm - End 3pm

  6. Once all hours are entered, click Save.

  7. (Optional) Once the hours are saved, you have some additional options:
    ​
    ​ - Click this icon to delete the schedule for this project only.
    ​
    ​ - This option will exit out of this project's schedule, allowing you to choose another project to start scheduling.
    ​
    ​ - This option will highlight this project green on the right hand side. This is a visual to mark which projects have already been scheduled.
    ​

    - Click these options to view either Scope of Work or Scheduling Notes.


    ​- You can make adjustments by clicking directly on the employee or assets Grey Circle. This will take you back to the screen to configure hours.
    ​

    - For additional adjustments, select the employee or assets Radio Button. You can select the bubble from a single day, multiple days, or click to include everything. Then make changes using the icons.
    ​
    ​ - Click this icon to cancel all selections.
    ​

  8. (Optional) After you select which hours you need to change, you have the following icons to adjust time:
    ​
    ​ - This icon copies the selected hours to another employee or asset.
    ​
    ​ - This icon moves the selected employee(s)/asset(s) hours to a different project.

    - If one day's hours is selected, you can click this icon to copy those hours to another day.
    ​
    ​ - This icon deletes the selected hours.
    ​
    ​Note: To use these icons, you must select which employees or assets hours will be effected by making sure their Radio button is clicked.
    ​Example:

  9. (Optional) Once your schedule is ready, you can send a confirmation text to all employees who are scheduled by clicking Ready SMS, Send Schedule, then click Yes.
    ​
    ​NOTE: Clicking Ready SMS will send a text to ALL EMPLOYEES who are scheduled across ALL PROJECTS.

data.title: How Do I Set Up Scheduling Settings?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to set up Scheduling Settings and the purpose of each setting.
data.body:
Setting up Scheduling Settings gives you options to configure how the schedule is received, and how the schedule acts as you create it. This article will show you exactly what each setting does!

Required

In order to set up Scheduling Settings, you must have the Full Scheduling Access role enabled.

Here are the steps to set up Scheduling Settings:

  1. On your left main menu, click Scheduling, then click Settings.

  2. Configure the following Schedule to Employees settings:

    • SMS - This will send a Text to all employees that are scheduled.

    • Email - This will send an Email to all employees that are scheduled.

    • Confirmation - This will give the employee an option to enter their pin and confirm the schedule sent to them.

  3. Configure the following Scheduling Options setting:
    ​
    • Send crew names in dispatch in scheduling - Selecting this will include all other employee names that are scheduled for that job in the scheduling text.

  4. Configure the Red when hours hit setting. Select an amount of hours from the drop-down.
    ​
    ​Note: The employees name will turn red once they are scheduled for this amount of hours.

  5. Set up the Default Weekly Start Day setting. Choose the day from the drop-down.
    ​
    ​Note: The day that is selected will be the first day of the week that shows when scheduling hours.

  6. Set up the Default Scheduling Hours by configuring the Start, End, and Break Time for each day.
    ​
    ​Note: The times that are selected here will be the default times that show up when you start to schedule hours.

data.title: How Do I Use Scheduling?
data.description: This article will show you how to schedule employees and assets using FieldFlō's Scheduling module.
data.body:
Creating a weekly schedule for employees and assets is made simple with FieldFlō. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to utilize this feature!

Required

In order to use the Scheduling module, you must have the Full Scheduling Access role enabled.

Information

Before you create your schedule, you may want to check your Scheduling Settings so the schedule works and sends the way you would like. You can refer to the article below to learn about Scheduling Settings!
​

How Do I Set Up Scheduling Settings?

If you're needing to schedule an employee for one day only, you can refer to the article below!
​

How Do I Use Daily Scheduling?


Here are the steps to use Scheduling:

  1. On your left main menu, click Scheduling, then click Week.

  2. Click the Week drop-down and select the week you're creating the schedule for.

  3. Click Open.

  4. Once your schedule opens, you have the following options to configure on the top of your screen:

    Type - You can select Crew, Asset, or All. This is depicting what you're scheduling.
    ​

    Set Day - You can select a day from the drop-down to create the schedule for that day only.

  5. Start scheduling by using the Project, All Projects, or Crew tabs. For detailed instructions on how to use each view, you can click on the buttons below!
    ​
    ​

    How Do I Use The Project View While Scheduling?

    How Do I Use The All Projects View While Scheduling?

    How Do I Use The Crew View While Scheduling?

  6. (Optional) After sending the Scheduling Verification text, you can track the status using the guide below:
    ​
    ​ - This weeks schedule was accepted by the employee via text.
    ​
    ​ - This weeks schedule was denied by the employee via text.
    ​
    ​ - This weeks schedule was sent to the employee via text, but it has not been accepted or denied.


    ​ - This weeks schedule was not sent to the employee.

    Note: You can make changes to the schedule by adjusting the hours, then resending the scheduling verification text to the effected employees.

data.title: How Do I Use The Link Data Object?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Link data object within FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The Link data object is a great way to include hyperlinks within a form. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to add this to a custom form!

Required

In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled.

Here are the steps to use the Link data object:

  1. Drag and drop the Link data object to the desired spot in the center of your screen.

  2. Once it's dropped, the SAFETY SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and click Save:
    ​
    • Link Name - This is the title of the hyperlink. Enter a name in the text field.
    ​
    • URL - Enter the URL for the hyperlink in the text field.
    ​
    • Open in New Tab - If this option is selected, when the link is clicked it will open a new tab instead of opening in the tab they're currently on.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the the following options:
    ​
    • Blue pdf square - When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.
    ​
    • Settings Gear Icon - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​
    • Trash can icon - Click this icon to delete the Safety data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Safety Data Object?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Safety data object within FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The Safety data object is a great way to log incidents, Near Misses, Stop Works, and Injuries. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to add this option to a custom form!

Required

In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled.


Here are the steps to use the Safety data object:

  1. Drag and drop the Safety data object to the desired spot in the center of your screen.

  2. Once it's dropped, the SAFETY SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and click Save:

    • Incident, Near Miss, Stop Work, Injury - Select one of these options to depict which safety type you're needing to log.

    • Use Custom Labels - If this is selected, enter your custom Label and Description in each text field.

    Note: If Injury is selected, you must add the "Person Selector / Pin Verify" data object. After it is added to the form, you can then select that data object from the "injured employee block" drop-down within the SAFETY SETTINGS.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the the following options:
    ​
    • Blue pdf square - When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.
    ​
    • Settings Gear Icon - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​
    • Trash can icon - Click this icon to delete the Safety data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Inventory Lookup Field Data Object?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Inventory Lookup Field data object within FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The Inventory Lookup Field data object is an easy way to lookup inventory items and document them within a form. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to add this to a custom form!

Required

In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled.


Here are the steps to use the Inventory Lookup Field data object:

  1. Drag and drop the Inventory Lookup Field data object to the desired spot in the center of your screen.

  2. Once it's dropped, the INVENTORY LOOKUP FIELD SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and click Save:
    ​
    • Inventory Lookup Field Name - This is the title of the Inventory Lookup Field. Enter a name in the text field.


    • Required - Select this setting to make the Inventory Lookup Field a required entry in order to close the form.
    ​
    • Tag Inventory Item/Form to the inventory item details - If this setting is selected, every time an item is entered in this field, the form name will show up within the "Item Form Tagging" tab within the items profile.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the the following options:
    ​
    • Blue pdf square - When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.
    ​
    • Settings Gear Icon - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​
    • Trash Can Icon - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Person Selector / Pin Verify Data Object?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Person Selector / Pin Verify data object within FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The Pin Selector / Pin Verify data object will allow you to choose employee names from a drop-down with an option to capture their signature. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to add this to a custom form!

Required

In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled.

Here are the steps to use the Person Selector / Pin Verify data object:

  1. Drag and drop the Person Selector / Pin Verify data object to the desired spot in the center of your screen.

  2. Once it's dropped, the PERSON SELECTOR SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and click Save:
    ​
    • Required - Select this option to make this whole data object required to complete in order to close this form.
    ​
    • All Employees - Select this option to have all employee names show as drop-down options.
    ​
    • Can Login / Supervisors Only - Select this option to have only supervisors and employees who can login show as drop-down options
    ​
    • Pin Required - Select this option to make each employee enter their PIN in order to close this form.
    ​
    • Enter Pin - Select this option to capture the employees PIN. If selected, this option will not be required.
    ​
    • Anyone with Role 'Can validate anything with PIN' - Select this option to allow employees with the 'Can validate anything with PIN' role to PIN for other employees.
    ​
    • Project Supervisor - Select this option to make the Supervisor on that project be able to PIN for other employees.
    ​
    • Tag Employee/Form to the employee details - Selecting this option will make it so that every time an employees name is entered using this person selector, the form name will appear in the "Employee Form Tagging" tab within that employees profile.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the the following options:
    ​
    • Blue pdf square - When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.
    ​
    • Settings Gear Icon - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​
    • Trash can icon - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Time Picker Data Object?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Time Picker data object within FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The Time Picker data object is a great tool to use when needing to capture an exact time of day on your forms. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to add this to a custom form!

Required

In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled.


Here are the steps to use the Time Picker data object:

  1. Drag and drop the Date Picker data object to the desired spot in the center of your screen.

  2. Once it's dropped, the TIME PICKER SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and click Save:

    • Time Picker Name - This is the title of the time picker. Enter a name in the text field.

    • Default current time - With this setting selected, the time will default to the current time of day.
    ​
    • Required - Select this setting to make the Time Picker a required entry in order to close the form.
    ​
    • INFO POPUP - Enter information/description in the text field and select the active Radio button. This will make an "i" icon appear and if a user hovers over this, they will see the information that was entered.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the the following options:
    ​
    • Blue pdf square - When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.
    ​
    • Settings Gear Icon - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​
    • Trash can icon - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Add Production Tasks To A Project?
data.description: This article will show you how to add production tasks to a project.
data.body:
Adding production tasks to your project allows you to start tracking production rates. FieldFlō makes this process simple! This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add production tasks to a project, you must have the following roles enabled:
​• View All Projects or View Assigned Projects

• Can edit Production Tasks


Here are the steps to add production tasks to a project:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, click View Details next to Production Tracking.

  5. Once your Production Dashboard opens, you can add tasks by clicking + Add Task(s).

  6. Once the ADD TASK(s) pop-up appears, you have the following options to configure and click Add:
    ​
    • Add to Phase - If Phases are used, select which phase that this task will be performed for. Otherwise, leave this field blank.
    ​
    • Filter by Task Group - You can filter the options to choose from by selecting a group. Once a group is selected, the list will show only tasks that are apart of that group. This will only work if you have task groups entered.
    ​
    • Filter by Task Name - You can use this search field to find your needed task.
    ​
    • Task Name - Select the Radio button next to each task that needs to be added. Once the radio button is selected, enter the Total Scope of how much area (UoM) this task will cover.

  7. After you click save, you can edit or remove tasks by clicking the 3 Dots next to the task and click Edit or Remove.

data.title: How Do I Complete The Production Tracking Form?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to complete the Production Tracking form.
data.body:
Completing the Production Tracking form is simple, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to complete the Production Tracking form, you must have production tracking enabled. Please refer to the article below to enable this feature!
​

How Do I Enable Production Tracking?

In order to complete the Production Tracking form, there must be tasks entered within this projects Production Tracking. In order to add tasks to a project, please refer to this article:
​

How Do I Add Production Tasks To A Project?

Here are the steps to complete the Production Tracking form:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, scroll down and click + Add Form.

  5. You can use the Filter Forms search bar on the top to search for the form, or you can scroll to find your form. Once you locate the form, click on the Radio button next to the Production Tracking form and click Save.

  6. Click anywhere on the Production Tracking form to open it up.

  7. First click the Date drop-down and select the correct date. Then select a Supervisor from the drop-down and enter the PIN.

  8. For each task that was worked, enter the correct amount of UoM that was completed today, in the Completed field.

  9. Click the Hours text box and enter the amount of hours that was spent working on each task.

  10. Once the Completed and Hours boxes are filled out ,Save & Close (to go back to dashboard) or click Save (to stay on the form).

  11. If your form is complete, you can close and submit this form by clicking the Close Form icon on the right side of the form. The form will also close when the End Day button is selected

  12. Now this project's Production Tracking is up to date! You can view the current production statistics by clicking the View Details next to Production Tracking.
    ​
    ​Note: In order for the Production Dashboard to update, the production tracking form must be closed.

data.title: How Do I Add/Edit Tasks For Production Tracking?
data.description: This article will show you how to add and edit tasks for Production Tracking.
data.body:
Adding and editing tasks for FieldFlō's Production Tracking is simple, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add and edit tasks for Production Tracking, you must have the Can edit Production Tasks role enabled.

Information

What is a Task and What is the Purpose?

• Tasks are the specific type of work that will be preformed on a project.
​
• Each task will include a Unit of Measure, this allows you to estimate how many units can be completed per hour.
​
• After tasks are configured, add tasks to that project within a project's Production Tracking. These should be the tasks that will be completed on that specific project only.
​
• Fill out the Production Tracking form on the project each day. This will allow you to keep track of the estimated hours compared to the actual hours of each task.


Here are the steps to add tasks for Production Tracking:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin then click Portal Admins.

  2. Scroll to the bottom and under PRODUCTION TRACKING, click TASKS.

  3. Once the Tasks screen opens, click + Add New on the top right.

  4. Enter the following information for your new task and click Save:
    ​
    • Task Name - This is the display name of the task.
    ​

    • Task Description - Enter a brief description of what this task involves.
    ​
    • Position Code - Select a position to associate with this task. If no position is selected, this task will not be included in Job Costing or Proposal Builder.
    ​
    • Estimated Production Rate / Hr - Enter the estimate of how much work can be completed per hour.
    ​
    ​• UoM Code - Enter a Unit of Measure and press enter on your keyboard. This will allow a maximum of 4 characters.
    ​Example: ft, sqft, m, sqm
    ​
    • UoM Name - Enter the full name of the Unit of Measure and press enter on your keyboard.
    ​Example: Feet, Square Feet, Meters, Square Meters
    ​

    • Task Groups - If you would like to group tasks together, type in the group name and press enter on your keyboard.

Here are the steps to edit a Task for Production Tracking:

  1. Once you're in the Production Tracking Tasks page, click the 3 Dots next to the desired task and click Edit.
    ​
    ​Note: You can click Move to Top, Move 1 Up, Move 1 Down, or Move to Bottom. This is how you arrange the order of your tasks in this list.

  2. Once the Edit Task window appears, you can make your changes to any field and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Enable Production Tracking?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to enable Production Tracking.
data.body:
Enabling Production Tracking is simple, this article will walk you through the steps on how to do this!

Production Tracking allows you to track production rates for each job. This tool helps you keep a close eye on your estimated vs your actual production. Production rates will be updated each day by using the Production Tracking form.

Required

In order to enable Production Tracking, you must have Super Admin access.

Information

After enabling Production Tracking, you must add production tasks in order to start utilizing this feature. Please refer to the article below to learn how to add tasks!
​

How Do I Add/Edit Tasks For Production Tracking?


Here are the steps to enable Production Tracking:

  1. On your left main menu, click Company.

  2. Scroll down to the bottom, select Enable Production Tracking and click Save.

  3. Now you can start to add tasks and view Production Tracking on your project dashboard!

data.title: How Do I Use The Date Picker Data Object?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Date Picker data object within FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The Date Picker data object is an easy tool to use that allows you to pick a custom date within a form, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to use this!

Required

In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled.

Here are the steps to use the Date Picker data object:

  1. Drag and drop the Date Picker data object to the desired spot in the center of your screen.

  2. Once it's dropped, the DATE PICKER SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and click Save:

    • Date Picker Name - This is the title of the date picker. Enter a name in the text field.

    • Default current time - With this setting selected, the date will default to today's current date.
    ​
    • Adjust form date - With this setting selected, the "Form Date" will automatically update to the date that is entered within the Date Picker.


    • Show time - With this setting selected, the date picker will also allow you to choose the time of day.


    • Required - Select this setting to make the Date Picker a required entry in order to close the form.
    ​
    • INFO POPUP - Enter information/description in the text field and select the active Radio button. This will make an "i" icon appear and if a user hovers over this, they will see the information that was entered.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the the following options:
    ​
    • Blue pdf square - When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.
    ​

data.title: How Do I Use The PDF Table Data Object?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the PDF Table Data Object within FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The PDF Table data object is a great tool to use to generate your own PDF Table with custom rows, this article will guide you through the steps on how to use this!

Required

In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled.

Information

The PDF Table has many use cases. Here's an example of how the format will look within the form and when the form is exported to a PDF.
​
​Form Example:

PDF Example:

Here are the steps to use the PDF Table data object:

  1. Drag and drop the PDF Table data object to the desired area in the center of your screen.

  2. Once it's dropped, the PDF TABLE SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and click Save:


    • Table Name - This is the label for the PDF Table. Enter a name in the text field.
    ​
    • + Add Column - Click this button to add each new column.
    ​
    • Vertically / Horizontally - Select one of these two options to format your PDF Table. This depicts if the PDF table is displayed vertical or horizontal.
    ​
    ​• Name - Enter a name in the text field for each column.

  3. Choose one of the following options from the Select Column Type drop-down. This will be what this column is used for:
    ​
    • Row Numbering
    • Dropdown
    • Text Field
    ​• Text Input
    • Number Field
    • Date Picker
    • Time Picker
    • Person Selector
    • Inventory Lookup Field
    • Calculation Field
    • Image Uploader
    • Signature
    • Position
    • Phase
    ​
    ​Note : For more in-depth training on how to use the PDF Table or any data object, please feel free to contact support@fieldflo.com to set up a training!

  4. Once all columns and settings are configured, click Save and you have the following options:
    ​
    • Blue pdf square - When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.
    ​
    • Settings Gear Icon - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​
    • Trash can icon - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Question/Mass Group Radio Buttons Data Object?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to use the Question / Mass Group Radio Buttons data object in FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The Question / Mass Group Radio Buttons data object is a great way to create a multiple choice question with plenty of answer choices, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled.

Here are the steps to use the Question / Mass Group Radio Buttons data object:

  1. Drag and drop the Question / Mass Group Radio Buttons data object to the center of your screen.

  2. Once it's dropped, the QUESTION / MASS GROUP RADIO SETTINGS will appear. Configure the following settings and click Save:
    ​
    • Question - Enter your question in the text field.
    ​
    • Required - Select/Unselect this radio button. If it's selected, this question will be required to answer in order to close the form.


    • Radio Button Names - Click + Radio Button for each answer option. Enter each answer in the text field.
    ​
    • Email Alert - Select/Unselect this Radio button for each answer. If this is selected, an email notification will be sent each time this option is selected.
    ​
    • INFO POPUP - Enter information/description in the text field and select the active Radio button. This will make an "i" icon appear and if a user hovers over this, they will see the information that was entered.

  3. If an Email Alert option is selected, you can choose who receives the alert by entering any of the following options and click Save:
    ​
    • Email Template - Select an option from this drop-down to choose the format of the email alert.
    ​
    • Email Group - If Email Groups are configured, you can select a group from this drop-down and whoever is within the group will receive the email alert.
    ​
    • Key Project Personnel - You can select Project Manager, Supervisor, or Assigned Employees. This will send the email alert to those employees if they are entered in the project's details.
    ​
    • Admins - Select the Super Admin radio button and this will send the email alert to all Super Admins.
    ​
    • Others - You can enter a specific email in this text box, the email alerts will be sent to this email. To add more specific emails, click the blue + button.

  4. Once you click Save, you have the the following options:
    ​
    • Blue pdf square - When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.
    ​
    • Settings Gear Icon - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​
    • Trash can icon - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Use The Timesheet Employee Pin Populate Data Object?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to use the Timesheet Employee Pin Populate data object in FieldFlō's form builder module.
data.body:
The Timesheet Employee Pin Populate data object is an easy way to capture signatures from every employee on a project's timesheet, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled.

Information

When this data object is used, it will automatically populate this form with every employee listed on the project's timesheet. You will also have the option to add additional employees.


Here are the steps to use the Timesheet Employee Pin Populate data object:

  1. Drag and drop the Timesheet Employee Pin Populate data object to the center of your screen.

  2. Once it's dropped, the TIMESHEET EMPLOYEE POPULATE SETTINGS will appear. Once all the following settings are configured, click Save:
    ​
    • Employee Block Name - Enter a title in the text field to label this data object.
    ​
    • Required - Select/Unselect this Radio button. If it's selected, this data object will be required to complete in order to close the form on a project.
    ​
    • Enter Pin - Select/Unselect this Radio button. If it's selected, each employee will be able to enter their pin number to verify.
    ​
    • SMS Verify - Select/Unselect this Radio button. If it's selected, you will be able to send a verification text to each employee.
    ​
    • Anyone with Role `Can validate anything with PIN` - Select/Unselect this Radio button. If it's selected, anyone with the "Can validate anything with PIN" role will be able to enter their pin verification for other employees.
    ​
    • Project Supervisor - Select/Unselect this Radio button. If it's selected, the Supervisor on this project will be able to enter their pin verification for other employees.
    ​
    • Tag Employee/Form to the employees details - Select/Unselect this Radio button. If it's selected, each time an employee is entered in this data object it will be logged within the employees profile under the "Employee Form Tagging" tab.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the the following options:
    ​
    • Blue pdf square - When shaded blue, the entire data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.
    ​
    • Settings Gear Icon - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​
    • Trash can icon - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Can I Track Prevailing Wage On A Timesheet?
data.description: This article will show you how to track prevailing wage on a timesheet.
data.body:
Tracking prevailing wage on a timesheet is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order enable the setting to track prevailing wage on a timesheet, you must have Super Admin access.

Here are the steps to track prevailing wage on a timesheet:

  1. On your left main menu, click on the Company module.

  2. Scroll down to the Timesheet settings and select the Radio button next to Enable Prevailing Wage on Timesheet and click Save.
    ​

  3. Now to enable prevailing wage tracking on a projects timesheet, on your left main menu, click Projects.

  4. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  5. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  6. Click Project Details.

  7. Scroll down and click the Payroll Information tab.

  8. Click Is this Job a Prevailing Wage Job drop-down and select Yes, then click Save.

  9. Now you are able to select an employees Prevailing Wage on this projects timesheet!

data.body:

  1. Drag and drop the Attendance data object to the center of your screen.

    ​
    • Auto fill from Project Details - Select/Unselect this Radio button. If it's selected, the Supervisor, Project Manager, and Foreman from Project Details will automatically be included.
    ​
    • Include subcontractors in FieldFlo - Select/Unselect this Radio button. It it's selected, the drop-down will include subcontractors to choose from.
    ​
    • Require signature - Select/Unselect this Radio button. If it's selected, each employee can enter their written signature.

    • INFO POPUP - Enter information or description in the text field and select the active Radio button. This will make an "i" icon appear and if a user hovers over this, they will see the information that was entered.

    • Trash can icon - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Use Form Builder's Address Lookup Group Data Object?
data.description: This article will show you how to use the Address Lookup Group data object in FieldFlō's Form Builder module.
data.body:
The Address Lookup Group Data object is a great tool for logging an address within a form, this article will show you the exact steps on how to add this to a custom built form!

Required

In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled.

Information

When the Address Lookup Group data object is included in a built form, it enables users to search for and select an address. This feature is powered by Google to provide accurate address lookup results.


Here are the steps to use the Address Lookup Group data object:

  1. Drag and drop the Address Lookup Group to the center of your screen.

  2. Once it's dropped, the Address Lookup Settings will appear. Select/Unselect the Radio buttons next to each option for it to be included in the form and click Save:
    ​
    • Cross Street
    ​• City
    • State
    • ZIP Code
    • County / Parish
    • Enable Map Picker - If Enabled is selected, this will allow the address to be picked by selecting an exact location on a map.

  3. Once you click Save, you have the the following options:
    ​
    • Blue pdf square - When shaded blue, the entire Address Lookup Group data object will be included in the PDF version of the form. If it's not shaded, the data object will be excluded from the PDF.
    ​
    • Settings Gear Icon - Click this icon to edit this data object's settings.
    ​
    • Trash can icon - Click this icon to delete the data object.

data.title: How Do I Use Form Builder?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to use the Form Builder module.
data.body:
FieldFlō's Form Builder is a great way to build custom forms for employees to complete, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to use the Form Builder module, you must have the Access Form Builder role enabled.

Information

Form Builder allows you to drag and drop data objects from the right-hand side of the screen into the center. Each time you drop a data object, you are adding it to the form, customizing the data that will be displayed, and configuring the specific settings for that object. This process helps you build and tailor your form according to your needs.

Here are the steps to use Form Builder:

  1. On the left main menu, click Admin then click Form Builder.

  2. You can click an existing form from the list to edit it, OR create a new form by clicking + Add New Form.

  3. On the top, you have the following fields to complete:

  • Form Name

  • Form Layout

    • Single Page - Will only include one section (page).

    • Multi Page - Can add multiple sections (pages).

  • Status

    • Inactive - Will not be available to add to projects.

    • Active - Can add to projects after enabling it in Global Form Settings or Project Form Settings.

4. If multiple sections are being created, you can name each section by clicking the Pencil icon and add sections by clicking + Add Section.
​
​Note: The Pencil Icon will appear once you hover over the section name on the left hand side.

5. Once your form is built, you have additional options. Click the 3 Dots, then click Form Settings. You will have the following settings to configure and click Save:

  • PDF Header

    • Active - Will display a general header on top of the PDF.

    • Inactive - Will not display any header on top of the PDF.

  • Allow Multiple

    • Active - Will allow multiple of these forms to be open on a project at once.

    • Inactive - Will not allow multiple of these forms to be open on a project at once.

  • Company Address on PDF

    • Show - Will show your company's address on the PDF version.

    • Hide - WiIl not show your company's address on the PDF version.

  • Element Spacing on PDF

    • Normal - PDF will display normal spacing between data objects.

    • Reduced - PDF will have data objects appear closer together.
      ​

  • Image Display Options on PDF

    • Full Page - On the PDF version, each image will be displayed on a separate page for maximum visibility.

    • Condensed - On the PDF version, each image is 1/3 of the pages height.

    • Grid - On the PDF version, Images will be displayed in rows of 2. Each row is 1/4 of the pages height

  • Same As Previous

    • Enabled - Allows you to copy information entered from the previous day.

    • Disabled - Will not allow you to copy information entered from a previous day.

  • ​PDF orientation

    • Portrait - When the form is exported to a PDF, it will display vertically.

    • Landscape - When the form is exported to a PDF, it will display horizontally.

6. Once all data objects are added and all correct settings are applied, click the blue Save Form button on the top right.

Information

For information on how to utilize this form on your projects, you can refer to the article below!

How Do I Add A Form I Built To My Project?


​


​


​

data.title: How Do I Complete A Daily Field Report
data.description: This article show you how to complete a Daily Field Report form on a project.
data.body:
Completing a Daily Field Report form is a great way to capture details about the work that was preformed on a project, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!
​

Required

In order to complete the Daily Field Report, you must have the following roles enabled:
• View All Projects or View Assigned Projects

• Add/Edit Open Forms


Here are the steps to complete a Daily Field Report:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, scroll down and click + Add Form.

  5. Use the Filter Forms search bar on the top to search for the form, or you can scroll to find your form. Once you locate the form, click on the Radio button next to the Daily Field Report and click Save.

  6. Click anywhere on the Daily Field Report to open it up.

  7. Complete the General Information section by clicking the following drop-downs and select an option:
    ​
    • Supervisor - Shows the supervisor that is within Project Details, you can select a different supervisor from this drop-down if needed.
    • Project Manager - Shows the project manager that is within Project Details, you can select a different project manager from this drop-down if needed.
    • Date - Shows todays date, you can click the drop-down and select a new date if needed.

  8. (Optional) Complete the Scope of Work section by clicking the following drop-downs and select an option:
    ​
    • Scope Received
    • Scope Date
    • Structure

  9. Enter the required Work Completed Today field.

  10. (Optional) Answer the following End of Shift Review questions:
    ​
    • What went right?
    • What can be improved?

  11. Click the Yes or No radio buttons under Incident, Near Miss, and Stop Work.
    ​
    ​Note: If Yes is clicked, select the type of Incident, Near Miss, or Stop Work from the drop-down and describe what happened in the text field below.

  12. (Optional) Answer the following fields:
    ​
    • Goals for Tomorrow
    • Goals for the Week

    • Action Required
