    • Project Notes or Special Considerations
    • Meeting Log
    • Visitors
    • Workflow
    • Bulk Equipment in use this Day

  13. (Optional) If ACM is handled, enter an option from the following drop-downs:
    ​
    • Detected
    • Date Tested
    • Survey Date

  14. (Optional) If Lead is handled, enter an option from the Detected and Date Tested drop-downs.

  15. (Optional) If Mold is handled, complete the following fields:
    ​
    • Detected
    • Date Tested
    • Notes related to Environmental testing
    • Estimated Completion Date
    • Days Remaining on Project (Including Demobilization)

  16. (Optional) Complete the RRP and/or Abatement Procedures section by selecting the Radio button next to each task that applies to todays work.

  17. (Optional) Enter the following information for each field:
    ​
    • Work Area Locations
    • # of cleaning cloths utilized
    • What cleaning verification did you pass on?

  18. (Optional) You can also attach images by clicking Choose File.

  19. Lastly, click Save.

data.title: (IOS App ONLY) How Do I Complete A Daily Timesheet
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to complete a timesheet on the FieldFlo IOS app.
data.body:
Completing a timesheet on FieldFlō's IOS app is simple, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Here are the steps to complete a timesheet on FieldFlō's app:

  1. Once your app opens, you can search for your project using the search field on top. Or you can scroll to find your project, once you've found the project click on the Project Name to open it up.

  2. Click Start Day on the bottom right of the screen.

  3. Click anywhere on the Daily Timesheet to open it up.

  4. Select the Foreman/ Superintendent Signature, select the name then click the Add employee icon.

  5. Once the Supervisor has been added, click the Add employee button on the bottom right of your screen.

  6. Click all the Employees that need to be added to the timesheet and click Save.

  7. Click the Select All button on top of the employee list and select the Start icon.

  8. The time has started if the Clock next to the Employee's name turns green and the word TRACKING appears.

  9. To stop time at the end of the day, click the Select All button and select the Stop icon on the bottom of the screen.

  10. Enter the following information:


    • Did they take a break?
    • Verify if the above information is correct
    • Enter your Pin
    • Submit

  11. Now the time has been stopped.

    Each individual employee completes the following fields by selecting Verify next to their names:


    • Select Yes or No for each question

    • Verify if the above information is correct
    • Enter your Pin
    • Submit

  12. Everyone on the timesheet should have the Verified check mark next to their name.

  13. To Close and Submit the Timesheet, click Back.

  14. Select the End Day at the bottom of the screen.

  15. Click Yes on the End Day? question to Submit your Timesheet.

16. Verify that all forms are closed.

data.title: How Do I Choose Skills For An Employee And What Is The Purpose
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to choose skills for an employee and will explain what this can be used for.
data.body:
FieldFlo makes it easy to choose specific skills for an employee, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to choose skills for an employee, you must have the Edit Employee role enabled.

Information

• Choosing skills for an employee allows you to keep track of which tasks an employee is capable of completing. You can completely customize these skills to the specific type of work your company preforms.
​Ex: Demolition Supervisor, Demolition Burner, Abatement Laborer, CDL Driver, ect.
​
• This will also allow you to apply filters to your employee list to see which employees have certain skills.

Here are the steps to associate skills with an employee:

  1. On your left main menu, click Employees.

  2. Once you're in the employe module, you can find the employee you need by typing their name in the search bar or filter your options by the Status dropdown. If you would like additional filtering options click the blue + Filter button.

  3. Once you find the employee you need, click anywhere on the Employee name to open up their profile.

  4. Under the Employee Details tab, scroll down to the Skills section and select the Radio button next to each skill that this employee is associated to.

  5. Lastly, scroll down and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Change The Timezone For My Company
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to change the timezone for your company's portal.
data.body:
FieldFlō makes it simple to change the timezone for your company, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to change your company's timezone, you must have Super Admin access.

Information

All times that show in this portal will follow the timezone that is selected in the Company module.


Here are the steps to change the timezone for your company:

  1. On your left main menu, click Company.

  2. Scroll down to the Time Zone drop-down and select your timezone.

  3. Once a timezone is selected, scroll down and click Save.

data.title: How Do Email Project And Company Documents
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to email project and company documents.
data.body:
FieldFlō allows you to email documents straight from your portal, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to email documents from FieldFlō, you must have the following roles enabled:
• View All Projects or View Assigned Projects
• Edit/Delete/Share Link

Here are the steps to email project and company documents:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, click the 3 Dots then click Documents.

  5. Click the 3 Dots next to the document that you need to send and click Email. You can email company documents by clicking the Company Documents folder and follow these same steps.

  6. (Optional) You can email multiple documents at once by selecting the Radio buttons next to each document, click the 3 Dots on the top right of all the documents and click Email.

  7. Once you get to the File Sharing pop-out, you can select an Email Group from the drop-down and/or enter a specific email in the Add Email box.
    ​
    ​Note: You can add more emails by clicking the + blue button

  8. Lastly click the Template drop-down, select a template and click Send.


​

Information

You can also email company documents from the Company module. This is faster if you're looking to send only company documents.

Required

In order to email documents from the company module, you must have Super Admin access

Here are the steps to send a company document from the company module:

  1. On your left main menu, click Company.

  2. Select the 3 dots and click Company Documents.

  3. Select the 3 Dots next to the document that you need to email and click Email.

  4. (Optional) You can email multiple documents at once by selecting the Radio buttons next to each document, click the 3 Dots on the top right of all the documents and click Email.

  5. Once you get to the File Sharing pop-out, you can select an Email Group from the drop-down and/or enter a specific email in the Add Email box.
    ​
    ​Note: You can add more emails by clicking the + blue button

  6. Lastly click the Template drop-down, select a template and click Send.

data.title: How Can I Assign A Default Position To An Employee
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to assign a default Position to an employee.
data.body:
Assigning a default Position to an employee is easy with FieldFlō, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to assign a default Position to an employee, you must have the following roles enabled:
• View Employees
• Edit Employee

Information

Setting a default Position for an employee is a great time saver. This allows the supervisor to add the employee to the Daily Timesheet without having to select their Position each time.


Here are the steps to assign a default Position:

  1. On your left main menu, click Employees.

  2. Once you're in the employe module, you can find the employee you need by typing their name in the search bar or filter your options by the Status dropdown. If you would like additional filtering options click the blue + Filter button.

  3. Once you find the employee you need, click anywhere on the Employee name to open up their profile.

  4. Under the Employee Details tab, scroll down and select a Position from the Position drop-down.

  5. Lastly, scroll down and click Save.

data.title: How Can I See A List Of All Super Admin Employees
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how you can see which employees have Super Admin access.
data.body:
Viewing a list of all Super Admins on your portal is simple with FieldFlō, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this!
​

Required

In order to see all Super Admin employees, you must have the View Employees role enabled.


Here are the steps to see a list of all Super Admin Employees:

  1. On your left main menu, click Employees.

  2. Click the blue + Filter button.

  3. Click the Type drop-down and select Super Admin.

    Note: You can see a list of different types of employees by selecting one of the following options:
    • Can Login
    • Employee User
    • Temp

  4. Now your employee list will show all Super Admin employees!

data.title: How Do I Complete A T&M Form
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to complete a T&M form on a project.
data.body:
Completing a T&M form is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!
​

Required

In order to complete a T&M form, you must have the following roles enabled:
• View All Projects or View Assigned Projects
• Add/Edit Open Forms


Here are the steps to complete a T&M form:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, scroll down and click + Add Form.

  5. You can use the Filter Forms search bar on the top to search, or you can scroll to find your form. Once you locate the form, click on the Radio button next to the T&M form and click Save.

  6. Click anywhere on the T&M Form to open it up.

  7. First click the Supervisor drop-down and select the project supervisor, then click + New Day and select a date from the calendar.
    ​​
    Note:
    • The "Date Created" drop-down will show todays date, you can always change this date by clicking the Drop-down and select a new date.
    • You can select the ARCHIVE button to copy from a previous T&M form
    • You can select the COST button to see previous T&M forms and the costs.

  8. Click the + Time button for each employee that you need to log time for.
    ​
    ​Note:
    • Before selecting + Time, you can click the New drop-down and select a date to copy the time entered from a previous T&M form.
    • Before selecting + Time, you can click the New drop-down and choose Pull From Timesheet to copy the time from this projects timesheet.
    • If the options above are selected, click + Time and this will enter the copied data.

  9. Now you can enter or change the following employee information:


    • Employee
    • Position
    • Time - Amount of hours
    • Hourly Cost
    • Description of Work
    • Employee Notes

  10. Click the + Material button for each piece of material.
    ​
    ​Note:
    • Before selecting     + Material, you can click the New drop-down and choose a date to copy the material entered from a previous T&M form. If this option is selected, click + Material and this will enter the copied data.

  11. Now you can enter or change the following material information:
    ​
    • Item Name/No
    • Qty
    • Item Cost
    • Comments

  12. You can enter Notes or add Images.

  13. Lastly, enter the following information and click Save:
    ​
    • Approved By
    • Signature - This signature is for whoever is approving this T&M form.
    ​
    ​Note: You can add more approvers and signatures by clicking + Signature.

data.title: How Do I Add A Client To My Project
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add a client to your project.
data.body:
Adding a client to your project is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add a client to your project, you must have the Edit/Delete Project role enabled.


Here are the steps to add a client to your project:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, click Project Details.

  5. Click the Project Details tab and choose your client from the Client drop-down.

  6. Once you select a client, scroll down and click Save.

  7. Now the client you've added will appear on the Project Dashboard and will be included in this projects closeout report!

data.title: How Do I Complete A Disciplinary Action Form
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add and complete a Disciplinary Action form on a project.
data.body:
FieldFlō's Disciplinary Action form is an easy way to log and keep track of employee compliance, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to complete this form!

Required

In order to complete a Disciplinary Action form, you must have the following roles enabled:
• View All Projects or View Assigned Projects
• Add/Edit Open Forms


Here are the steps to complete a Disciplinary Action form:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, scroll down and click + Add Form.

  5. You can use the Filter Forms search bar on the top to search for the form, or you can scroll to find your form. Once you locate the form, click on the Radio button next to the Disciplinary Action form and click Save.

  6. Click anywhere on your Form to open it up.

  7. Once your form opens, choose an option from the following drop-downs:


    • Supervisor
    • Date - This will show todays date. If this needs to be changed, you can click the drop-down and select the new date.
    • Employee - This is the employee that's receiving the disciplinary action.
    • Incident Type

  8. Enter the Description of Incident and Corrective Plan/Action.

  9. Under the Acknowledge By section, enter the following mandatory fields:


    • Supervisor and their Signature
    • Employee Signature
    • Witness and their Signature

  10. (Optional) You can also attach Images of the Incident.

  11. Lastly, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Complete A PSI/JHA/SPA Form
data.description: This article will show you how to complete the PSI/JHA/SPA form.
data.body:
FieldFlō's PSI/JHA/SPA form is a great way to acknowledge project site safety. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to complete this form!

Required


​In order to complete a PSI/JHA/SPA form, you must have the following roles enabled:
​• View All Projects or View Assigned Projects
• Add/Edit Open Forms

Here is a quick training video on how to complete a PSI/JHA/SPA form:
​


Here are the steps to complete a PSI/JHA/SPA form:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, scroll down and click + Add Form.

  5. You can use the Filter Forms search bar on the top to search for the form, or you can scroll to find your form. Once you locate the form, click on the Radio button next to the PSI/JHA/SPA and click Save.

  6. Click anywhere on your Form to open it up.

  7. Within the first General Information tab, the following fields are required:


    • Task Location
    ​• Muster / Meeting Point
    • Supervisor - Chose the supervisors name from the drop-down and enter their by clicking the ENTER PIN button.

  8. (Optional) Click on the Nearest Hospital tab and enter the following information:


    • Name

    • Address
    • City
    • State
    • ZIP Code
    • Phone Number

  9. (Optional) Click on the Review tab and select the Radio buttons next to each hazard that you will encounter during todays work.

  10. (Optional) Click on the Evacuation Plan tab to enter any Notes or attach any Images.

  11. Click on the Task Steps / Hazard & Control / Risk tab. Click the + Add Task button and chose all of the tasks that apply to todays work. You can also click the + Add Custom button to add any additional tasks.
    ​

    Note: If + Add Custom is selected, enter the Task Steps, Hazard, Control, and Risk Rating within the empty boxes.

  12. Click on the Weather Questions tab and check the Yes or No Radio buttons next to the following required questions:
    ​
    • I have reviewed the weather conditions with the crew?
    • I have reviewed the road conditions with the crew?
    • I have reviewed the OSHA Heat Index?

  13. Click on the Signatures tab. Click + Add Employee for each employee on the project, then chose each name from the Drop-downs and click Save & Close.

  14. Now click back into the PSI/JHA/SPA and within the Signatures tab, click Select All / Deselect All.

  15. Once all employees are selected, click the SMS Phone Icon to send a verification text to each employee. You can also click Enter Pin to manually verify.

  16. (Optional) Click the Other tab and select the Adequate or Inadequate radio buttons for each statement.

  17. Lastly, click Save & Close.

data.title: How Do I Run A Basic Plus (Payroll) Report And What Does It Include?
data.description: This article will cover how to run a Basic Plus (Payroll) Report and will explain the different data points that it includes.
data.body:
FieldFlō's Basic Plus Report is an easy way to view payroll data, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to run the Basic Plus Report, you must have Super Admin access.


Here are the steps to run a Basic Plus (Payroll) Report:

  1. On your left main menu, click Payroll.

  2. The payroll menu will appear, click Payroll Exports.

  3. Enter the following mandatory fields that are marked with a red * :


    • Type - Basic Plus Report

    • Date From - Enter the date that you need this report to begin from.

  4. Select the Radio Button next to each project you need to include in the report.

    Note: You can filter your options by the following:

    • Status

      • All, Active Only, Closed Only, or On Hold Only

    • Client

    • Project Type

  5. Once you have your projects selected, select the Radio Button next to the Employees that you need included. Select/Unselect the Include Deleted Employees radio button, if selected the report will include deleted employees.

    Note: You can filter your employee options by All, Regular, and Temp employees.

  6. Once you have your desired projects and employees selected, click the blue Run Report button on the top right of your screen.

  7. The Generating Report pop-out will appear click either Return to Export Page or Leave and be Notified, whichever you prefer.

  8. Once the report opens up, the first Project Hours tab will show the following data:
    • Project Name
    • Project Manager
    • Sum of Regular Hours - Shows all hours worked on the project within that week.
    • Total Employees - Shows the total amount of employees that worked on the project within that week.

  9. (Optional) If you click the Hours Worked tab, it will show the following data:
    • Employee Name
    • Regular Hours - Shows all non OT hours that were worked on the project within that week.

    • OT Hours - Shows how many OT hours that were worked on the project within that week.
    • Total Hours - Shows how many hours in total (OT and Regular) that were worked on the project within that week.

  10. (Optional) If you click the By Employee tab, it will show the following data:

    • Date Worked - Shows the exact day that the employee has hours for.
    • Project Number
    • Project Name
    • Project Manager
    • Project Type
    • Cost Code - This is the Cost Code to the Position that the employee clocked in with.
    ​• Cost Code Description - This is the Position name that the employee clocked in with.
    • Prevailing Wage Code - If Prevailing Wage was used, this is the code to the Prevailing Wage that the employee clocked in with.
    • Prevailing Wage Name - This is the name of the specific Prevailing Wage that the employee clocked in with.
    ​• Prevailing Wage Base Rate - This is the Base Rate of the Prevailing Wage that the employee clocked in with.
    • Prevailing Wage Fringe Rate - This is the Fringe Rate of the Prevailing Wage that the employee clocked in with.
    • Employee Number
    • Employee Full Name - Shows employees first and last name.
    • Regular Hours - Shows all non OT hours that were worked on the project within that week.
    • Per Diem - If Per Diem is owed to this employee, it will display "Per Diem". If no Per Diem is owed to the employee, this box will be blank.
    • Per Diem Status - Shows Approved, Pending, or will be blank depending on if Per Diem was approved for this employee.
    • Timesheet Note - If the supervisor had left a note on the timesheet, those notes will appear here.
    • Employee Note - If the employee had left a note on their verification text, those notes will appear here.


​
​

data.title: How Do I Run A Master Extended (Payroll) Report And What Does It Include
data.description: This article will show you how to run a Master Extended Report and will explain the different data points that this report shows.
data.body:
FieldFlō's Master Extended (Payroll) Report is a great report to use to view payroll information, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to run this report!

Required

In order to run a Master Extended Report, you must have Super Admin access.

Here are the steps on how to run a Master Extended (Payroll) Report:

  1. On your left main menu, click Payroll.

  2. The payroll menu will appear, click Payroll Exports.

  3. Enter the following mandatory fields that are marked with a red * :


    • Type - Master Extended Report

    • Date From - Enter the date that you need this report to start at.

    • Date To - Enter the date that you need this report to end at.

  4. Select the Radio Button next to each project you need to include in the report.

    Note: You can filter your options by the following:

    • Status

      • All, Active Only, Closed Only, or On Hold Only

    • Client

    • Project Type

  5. Once you have your projects selected, select the Radio Button next to the Employees that you need included. Select/Unselect the Include Deleted Employees radio button, if selected the report will include deleted employees.

    Note: You can filter your employee options by All, Regular, and Temp employees.

  6. Once you have your desired projects and employees selected, click the blue Run Report button on the top right of your screen.

  7. The Generating Report pop-out will appear click either Return to Export Page or Leave and be Notified, whichever you prefer.

  8. Once the Master Extended Report opens up the first Details tab will give the following data:
    ​
    • Date - Exact day that the employee worked.

    • Employee - First and Last name of the employee who had hours within the timeframe.

    • Employee ID - The employee's ID that had hours within the timeframe.

    • Union Code ID - If an employee has a Union Code/ID entered within their profile, that code will show in this column.

    • Foreman / Superintendent - Shows the Foreman / Superintendent on this project.

    • Project Number - Project's Number that the employee had worked on.

    • Project Name - Name of the project that the employee had worked on.

    • Night Shift - This will display Yes or No depending on if this project was worked throughout the night.

    • Shift Length - This will display how long the shift was in hours.

    • Certified Payroll - Will display Yes or No depending on if this project used Certified Payroll.

    • Employee Note - If the employee had left a note on their verification text, those notes will appear here.
    • Timesheet Note - If the supervisor had left a note on the timesheet, those notes will appear here.

    • Injured - This will display Yes or No depending on if the employee or supervisor has marked them as injured when verifying their day.
    ​• Injured Verified By - Shows who verified the day in which the employee was injured.
    • Injured Verified Date/Time - Shows the date and exact time that this injury was verified at.
    • Regulated Break - Depending on if a break was taken, this will show Yes or No
    • Regulated Break Verified By - Shows who verified the employees Injury status.
    • Regulated Break Verified Date/Time - Shows the date and exact time that the injury status was verified.

    • Billable - Depending on if Billable is selected on the Timesheet, this will show Yes or No.

    • Position - Position that the employee was clocked in with.

    • Prevailing Wage Code - Shows the Prevailing Wage code for the type of Prevailing wage that the employee had clocked in with.

    • Prevailing Wage Name - Shows the Prevailing Wage name that the employee had clocked in with.

    • Prevailing Wage Base Rate - Shows the Base Rate of the Prevailing Wage that the employee had clocked in with.

    • Prevailing Wage Fringe Rate - Shows the Fringe Rate of the Prevailing Wage that the employee had clocked in with.
    • Phase Code - Shows the Phase Code to the Phase that was selected on the timesheet for this employee.
    • Phase - Shows the Phase name that was selected on the timesheet for this employee.
    • Total Hours - Total hours that this employee has worked on this project within the timeframe that was selected.

    • Total Hours (digits) - Shows Total Hours but in decimal form.
    • Check-in Time - If an employee checks in with the text message feature, this will show the exact date and time of the employees check in.
    • Start Time - Shows the start date and exact start time of this timesheet.
    • End Time - Shows the end date and exact end time of this timesheet.
    • Break Time - Shows the amount of time that the employees break was.
    • Time Verified By - Shows who verified the employees time.
    • Per Diem Type - Shows if it's Daily or Hourly Per Diem

    • Per Diem Amount - Shows the exact dollar amount of Per Diem owed within that timeframe.
    • Per Diem Cash Given - If per diem was given in cash and the amount was logged on the timesheet, that dollar amount will appear here.
    • Change Log - Shows Yes or No depending on if their time was edited.
    • Inserted via Adjuster - Shows Yes or No depending on if their time was entered/changed with the Timesheet Adjuster
    • Last Change Time Action By - If time was changed, this will show the last person who changed the time.
    • Original Start Date - If time was changed, this will show the original start date and start time before the changes were made.
    • Original End Date - If time was changed, this will show the original end date and end time before the changes were made.


    ​

  9. (Optional) Clicking the By Project tab will give the following data:
    ​

    • Employee - First and Last name of the employee who had hours within the timeframe.
    • Project Number - Project's Number that the employee had worked on.
    • Project Name - Name of the project that the employee had worked on.
    • Total Hours - Total hours that this employee has worked on this project within the timeframe that was selected.

    • Total Hours (digits) - Shows Total Hours but in decimal form.

  10. (Optional) Clicking the By Employee tab will give the following data:
    ​
    • Employee - First and Last name of the employee who had hours within the timeframe.
    • Total Hours - Total hours that this employee has worked on this project within the timeframe that was selected.

    • Total Hours (digits) - Shows Total Hours but in decimal form.

  11. (Optional) Clicking the Not Booked Employees tab will show all employees who don't have time worked within the timeframe that was selected. This will include the Employee Name and Employee ID.

data.title: How Do I Run A Basic (Payroll) Report And What Does It Include?
data.description: This article will show you how to run a Basic (Payroll) Report and will explain exactly what information will be included.
data.body:
Running FieldFlō's Basic Report is a great way to view payroll information, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to run a Basic Report, you must have Super Admin access.


Here are the steps to run a Basic (Payroll) Report:

  1. On your left main menu, click Payroll.

  2. The payroll menu will appear, click Payroll Exports.

  3. Enter the following mandatory fields that are marked with a red * :


    • Type - Basic Report

    • Date From - Enter the date that you need this report to start at.

    • Date To - Enter the date that you need this report to end at.

  4. Select the Radio Button next to each project you need to include in the report.

    Note: You can filter your options by the following:

    • Status

      • All, Active Only, Closed Only, or On Hold Only

    • Client

    • Project Type

  5. Once you have your projects selected, select the Radio Button next to the Employees that you need included. Select/Unselect the Include Deleted Employees radio button, if selected the report will include deleted employees.

    Note: You can filter your employee options by All, Regular, and Temp employees.

  6. Once you have your desired projects and employees selected, click the blue Run Report button on the top right of your screen.

  7. The Generating Report pop-out will appear click either Return to Export Page or Leave and be Notified, whichever you prefer.

  8. Once your report opens up the first Details tab will give the following data:

    • Date - Exact day that the employee worked.

    • Employee - First and Last name of the employee who had hours within the timeframe.

    • Employee ID - The employee's ID that had hours within the timeframe.

    • Project Number - Project's Number that the employee had worked on.

    • Project Name - Name of the project that the employee had worked on.

    • Certified Payroll - Will say Yes or No if this project required Certified Payroll.

    • Position - Position that the employee was clocked in with.

    • Prevailing Wage Code - If Prevailing Wage was used, this is the Prevailing Wage code for the type of Prevailing wage that the employee had clocked in with.

    • Prevailing Wage Name - This is the Prevailing Wage name that the employee had clocked in with.

    • Prevailing Wage Base Rate - This is the Base Rate of the Prevailing Wage that the employee had clocked in with.

    • Prevailing Wage Fringe Rate - This is the Fringe Rate of the Prevailing Wage that the employee had clocked in with.

    • Employee Note - If the employee had left a note on their verification text, those notes will appear here.
    • Timesheet Note - If the supervisor had left a note on the timesheet, those notes will appear here.
    • Total Hours - These are the total hours that this employee has worked on this project within the timeframe that was selected.

    • Total Hours (digits) - This is the same amount as the Total Hours but in digits.

  9. (Optional) Clicking the By Project tab will show the following data:

    • Employee - First and Last name of the employee who had hours within the timeframe.

    • Project Number - Project's Number that the employee had worked on.

    • Project Name - Name of the project that the employee had worked on.
    • Total Hours - These are the total hours that this employee has worked on this project within the timeframe.

    • Total Hours (digits) - This is the same amount as the Total Hours but in digits.

  10. (Optional) Clicking the By Employee tab will show the following data:

    • Employee ID - The employee's ID that had hours for that date.

    • Employee - First and Last name of the employee who had hours within the timeframe.

    • Total Hours - These are the total hours that this employee has worked on this project within the timeframe.

    • Total Hours (digits) - This is the same amount as the Total Hours but in digits.

  11. (Optional) Clicking the Project Summary tab will show the following data:
    ​
    • Job Number - Project number that these hours were worked on.
    • Job Name - Name of the Project that these hours were worked on.
    • Project Manager - Project Manager of this job
    ​• First Timesheet Date - This is the date of the first timesheet that was submitted within this timeframe.
    • Last Timesheet Date - This is the date of the last timesheet that was submitted within this timeframe.
    ​• Actual Labor Hours - The total amount of hours this employee worked within the timeframe that was selected.

data.title: How Do I Set Project To Be A Prevailing Wage Project?
data.description: This article will show you how to set a project as a prevailing wage project.
data.body:
Some projects require prevailing wage, and FieldFlō makes tracking those projects easy! This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to set a project as a prevailing wage project.

Required

In order to indicate a prevailing wage project, you must have the Edit/Delete Projects role enabled.


Here are the steps to set project as a prevailing wage project:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Click Project Details.

  5. Scroll down and click the Payroll Information tab.

  6. Click Is this Job a Prevailing Wage Job drop-down and select Yes, then click Save.

Check out the following articles for more information on using FieldFlō's Prevailing Wage feature!

How Do I Add Prevailing Wage / CP Classification Types
How Do I Add Prevailing Wage / CP Classification Groups
How Do I Limit Prevailing Wages To Choose From On A Timesheet

data.title: How Can I View Specific Forms Used In The Last 60 Days?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how you can see any specific  forms used within the last 60 days.
data.body:
Viewing any form that has been used in the last 60 days is simple in FieldFlō. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!


Here are the steps to view forms completed in the last 60 days:

  1. On your left main menu, click Dashboard.

  2. Once you're in the Dashboard, click the Projects tab.

  3. Scroll down until you see the Forms widget.

  4. Select the Settings gear on the top right of the widget.

  5. The Forms Filter selections will appear:
    ​

    • Available Forms - Allows you to pick specific forms that you want to see.

    • Intervals - Allows you to narrow down your search results by time frame of Last 7 days, Last Month, Last 3 Months, or Last 6 Months.

    • Form Status - Allows you to filter for Open or Closed forms.

    • Project Status - Allows you to see forms from Active or Closed projects.

  6. Once you have selected your desired filters, click Apply.

  7. The widget will refresh and will show you all of the forms based on your filtering.

    Note: You can click on the blue text of any form to be taken directly to the form.

data.title: How Can I Be Notified When An Injury Form Is Created
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to be notified when an injury form is created.
data.body:
Setting up notifications for when an injury form is created is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Information

When this setting is enabled, you will receive an email at 7:05 a.m. and 7:05 p.m. letting you know of any Injury forms that have been created.

Here are the steps to be notified when an injury form is created:

  1. On your top right menu, click the Gear icon.

  2. Under Daily notifications, select the Radio button next to Injury form created.

  3. After the selection is made, click Save.

data.title: How Can I Be Notified When Projects Are Nearing The End Date
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to be notified when projects are nearing the end date.
data.body:
Setting up notifications for when projects are nearing the end date is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Information

When this setting is enabled, you will receive an email at 7:05 a.m. and 7:05 p.m. letting you know of any project end dates that end within the next 5 days.

Here are the steps to be notified when projects are nearing the end date:

  1. On your top right menu, click the Gear icon.

  2. Under Daily notifications, select the Radio button next to Project nearing end date.

  3. After the selection is made, click Save.

data.title: How Can I Be Notified Of Changes To Job Costing Estimates
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to be notified when a change is made to Job Costing Estimates.
data.body:
Setting up notifications for when there are changes to Job Costing Estimates is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Information

When this notification is selected, you will receive an email notification at 7:05 a.m. and 7:05 p.m. letting you know of any changes within projects Job Costing Estimates that have happened within 24 hours.

Here are the steps to be notified of changes to Job Costing Estimates:

  1. On your top right menu, click the Gear icon.

  2. Under Daily notifications, select the Radio button next to Job Costing Estimate Changes.

  3. After the selection is made, click Save.

data.title: How Can I Be Instantly Notified When A New Employee Is Hired
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to be instantly notified when a new employee is hired.
data.body:
Setting up an instant notification for when a new employee is hired is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Information

When enabling this notification, you will immediately receive a notification when a new employee is added to FieldFlō.

Here are the steps to be instantly notified when a new employee is hired:

  1. On your top right menu, click the Gear icon.

  2. Scroll down to Instant notifications, select the Radio button next to New Employee Hired.

  3. After the selection is made, click Save.

data.title: How Can I Be Notified When A Role Is Changed
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to receive notifications when a role is changed within an employees profile.
data.body:
Setting up notifications for when a role is changed is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Information

Enabling this setting will allow you to receive a notification at 7:05 a.m. or 7:05 p.m. letting you know if any roles have been changed.

Here are the steps to be notified when a role is changed:

  1. On your top right menu, click the Gear icon.

  2. Under Daily notifications, select the Radio button next to Roles have been Changed.

  3. After the selection is made, click Save.

data.title: How Can I Be Notified When A Form Isn't Closed
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to be notified when a form isn't closed.
data.body:
Setting up notifications for forms not being closed is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Information

If a form isn't closed and this notification is selected, you will receive an email after 12 hours of that form being open. You will receive a notification twice a day until this form is closed, once at 7:05 a.m. and 7:05 p.m.


Here are the steps to be notified when a form isn't closed:

  1. On your top right menu, click the Gear icon.

  2. Under Daily notifications, select the Radio button next to Form not closed.

  3. After the selection is made, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add A Prospect Client To A Lead
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add a prospect client to your lead.
data.body:
Adding a prospect client to a lead is simple with FieldFlō, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add prospect clients to a lead, you must have the following roles enabled:

  • View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads

  • Can Add Leads

  • Can Delete Leads


Here are the steps to add a prospect client to a lead:

  1. On your left main menu, click CRM then click Leads.

  2. You can scroll to find your Lead, use the search bar, or click + Filter for more filtering options.

  3. Once you've found your Lead, click on the Lead to open it up.

  4. Once your lead opens up, click the Choose Clients tab.

  5. Click Add Prospect Client.

  6. Select the Radio button next to Pull From Existing Client or Create New:

    • Pull From Existing Client - If selected, use the Filter Clients search bar and type in at least the first 3 letters of the client name. Click the Select Clients Please drop-down and select the needed client, then click Save.

    • Create New - If selected, enter the following mandatory fields and any additional information, then click Save.

      • Client Name

      • Address

      • City

      • State

      • Zip

      • Contact Name

  7. Now the client you selected will be added and available to setup a reach out!

data.title: How Can I Be Instantly Notified When A Training Is Failed
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to set up instant notifications for when an employee fails a training.
data.body:
Setting up notifications for failed trainings is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Information

​After selecting the "Training Failed" notification, you will get an email immediately letting you know which training was failed, which employee, and their correct answers percentage.

Here are the steps to be instantly notified when a training is failed:

  1. On your top right menu, click the Gear icon.

  2. Scroll down to Instant notifications, select the Radio button next to Training Failed.

  3. After the selection is made, click Save.

data.title: How Can I Select A Position For All Employees At Once On A Timesheet
data.description: This article will show you how you can easily select one position for all employees at once on a timesheet.
data.body:
Selecting a position to be assigned to all employees at once on a timesheet is easy with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to fill out a Daily Timesheet, you must have the Add/Edit Open Forms enabled.

Here are the steps to select a position for all employees at once on a timesheet:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Scroll down and click + Add Form.

  5. Use the search field or scroll to select the Radio Button next to the Daily Timesheet, then click Save.

  6. Click the Daily Timesheet to open up the form.

  7. Select the Foreman/Superintendent Signature drop-down and select the foreman's name, then click Add to Timesheet.

  8. Click the + Employee button.

  9. Select the Radio button next to each employee you need to add to the timesheet, then click Add.

  10. Once all employees are added, click the Radio button on the top left of all the employees.

  11. Once all employees are selected, click the Person/Pencil icon on the bottom left.

  12. Select the Position drop-down and click the position needed for all employees, then click Submit.

  13. Now the position you selected will be entered for all employees!

data.title: How Do I See All Hours Ever Worked For An Employee(s)
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to run a report to see all hours worked on all projects for any employee.
data.body:
Running a report to see total hours worked by any amount of employees is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to see all hours worked for any employee, you must have Super Admin access.


Here are the steps to see all hours ever worked for an employee(s):

  1. On your left main menu, click Payroll then click Payroll Exports.

  2. First click the Type dropdown and chose the Basic Report or Master Extended Report , then select the Date From and Date To fields to select the timeframe that these employee(s) have been with your company for.

  3. Select the All Projects radio button.

  4. Select the Radio Button next to the Employee(s) that you need included. Select/Unselect the Include Deleted Employees radio button, if selected the report will include deleted employees.

    Note: You can filter your employee options by All, Regular, and Temp employees.

  5. click the blue Run Report button on the top right of your screen.

  6. The Generating Report pop-out will appear click either Return to Export Page or Leave and be Notified, whichever you prefer.

  7. You can click the By Employee tab on the bottom right, this will total up all hours for each employee.

data.title: How Do I Limit The Prevailing Wages  Types Available To Choose On A Timesheet?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to limit prevailing wage types to choose from on a project's timesheet.
data.body:
Limiting Prevailing Wage Types on a Project will help your employees select the correct Prevailing Wage Type on their projects. This article will show you the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

"Enable Prevailing Wage on Timesheet" setting under Company Module must be turned on in order to track Prevailing Wage Types on your Timesheets.

Prevailing Wage Types must be set-up in Portal Admins to use this feature.

In order to limit the Prevailing Wage Types available on a project's timesheet, you must have the Edit/Delete Projects permission.

Here are the steps to limit the Prevailing Wage Type selections on a timesheet:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, click Project Details.

  5. Click the Timesheet/Prevailing Wage tab.

  6. Select the Radio buttons next to each needed Prevailing Wage, or you can select a Prevailing Wage Group from the Drop-down.

  7. Once all needed options are selected, click Save.

  8. Now what you've selected will be the only Prevailing Wages to choose from within this project's timesheet!

data.title: How Do I Remove "Trainings Needed" From An Employees Profile
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to remove "Trainings Needed" from an employees profile.
data.body:
Removing needed trainings from an employees profile is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to remove needed trainings from an employees profile, you must have the Edit Trainings role enabled.

Here are the steps on how to remove "Trainings Needed" from an employees profile:

  1. On your left main menu, click Certification then click Trainings.

  2. Navigate to the specific training that you're looking for, you can use the Search tool to easily find your training.

  3. Once you've found the training, click the 3 Dots next to the training name then click Enroll/Enrolled.

  4. Select the Radio button next to the needed employee(s), then click Remove Employee

  5. The PLEASE CONFIRM pop-up will appear, click Yes.

  6. Now this training will be removed from the "Trainings Needed" tab in the employees profile and their QR code.

data.title: How Do I Export Job Costing Estimates
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to export a projects job costing estimates
data.body:
Exporting a projects job costing estimates is simple with FieldFlō, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to export job costing estimates, you must have Super Admin access.

Here are the steps to export job costing estimates:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, click the 3 Dots then click Export Job Costing Estimates.

data.title: How Do I Merge A Lead With An Existing Project
data.description: This article will show you how to merge a lead with an existing project.
data.body:
Merging a lead with a project is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to merge a lead with a project you must have these following roles enabled:

  • View All Projects or View Assigned Projects

  • Add Projects

  • View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads

  • Can Add Leads

Here are the steps to merge a lead with an existing project:

  1. On your left main menu, click CRM then click Leads.

  2. You can scroll to find your Lead, use the search bar, or click + Filter for more filtering options.

  3. Once you've found your Lead, click on the Lead to open it up.

  4. Once your lead opens up, click the Award & Create Project tab.

  5. Make sure the Award Radio button is selected and click Save.

  6. Select Create Project.

  7. Select the Merge with existing project Radio button and select the project from the Select Project drop-down.

  8. Select one of the Radio buttons under each of these fields.

    Note: These selections will determine what information will be on this newly merged project, you can select either the leads data or the projects data.

  9. Once all selections are complete, click Submit.

  10. Now this lead is merged with this project, you can jump straight to this project by clicking this Project link!

data.title: How Do I Use The Gantt Chart
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to use the Gantt Chart.
data.body:
Using FieldFlō's Gantt Chart is simple, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to use the Gantt Chart, you must have the Scheduling Reports role enabled.

Information

FieldFlō's Gantt Chart is used for viewing all scheduled projects. This will give you a weekly calendar view for each project, showing employees and assets that are scheduled for each job.

Here are the steps to use the Gantt Chart:

  1. On your left main menu, click Scheduling then click Gantt Chart.

  2. Click the Week drop-down and select which week you need to view.

  3. (Optional) Select the Radio button next to Scheduled Projects Only to include only scheduled projects. If you want to include projects that aren't scheduled, make this Radio button unchecked.

  4. (Optional) Select the Show crew names Radio button to include all scheduled employee names. If you don't want to include employee names, make this Radio button unchecked.

  5. When all required fields are entered, click Run Report.

  6. (Optional) Once the Gantt Chart opens, you can use the Blue Arrows to toggle from one week to another. You also have the Filter drop-down where you can choose which projects you would like to view.

  7. (Optional) You can also click the 3 Dots then Export PDF to export this Gantt Chart.

data.title: How Do I Run A Schedule Report
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to run a schedule report.
data.body:
Running a schedule report is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to run a schedule report, you must have the Scheduling Reports role enabled.

Here are the steps to run a schedule report:

  1. On your left main menu, click Scheduling then click Reports.

  2. Click the Report drop-down and choose the following scheduling report types:

    • Project Schedules - This will group the report by project.

    • Employee Schedules - This will group the report by employee.

    • Asset Schedules - This will group the report by asset.

    • Daily Scheduling Report - This will group the schedule by a single day

  3. Select the Week drop-down and select the week this report is for.
    ​

    Note: If Daily Scheduling Report is selected, choose a date from the Date drop-down and choose an option from the Type drop-down.

  4. Once all required fields are entered, click Run Report.

  5. You can now view this report. If you need to export this report, click Generate Report.

data.title: How Do I Limit Positions To Choose From On A Timesheet
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how you can limit positions to choose from within a projects timesheet.
data.body:
Limiting the different positions to choose from within a timesheet is easy with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Here are the steps to limit positions to choose from on the timesheet:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, click Project Details.

  5. Click the Timesheet/Positions tab.

  6. (Optional) You can click the "Select a position group to filter on timesheet" drop-down and select a Position Group.

    Note: Selecting a position group will make only positions within that group to be available on the timesheet.

  7. (Optional) Select the Radio buttons next to each individual position that you need to be available on the timesheet.

    Note: Each position you select will be the only available positions to choose from when entering a position on this projects timesheet.

  8. After selecting all needed positions, scroll down and click Save.

  9. Now all positions that were selected will be the only positions available on the timesheet.

data.title: How Can I Be Instantly Notified Of An Employee Clocking In Outside Of A Geo Fence
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to be instantly notified when an employee clocks in outside of the geo fence.
data.body:
Setting up notifications for when employees clock in outside of the project area is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

Geo Tagging and Geo Fencing must be turned on within project details in order to receive these notifications


Here are the steps to be instantly notified of an employee clocking in outside of the geo fence:

  1. On your top right menu, click the Gear icon.

  2. Scroll down to Instant notifications, select the Radio button next to Check in Outside of Project Area.

  3. After the selection is made, click Save.

data.title: How Can I Be Instantly Notified Of A Warehouse Request
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to be instantly notified when a warehouse request is submitted.
data.body:
Setting up an instant notification for warehouse requests is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Here are the steps to be instantly notified of a warehouse request:

  1. On your top right menu, click the Gear icon.

  2. Scroll down to Instant notifications, select the Radio button next to Warehouse Requests.

  3. After the selection is made, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Translate A Form To English
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to translate a form that was filled out in another language, back to English.
data.body:
Translating a form back to English is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Here are the steps to translate a form back to English:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Scroll down and click the Radio button next to the form(s) that you need to translate.

  5. Click the 3 dots on the top right of the forms, then click Translate to English.

data.title: How Do I Archive / Unarchive A Certificate
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to archive and unarchive a certificate.
data.body:
Archiving and unarchiving a certificate is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to archive or unarchive certificates, you must have the Edit Certs role enabled.

Here are the steps on how to archive/unarchive a certificate:

  1. On your left main menu, click Certification then click Certificates.

  2. Select the Radio button next to the certificates you need to archive/unarchive.

  3. Click the 3 dots on the top right of all the certificates, then click either Archive or Unarchive.

  4. The PLEASE CONFIRM pop-up will appear, click Yes.

data.title: How Do I Order Inventory To A Project
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of how to order inventory to your project.
data.body:
Ordering items from the warehouse is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to fill out a warehouse request form, you must have the Add/Edit Open Forms role enabled.

Here are the steps to order inventory to a project:

  1. On the left side main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your Project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Click on your Project.

  4. Scroll down and click the blue + Add Form button.

  5. Find the Warehouse Request Form and select the Radio button next to the form.

  6. Once you have the form selected, click Save.

  7. Click on the Warehouse Request Form.

  8. Click on the Request Type dropdown and select Order, then click Next.

  9. Select Request By Name and select your name, then enter the Pin to verify.

  10. Enter the Date Requested By.

    Note- This is the day you want the items delivered by.

  11. Click + Item.

  12. Enter the Item Name and any other details you need.

  13. To add more items, click the + Item for each item.

  14. Once you have all your items added and are ready to submit, select Submit Request.

    Note- If you would like to come back to this Form and submit it later, you can select Save & Close.


​

data.title: How Do I Remove A Lead
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to remove a lead.
data.body:
Removing a lead is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through step by step on how to do this!

Required

In order to remove a lead, you must have the Can Delete Leads role enabled.

Here are the steps on how to remove a lead:

  1. On your left main menu, click CRM then click Leads.

  2. You can scroll to find your Lead, use the search bar, or click + Filter for more filtering options.

  3. Click on the 3 Dots next to the lead, then click Remove.

data.title: How Do I Change The Confidence Level For A Lead
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to change the confidence level for a lead.
data.body:
Changing a confidence level for a lead is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to change a lead's confidence level, you must have the View All Leads or View Assigned Leads, and Can Add Leads roles enabled.

Information

The confidence level for a lead is depicting how confident you are that this project will be awarded, this confidence will display on your list of all the leads.

Here are the steps to change the confidence level for a lead:

  1. On your left main menu, click CRM then click Leads.

  2. You can scroll to find your Lead, use the search bar, or click + Filter for more filtering options.

  3. Once you've found your Lead, click on the Lead to open it up.

  4. Once you're in the Lead, click Job Walk.

  5. Click the Confidence drop-down and choose either High, Medium, or Low.

  6. Once the change is made, click Save or Save & Close.

data.title: How Do I Add Assigned Personnel To A Lead
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add assigned personnel to a lead.
data.body:
Adding assigned personnel to a lead is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add assigned personnel to a lead, you must have the View All Leads and Can Delete Leads roles enabled.

Here are the steps to add assigned personnel to a lead:

  1. On your left main menu, click CRM then click Leads.

  2. You can scroll to find your Lead, use the search bar, or click + Filter for more filtering options.

  3. Once you've found your Lead, click on the Lead to open it up.

  4. Once you're in the Lead, click Assigned Personnel.

  5. Click + Add Employee for each employee that you need to make assigned personnel.

  6. Click the Drop-down and select an employee from the list.

  7. Once all needed employees are added, click Save or Save & Close.

data.title: How Do I Show Employee Names In The Scheduling Text
data.description: This article will walk you through how to show employee names in the scheduling text.
data.body:
Showing employee names in the scheduling text is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to make changes to scheduling settings, you must have the Full Scheduling Access role enabled.

Here are the steps to show employee names in the scheduling text:

  1. On your left main menu, click Scheduling then click Settings.

  2. Under Scheduling Options, select/unselect the Radio button next to Send crew names in dispatch in scheduling.

    Note: Select this option if you want all employee names to be included in the schedule text. Unselect this option if you don't want the text to show all employee names.

  3. Once this selection is made, make sure to click Save on the bottom right of your screen.

data.title: How Can I Be Instantly Notified When A New Project Is Created
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of how to set up an instant notification for when a new project is created.
data.body:
Setting up a notification for when new projects are added is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Information

After selecting the "New Project Created" instant notification, you will receive an email as soon as a project is created.

Here are the steps to be instantly notified when a new project is created:

  1. On your top right menu, click the Gear icon.

  2. Scroll down to Instant notifications, select the Radio button next to New Project Created.

  3. After the selection is made, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add Types Of Damage For The Vehicle Accident Form
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add types of damage for the vehicle accident form.
data.body:
Adding types of damage is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add types of damage, you must have Super Admin access.

Information

Adding this type of damage will populate the "Type of Damage" drop-down within the Vehicle Accident Form, under the Accident / Incident Information section.

Here are the steps to add types of damage for the vehicle accident form:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin.

  2. The admin dropdown will appear, click Portal Admins.

  3. Scroll down to the Safety section, click TYPES OF DAMAGE.

  4. Click + Add New.

  5. Select the Active radio button, enter the mandatory Name, then choose the priority.

  6. Once all needed fields are entered, click Save.

  7. Now your Type of Damage is available to select within the Vehicle accident form!


​

data.title: How Do I Use The Certificate Maker
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to use the certificate maker.
data.body:
Using FieldFlō's certificate maker is simple, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to utilize the certificate maker, you just have the Edit Certs role enabled.

Here are the steps on how to use the certificate maker:

  1. On your left main menu, click Certification then click Certificate Maker.

  2. Complete each of the following mandatory fields, marked with a red * :

    • Destination - This is where the certificate will appear after generation.

    • Certificate Name - Choose the certificate name that you need generated.

    • Training Name - Enter the training name that is associated with this certificate.

    • Valid From - Choose the start date of this certificate.

    • Expire - Choose the date of expiration for this certificate, if no expiration is needed click the No Expiration Date radio button.

    • Certificate Author - Choose who is creating this certificate and enter the pin verification.

    • Signature - Whoever is creating this certificate has to enter their signature, this will display on the certificate image.

  3. Select the Radio buttons next to each employee that needs this certificate.

    Note: You can search for employees using the Name search field, you can also narrow down your options by choosing a Status to filter by.

  4. Once all needed employees are selected, on the top right of your screen click Generate Certificates.

data.title: How Do I Add/Edit Warehouse Request Templates
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add and edit  warehouse request templates
data.body:
Adding and editing warehouse request templates is simple with FieldFlō, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add and edit warehouse request templates, you must have Super Admin access.

Information

Request templates are used for requesting items fast, you can add items to the template that are commonly ordered for that certain type of project.
​
​When a project needs an initial inventory order, you can simply choose a template that will add needed inventory items to that order. You can always add or remove certain items per order if needed.

Here are the steps to add a warehouse request template:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin then click Portal Admins.

  2. Scroll down to inventory and click Request Template.

  3. Click + Add Request Template.

  4. Enter the mandatory Name for this template.

  5. Enter each Item, the Quantity, and any comments that may be needed for that item.

  6. To add more items, click add new item.

  7. Once all items are added, click Save.

Here are the steps to edit an existing warehouse request template:

  1. Click the 3 dots next to the needed template, then click Edit.

  2. The Edit Request Template pop-out will appear, you can edit any information in these fields.

  3. Once all changes are made, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Access The Email Log And What Is It Used For
data.description: Article will walk you through how to access the email log and explains what this is used for.
data.body:
Viewing the email log is simple with FieldFlō, this article will explain exactly what the email log is and how to access it!

Information

The email log will display a list of all emails that have been sent from your FieldFlō portal.

Required

In order to view the email log, you must be a Super Admin user.

Here are the steps to access the email log:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin then click Email Log.

  2. Now you can see the list of all emails that have been sent from your FieldFlō portal!

    Note: This log is organized by date, the top of the list is the most recent email that was sent.

data.title: How Do I Use Form Sequencer And What Is It Used For
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of how to use form sequencer and explains what it is used for.
data.body:
Using form sequencer to organize your forms is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through how to use this and what it is used for!

Information

The form sequencer module is used to organize the list of your forms to choose from when adding forms to a project, this is for visual preference.

Required

In order to organize forms with form sequencer, you must have the Edit Form Sequencer role enabled.

Here are the steps to use the form sequencer:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin then click Form Sequencer.

  2. (Optional) You can use the Filter Form Sequencer field to narrow down which forms you're trying to find, forms that match the search you entered will turn grey so that you can easily locate them.

  3. Now you're able to click and drag each Form into the correct order.

    Note: The exact order that these forms are in will directly affect to the order of forms when you click + Add Form within a project.

  4. Now when adding forms to a project, the list of forms is organized the same way as the form sequencer.

data.title: How Can I Be Notified When An Employee Exceeds Daily Overtime
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to be notified when an employee exceeds daily overtime.
data.body:
Setting up notifications for when an employee exceeds overtime is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order for these notifications to be in effect, you must set up the "Daily Overtime Notification Trigger When Exceeds" setting in within your project.
​
1. Once you navigate to your project, click on Project Details.

2. Click the Settings tab, then choose an hours option from the Daily Overtime Notification Trigger When Exceeds drop-down and click Save.

Here are the steps to be instantly notified when an employee exceeds daily overtime:

  1. On your top right menu, click the Gear icon.

  2. Scroll down to Instant notifications, select the Radio button next to Daily Set Overtime Exceeded.

  3. After the selection is made, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Enter An Hourly Rate For A Position
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how you can enter hourly rates for a position.
data.body:
Entering or changing an hourly rate for a position is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to enter an hourly rate for a position, you must have the Edit Employees role enabled.

Here are the steps to enter an hourly rate for a position:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin then click Portal Admins.

  2. Scroll down to the employee section, then click Positions.

  3. Find your specific position by scrolling, use the Search field, or filter by Status.

  4. Once you find the position, Click on it to open up the details.

  5. Enter the rate under the Burden Hourly Rate.

  6. Lastly, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Run A Per Diem Report
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to run a per diem report.
data.body:
Running a per diem report is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to run a per diem report, you must have the Per Diem Report role enabled.

Here are the steps to run a per diem report:

  1. On the top right of your screen, click the Reporting Center icon.

  2. Once your Reporting Center opens up, click Per Diem Report.

  3. Select the Date From drop-down and enter the week you're running this report for, then click Generate.

data.title: How Do I Update A Lead's Actual Contract Value
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to update a lead's contract value.
data.body:
Updating a lead's contract value is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to update a lead's contract value, you must have the View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads and the Can Add Leads roles enabled.


Here are the steps to update a lead's contract value:

  1. On your left main menu, click CRM then click Leads.

  2. You can scroll to find your Lead, use the search bar, or click + Filter for more filtering options.

  3. Once you've found your Lead, click on the Lead to open it up.

  4. Once you're in the Lead, click Job Walk.

  5. Click into the Actual Contract Value text field and enter the value.

  6. Scroll down and click Save or Save & Close.

data.title: How Can I Be Instantly Notified Of A Disciplinary Action
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to be instantly notified when a disciplinary action occurs.
data.body:
Setting up disciplinary action notifications is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Information

When an instant notification is selected, as soon a disciplinary action occurs FieldFlō will send you an email.

Here are the steps to be instantly notified of a disciplinary action:

  1. On your top right menu, click the Gear icon.

  2. Scroll down to Instant notifications, select the Radio button next to Disciplinary Actions.

  3. After the selection is made, click Save.

data.title: How Can I Be Instantly Notified Of An Incident
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of setting up notifications to be instantly notified when an incident occurs.
data.body:
Setting up incident notifications is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Information

When this instant notification is selected FieldFlō will send you an email as soon as an Incident, Injury, Near Miss, or Stop Work occurs.

Here are the steps to set up incident notifications:

  1. On your top right menu, click the Gear icon.

  2. Scroll down to Instant notifications, select the Radio button next to Incidents.

  3. After the selection is made, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Fill Out A Waste Load Out Form
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to fill out a waste load out form.
data.body:
Completing a waste load out form is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to fill out a waste load out form, you must have the View All Projects or View Assigned Projects, and Add/Edit Open Forms roles enabled.

Here are the steps to complete a waste load out form:

  1. One the left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you have found the project, click on the Project.

  4. Scroll down and click + Add Form.

  5. Find the Waste Load Out Form and select the Radio Button to the left of the form.

  6. Scroll to the bottom and click Save.

  7. Click on the Waste Load Out Form.

  8. Select the Creation Date drop-down to enter the date, then click the Supervisor drop-down and select the supervisor.

  9. Click the + New Load button. This will add Load 1 to your form.

  10. Under each load you have added, there will be an information section. Enter as much information as you can about each load in the provided fields.

  11. You can add a picture of the manifest by clicking on the Choose File button.

  12. Click the Save All button.

  13. If you have multiple loads, you can click+ New Load or you can make a copy of the load you just created, update the necessary information and add new manifest pictures to each copy. To copy a load, go to the Create Multiple Copies of this load dropdown and select # of loads you wish to create.

  14. Once you have finished creating all of your loads, click the Save All button.


​

data.title: How Do I Set Required Certificates For A Project
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to set up required certificates for a project.
data.body:
