Setting up required certificates for a project is simple with FieldFlō, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to set up required certificates for a project, you must have the "Edit / Delete Projects" role enabled.

Here are the steps to set up required certificates for a project:

  1. One the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click the Projects module.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you have found the project click on the Project.

  4. Once your project dashboard appears, click Project Details.

  5. Select the Certificate/License tab.

  6. Select the Radio Buttons next to each certificate that you need to require. You can filter these certificate options by the Cert Source drop-down, and utilizing the Search Certificates field.

  7. Once all required certificates are selected, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Change An Archived Lead To Active
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to change an archived lead back to active.
data.body:
Changing a lead from archived to active is simple with FieldFlo, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to change an an archived lead to active, you must have the View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads and the Can Add Leads roles enabled.

Here are the steps to change an archived lead to active:

  1. On your left main menu, click CRM then click Leads.

  2. You can scroll to find your Lead, use the search bar, or click + Filter for more filtering options.

  3. Once you've found your Lead, click on the Lead to open it up.

  4. Once you're in the Lead, click General Info.

  5. Scroll down and click the Lead Status drop-down and select Active.

  6. Lastly, click Save or Save & Close

data.title: How Do I Add More Options To The Types Of Respirators In The Respirator Fit Test Form
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add types of respirators to choose from when completing a respirator fit test form.
data.body:
Adding different types of respirators is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add types of respirators, you must have the Add Item role enabled.

Information

Within the Respirator Fit Test form, the "Type of Respirator" drop-down will give options of inventory items that fall within the "Respirator" asset class.
​
Changing the asset class of an inventory item to "Respirator" will make that item appear in this drop-down.

Here are the steps to add types of respirators to the respirator fit test:

  1. On your left main menu, click on Inventory.

  2. Search for that item in the Search bar or scroll to find the item.

  3. Once you find the item, click on it to open up the details.

  4. Click the Asset Class drop-down and select Respirators.

  5. Click Save.

  6. Now in your Respirator Fit Test, the Type of Respirator drop-down will have your new option to choose from!

data.title: How Do I Complete A Respirator Fit Test
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to fill out a respirator fit test form.
data.body:
Completing a respirator fit test is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to complete a Respirator Fit Test, you must have the View All Projects or View Assigned Projects role enabled and the Add/Edit Open Forms role enabled.

Here are the steps to complete a respirator fit test:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Scroll down and click + Add Form.

  5. Use the search field or scroll to select the Radio Button next to the Respirator Fit Test, then click Save.

  6. Click on the Respirator Fit Test form.

  7. Once you're in the form, select an option from the following drop-downs:

    • Supervisor

    • Test Date - Will auto populate the current date. If a different date is needed, you can select this drop-down and choose the new date.

    • Employee - This is the employee who is receiving the test.

    • Type of Respirator

    • Size

  8. As you go through testing, select the Radio Buttons for Pass, Fail, or NA next to each type of test.

  9. (Optional) You can enter any additional comments or even attach files to this form.

  10. Click the Preformed By drop-down and choose who preformed this test, then enter the Signature and the Date.

  11. Have the employee enter their Signature, then double check the Date drop-down.

  12. Lastly, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add A New Certificate
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add a new certificate.
data.body:
Adding a new certificate is simple with FieldFlō, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add a new certificate, you must have the Edit Certs role enabled.

Here are the steps on how to add a new certificate:

  1. On your left main menu click Certification, then click Certificates.

  2. Your certification module will open up, click + Add Certificate.

  3. The add certificate pop-out will appear, enter the following mandatory fields that are marked with a red * :

    • Certificate Name

    • Valid From

    • Expiration Date (If no expiration date is needed, select the No Expiration Date radio button)

    • Employee

    • Certificate Document

  4. Once all mandatory fields are entered, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Build And Email A Proposal?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to create and email a proposal with FieldFlō.
data.body:
Creating proposals and sending proposal emails is easy with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to build and email Proposals, you must have the following roles enabled:
​
​• View All Leads or View Only Assigned Leads
• Can Add Leads

Here are the steps to create a proposal:

  1. On your left main menu click CRM, then click Leads.

  2. You can scroll to find your Lead, use the search bar, or click + Filter for more filtering options.

  3. Click on the Lead to open it up.

  4. Once you're in the Lead, click Proposals.

  5. If there are no proposals listed, click the Add Proposal blue button.

  6. The Add Proposal pop-out will appear, select the Proposal For and Create New radio button.

  7. Click Save.

  8. Once your proposal opens, you're able to drag and drop each data object to the center of the proposal to start building. For detailed instructions on how to use each data object, you can click the following articles:
    ​

    How Do I Use The Title & Breakline Data Objects While Building Proposals?

    How Do I Use The Paragraph Data Object While Building Proposals?

    How Do I Use The Paragraph Advanced Data Object While Building Proposals?

    How Do I Use The Graphic Data Object While Building Proposals?

    How Do I Use The Insert PDF Data Object While Building Proposals?

    How Do I Use The Signature Data Object While Building Proposals?

    How Do I Use The Bid - Line Item Data Object While Building Proposals?

    How Do I Use The Project Details Read Only Data Object While Building Proposals?

Here are the steps on how to email a proposal:

  1. Once you've found your Lead, click on the Lead to open it up.

  2. Once you're in the Lead, click Proposals.

  3. Once you have your proposal added, click the 3 dots next to the proposal then click Email Proposal.

  4. The Send Proposal pop-out will appear, enter/choose the following fields:

    • (Optional) Email Group

    • Add Email - Selecting individual emails that will receive the proposal.

    • Template

  5. Lastly, click Send.

data.title: How Do I Send A Text To Employees To Verify Their Work Week
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to send a weekly verification text to employees to confirm the weeks working hours.
data.body:
Sending a weekly verification text to employees is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to send a weekly verification text with the Payroll Approval module, you must have the Can Approve Payroll / Send SMS role enabled.

Here are the steps on how to send a weekly total verification text:

  1. On your left main menu, click Payroll then Payroll Approval.

  2. First click the Date From field and select your payroll week.

  3. (Optional Filtering) Next select the Verify Status drop-down and select one of the following options:

    • All

    • SMS Sent

    • Verified

    • Conflicted

  4. (Optional Filtering) Select the Projects Assigned To drop-down and select All or select a specific employee.

  5. (Optional Filtering) Click the Project Type drop-down and select All or select a project type to filter this report.

  6. Lastly, click Generate.

  7. To select all employees on this weeks payroll, click the Radio Button above the employee list.

  8. To select specific employees, click the Radio Button next to the employee name.

  9. After you've made your employee selections, click Send Very SMS to deploy the text message.

  10. The SEND TEXT MESSAGE pop-up will appear, click Yes.

data.title: How Do I Run An Inspection Report
data.description: This article will walk you through how to run an inspection report.
data.body:
Running an inspection report is simple with FieldFlō, this article will guide you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to run an Inspection report, you must have the Inspection Report role enabled.

Here are the steps to run an inspection report:

  1. On the top right of your screen, click the Reporting Center icon.

  2. Once your Reporting Center opens up, click Inspection Report.

  3. Select the Report Type drop-down and select a report type.

  4. Select the Radio Buttons next to one of these options to chose your time period for this report.

    Note: If Custom Range is selected, enter the Date From and Date To fields to depict your custom timeframe.

  5. Click the Inspection Type drop-down and select an Inspection type.

  6. Select which projects you would like included in this report, select the Radio Button next to All Projects or Customize.

    Note: If Customize is selected, click the Radio Button next to the Projects you need to include.

  7. Lastly, click Generate Report.

data.title: How Do I Run An Injury Report
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how run an Injury report.
data.body:
Running and injury report is simple with FieldFlō, this article will show the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to run an injury report, you must have the Injury Report role enabled.

Here are the steps on how to run an injury report:

  1. On the top right of your screen, click the Reporting Center icon.

  2. Once your Reporting Center opens up, click Injury Report.

  3. Select the Radio Buttons next to one of the options to chose your Time Period for this report.

    Note: If Custom Range is selected, enter the Date From and Date To fields to depict your custom timeframe.

  4. Select which Body Part you would like to include by selecting the Radio Button next to one of these options.

    Note: If Customize is selected, chose which Body Parts to include by selecting the Radio Button next to the needed Body Parts

  5. Select the Radio Button next to which Projects you need to include.

    Note: If Customize is selected, select the Radio buttons next to each Project you need included.

  6. Select the Radio Button next to which Employees you need to include.

    Note: If Customize is selected, select the Radio buttons next to each Employee you need included.

  7. Lastly, click Generate Report.

data.title: How Do I Change The Foreman On A Project
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to change the foreman on a project.
data.body:
Changing the foreman on a project is very simple with FieldFlō, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to change the foreman on a project, you must have the Edit/Delete Projects Role enabled.

Here are the steps on how to change the foreman on a project:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, click Project Details.

  5. Click the General Info tab.

  6. Click the Foreman drop-down and select your new Foreman.

  7. Once you've made all needed changes, scroll down and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add Assigned Personnel To A Project
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add assigned personnel to a project.
data.body:
Adding assigned personnel to a project is easy with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add assigned personnel to a project, you must have the Edit / Delete Project role enabled.

Here are the steps to add assigned personnel to a project:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

data.title: How Do I Add / Edit Haul Estimates On A Project?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add / edit hauler estimates in your projects job costing.
data.body:
Adding / editing haul estimates on a project is easy with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add and edit haul estimates to your project, you must have the Job Costing Estimate and Can View Contract Values Dashboard roles enabled in your employee profile.

Information

• After Haul Estimates are added, the actual costs of haulers for each project will be updated using our Waste Load Out form.


• You can view Haul Estimates compared to the Haul Actual cost by clicking Export Job Costing Estimates within a project.


Here are the steps to add haul estimates to a project:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project, or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Your project dashboard will open up. Next to Job Costing, click View Details.

  5. To add a new estimate, scroll down to the Haul Estimates and click + Haul Estimate.

  6. The Haul Estimate pop-up will appear, fill out all of the mandatory fields which are marked with a red *, and click Save.

Here are the steps to edit an existing haul estimate:

  1. Under Haul Estimates, click the Pencil icon next to the needed estimate.

  2. The Haul Estimate pop-up will appear, here is where you can make any changes to this estimate and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add And Edit  Waste / Scrap Estimates To A Project?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add and edit waste / scrap estimates to your projects job costing.
data.body:
Adding and editing estimates for waste / scrap is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add and edit waste / scrap estimates to your project, you must have the Job Costing Estimate and Can View Contract Values Dashboard roles enabled in your employee profile.

Information

  • After Waste/Scrap Estimates are entered, the actual cost of Wast/Scrap will be updated using the Waste Load Out form.

  • You can see the Waste/Scrap Estimates compared to the Waste/Scrap Actual cost by clicking Export Job Costing Estimates within a project.


Here are the steps to add and edit waste / scrap estimates to your project:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project, or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Your project dashboard will open up. Next to Job Costing, click View Details.

  5. To add a new estimate, scroll down to the Waste / Scrap Estimates and click + Waste / Scrap Estimate.

  6. The Waste / Scrap Estimate pop-up will appear, please enter the following mandatory fields marked with a red * :

    • Phase

    • Material

    • Qty per Load

    • Type

    • Loads

  7. Once you've entered all of these fields, click Save.

Here are the steps to edit an existing waste / scrap estimate:

  1. Under Waste / Scrap Estimates, click the Pencil icon next to the needed estimate.

  2. The Waste / Scrap Estimate pop-out will appear, here is where you can make edits to this estimate.

  3. Once you've made changes to this estimate, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Download A PDF Of My Forms
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of downloading a PDF version of your forms.
data.body:
Downloading a PDF version of your forms is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Here are the steps to download a PDF form:

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  4. To download one form at a time, select the PDF icon next to the form you would like to download.

Here are the steps to download a PDF of multiple forms at once:

  2. On the top left of all your forms click the 3 Dots, then click Download Forms .pdf or Download Forms .zip.

data.title: How Do I Delete Employees
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to delete employees.
data.body:
Deleting employees is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to delete employees, you must have the Delete Employees role enabled in your profile.

Information

FieldFlō does not recommend deleting employees. If employees are permanently removed, the only way to get these restored is through the FieldFlō development team.

Here are the steps for deleting employees:

  1. On the left main menu, click Employees.

  2. To permanently remove an employee, select the 3 dots next to your desired employee then click Remove.

  3. The PLEASE CONFIRM pop-up will appear, click YES to permanently delete this employee.

data.title: How Can I See What Lead My Project Was Created From

data.title: How Can I Adjust All Time on a Timesheet?
data.description: This article will show you how to adjust a timesheet for all employees on a daily timesheet.
data.body:
With just a few steps you are able to adjust the time for all employees on a open/active timesheet.

Requirements

NOTE: To be able to edit times for an active timesheet, you need to have the role of Can Edit Employee Time enabled under the Timesheet section of Employee Roles.

Here are the steps to adjusting all employee time:

  1. Navigate to the project using Projects on the left menu.

  2. Filter to find the project needed and click to open

  3. Locate the timesheet in the list of Active Forms and click to open timesheet

  4. Use the Select All radio button to select all employees then click on the Clock and Pencil icon

  5. Edit the pop-up window to the correct timesheet data.

    1. If you do not need to change the start date & time, the end date & time or break time you can select the radio button beside that option and it leave your current timesheet data as is.

    2. To update the time and date, click inside of the proper field and adjust the data using the calendar and/or the minute and hour slide.

  6. Enter PIN and submit when finished.

data.title: How Do I See What Inventory Is On My Project
data.description: This article will show you how to pull the Project Inventory Report that will tell you what inventory is on a project.
data.body:
By running this report, you are able to see what inventory was assigned to a project via the Warehouse Request Form. You are also able to see the quantities of those items and if they were fully used or returned into your Inventory at the end of a project, giving you costing(s) for your items (if costs are set).

Requirements

Note: To be able to pull the Project Inventory Report, you will need to have the roles of Run Admin Reports, Warehouse Fulfillment, Add and View Items

Here are the steps to see what inventory is on your project:

  1. Click on Admin on your left menu then Reporting Center or click on the Reporting Center icon on your Notification Bar.

  2. Click on Project Inventory Report.

  3. Select the Report Type.

  4. Choose the Time Period, you can choose Entire Project or unselect that radio button and select the Date From and Date To.

  5. Select the correct Asset Class(es) that you'd like to include in the report.

  6. You can Filter by project status, all projects, or you can search and select the Radio button next to specific projects.

  7. Click Run Report at the top right of the screen to generate your report.

data.title: How Do I Archive a Lead
data.description: This article will show you how you can archive a lead so that it now longer shows in your list of leads under CRM.
data.body:
You are able to clean up your list of leads to only display active leads in a few quick steps.

Requirements

Note: To be able to edit the status of a lead, you will need to be set up to view leads (all or assigned) and have the Can Add Leads role assigned

Here are the steps to archive a lead:

  1. On your left menu click on CRM, then click Leads.

  2. You can scroll to find your Lead, or use the filters on top to search. Once you've found your Lead, click on the Lead to open it up.

  3. Click on the General Info section.

  4. Under Lead Status in the bottom right of your screen, click the drop down to select Archived then click Save or Save and Close.

data.title: Can I Turn Off the Expiring Notification on Certificates?
data.description: This article will show you how to disable the alarm for expiring soon certificates in the widget or the bell on your main project dashboard.
data.body:
Turning off the notification setting for a certificate is easy and takes only a few steps to complete.

Requirements

Note: To be able to edit a certificate and disable the alarm you will need to have the role of Edit Certs in your employee profile.

Information

Note: By giving your employee the role to edit cert, this will also allow them to view employees

Here are the steps to disable the alarm on expiring certificates:

  1. On your left menu click Certification > Certificates.

  2. Filter to find the certificate that you'd like to disable the alarm on.

  3. Click on the 3 dots on the right side of the certificate and select Disable Alarm.

data.title: How Do I Run An Expense Report?
data.description: This article will detail the steps to running an Expense Report in FieldFlō.
data.body:
It is very easy to run an Expense Report in FieldFlō. Costs entered on FieldFlō's Expense Forms are included in the Expense Reports.

Requirements

NOTE: You must be a Super Admin or have the Employee Permission to "Run all Reports" to run Expense Reports.

Information

There are two types of Expense Reports:

  1. CSV - Displays cost information in an Excel file format

  2. PDF - Displays costs and receipt images in a PDF printable format

Click here for more information about FieldFlō's Expense Form

Here are the steps to run an Expense Report:

  1. Click Admin on your Left Main Menu. Scroll down and click Reporting Center.

  2. Click Expense Reports under the General Reports Section of the Reporting Center.

  3. Enter a Date From / Date To and use the drop-downs to filter the Expenses and select Run Report.

  4. Select the type of Report by selecting the red Generate CSV or Generate PDF buttons.

  5. One the pop-up, select if you would like to Return to Export Page, to wait for the report to download, or Leave and be Notified, to leave the page and be notified when the report is ready to download.

CSV Example:

PDF Example:

data.title: How Do I Approve Expenses?
data.description: This article will detail the steps to approving or declining expenses entered on the Expense Form.
data.body:
It is very easy to Approve or Decline Expenses entered with FieldFlō's Expense Form. This article will take you through the steps.

Requirements

NOTE: You must be a Super Admin or have the Employee Permission to "Run all Reports" to approve or decline expenses.

Information

Click here for more information about FieldFlō's Expense Form

Here are the steps to Approving or Declining Expenses:

  1. Click Admin on your Left Main Menu. Scroll down and click Reporting Center.

  2. Click Expense Reports under the General Reports Section of the Reporting Center.

  3. Enter a Date From / Date To and use the drop-downs to filter the Expenses and select Run Report.

  4. The SUMMARY Section will appear. This section displays Expense totals per Employee, Per Project.

  5. The EXPENSES section has detailed information about each expense. As well as the Receipt image. At the bottom of each Expense you will see the Accept or Decline options.

  6. Click the Radio Button for Accept or Decline. When the radio button is selected the Approver's name will be displayed along with the date and time of the Acceptance.

  7. Repeat Step 5 for any additional Expenses.

data.title: How Do I Fill Out An Expense Form?
data.description: It is easy to fill out an Expense Form and this article will show you how to do it!
data.body:
Important

Expense Types must be setup in Portal Admins before the Expense Form can be used properly.

Click here for instructions on how to enter Expense Types

Here are the steps to fill out an Expense Form

  1. Click Projects on your left main menu.

  2. Use the Search Fields or +Filter to find and navigate to your Project.

  3. Once you found your Project, click anywhere on the row to open it.

  4. While on the Project's Dashboard click the blue +Add Form button.

  5. Search the form list for the Expense Form and select Radio Button just to the left of the form name.

  6. Scroll to the bottom and click Save.

  7. Click on the Expense Form in the Active Forms area.

  8. Depending on what your company requires, enter the appropriate information in the SS (Social Security Number) / ID (Employee ID) & Employee Fields.

    1. The Date field is not editable and is set as the date the form was opened.
      NOTE: This is the From Date, it may be different than the Purchase Date.

  9. Click the blue +Add Row button. (Click the + Add Row as many times as needed for every expense that needs to be submitted)

  10. After adding all the rows that you need, several fields will appear. Fill out all all applicable fields.
    NOTE: None of the Fields are required but fill in as much information as possible.

    1. Purchase Date - Date purchase was made

    2. Project Type - Select from Dropdown or Add Custom

    3. Cost Type - Select from Dropdown or Add Custom

    4. Cost - Dollar amount of the Expense

    5. Reimbursable - Select Yes or No

    6. Purchase From - Vendor or Store name where purchase was made

    7. Receipt # - Identification number on Receipt

    8. Description - Details about the Expense or Purchase

  11. To attach Receipt images to the form, click Choose File and select the Receipt image. File types accepted are .jpg, .jpeg, .png or .pdf file types.

  12. When all Expense are entered, press the Save & Close button at the bottom of the form.

  13. On the Project's Dashboard, click the file box icon to Close the form.

    NOTE: A form MUST be Closed for it to be included in Reports and Job Costing.

data.title: Is There a Way Set Employee PINs In Bulk?
data.description: Absolutely there is! This article will walk you through the steps on how to update PIN numbers for multiple employees at one time.
data.body:
It is easy to add or update employee PINs for multiple employees at one time by using FieldFlō's Import Tool.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have Super Admin Permissions to use FieldFlō's Import Tool.

Information

  • In FieldFlō, a PIN (Personal Identification Number) is a four digit code used by Employees to verify information pertaining to themselves.

  • PINs should be kept private and unique to each employee.

  • To download an Employee Template that contains your current Employee Details, select the Employees hyperlink from the Export Area section of the Import Tool (step 2 below).

Here are the steps on how to use the Import Tool to add or update Employee PINs:

  1. Click Admin on your left main menu. Then scroll down to and select Imports.

  2. Select the Employee Template from the Export section.

  3. Add the 4 digit code to the Set PIN column (Column Q) and Save the file on your computer.
    ​Pro Tip: Apply a filter to the top row of the export file and filter the PIN column (Column P) by Yes or No.

  4. When you are ready to import your updated template, select Employees from the "Select Area for Import" drop-down menu, choose your file, and select Import.

  5. Check Log for Errors.

  6. Correct any Errors on your Template and repeat Step 3.

Additional Information

If updating other Employee Details keep the following in mind:

  • All dates should be typed in format with 4 numbers for year. YYYY-mm-dd or mm/dd/YYYY or d.m.YYYY etc. (ie. 2020-10-30 or 10/30/2020 or 30.10.2020 etc.)

  • If you don't see any results following import then it means too many errors were found in your file. Please ensure you follow the template formats and have ID's listed for every item.

  • First and Last Name and Employee ID's are required fields. If employee with entered employee ID exists in database, it will be updated, otherwise it will be inserted as new.

  • Super admin, can login, active, US citizen, and temp labor fields will be set to "no" if not set to "yes".

  • Be aware that dates can be uploaded incorrectly depending on your excel file configuration, so please check Birth Date and Date Hired after import.

data.title: How Do I Add Lead Tags In The CRM
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to set up CRM tags in FieldFlo.
data.body:
Adding lead tags is simple with FieldFlo, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Information

You are able to customize tags in FieldFlo to categorize certain types of leads, this will allow you to filter by these types when searching for a lead.

Required

In order to add lead tags, you must have the Can Add Leads role enabled.


Here are the steps to adding tags in the CRM:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin then Portal Admins.

  2. Under CRM click TAGS.

  3. Click the +Add Tag blue button the right side.

  4. Add the Tag Name and Color, then click Save.

Here are the steps to add Tags to your Lead:

  1. On your left main menu, click CRM then click Leads.

  2. You can scroll to find your Lead, or use the filters on top to search. Once you've found your Lead, click on the Lead to open it up.

  3. Click on General Info section and click +Tag at the bottom of the page.

  4. Click the Drop-Down to select a Tag and click Submit.
    ​
    ​Note: You can add up to 6 tags per Lead.

data.title: How Do I Add/Edit Referrals
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add and edit referrals.
data.body:
Adding and editing referrals is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add and edit referrals, you must have the Add Clients role enabled.

Here are the steps to add referrals:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin then click Portal Admins.

  2. Under the Projects section, click Referrals.

  3. Click + Add Referral.

  4. Enter the mandatory referral Name and any additional information you need to include, then click Save.

    Here are the steps to edit a referral:

  1. Within the list of referrals, click the 3 Dots next to the referral name, then click Edit.

  2. The Edit Referral pop-out will appear, you can now make edits to any of these fields and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add Loss Types?
data.description: This article will cover how to add loss types in FieldFlo.
data.body:
Adding loss types in FieldFlo is easy, and this article will show you how to do it.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have access to Portal Admins.

Here are the steps to adding loss types in FieldFlo:

  1. From the FieldFlo dashboard, select the Admin module, then Portal Admins.

  2. Under the PROJECT section, select LOSS TYPES.

  3. Select + Add Loss Type.

  4. Add the Name of your Loss Type, then click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add/Edit Subcontractors
data.description: This article will cover how to add and edit subcontractors in FieldFlo.
data.body:
Adding and editing subcontractors in FieldFlo is easy, this article will show you the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add and edit subcontractors, you must have the Add Clients role enabled.

Here are the steps to add subcontractors in FieldFlo:

  1. On your left main menu, select the Admin module then select Portal Admins.

  2. Under the PROJECT section, select SUB CONTRACTORS.

  3. Click +Add New.

  4. Add the mandatory Sub Contractor Name, then add any additional information that's needed and click Save.

Here are the steps to edit a sub contractor:

  1. Within the list of sub contractors select the 3 Dots next to the needed sub contractor, then click Edit.

  2. The Edit Sub Contractor pop-out will appear, you can now make edits to any of these fields and click Save.

data.title: Phone Version - How Do I Change The Language In FieldFlō
data.description: This article will show you the steps on how to switch FieldFlō to your preferred language on your phone.
data.body:
Changing the language within FieldFlō is very simple, this article will show you exactly how to do it!

Here are the steps to change the language in FieldFlō on your phone:

data.title: How Do I Add Prevailing Wage / CP Classification Groups
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add Prevailing Wage /  CP Classification groups.
data.body:
Prevailing Wage / CP Classification groups are convenient because they allow you to group Prevailing Wages together. You can then choose which groups are available on each project, which will narrow down the list of Prevailing Wages/CP Clarifications you have to choose from. It is very easy to add Prevailing Wage / CP Classification groups in FieldFlo, and this article covers exactly what you need to do!

Required

In order to add Prevailing Wage / CP Classification types, you must have the Add Employee role.

Here are the steps to add Prevailing Wage / CP Classification groups:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin.

  2. The admin dropdown will appear, click Portal Admins.

  3. Scroll down to the Employee section, click PREVAILING WAGE/CP CLASSIFICATION GROUPS.

  4. Click + Add Group.

  5. The Add Group pop-out will appear, enter the mandatory Group Name and your Prevailing Wages in the Add Prevailing Wage drop-down.

  6. Once these steps are complete, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add Prevailing Wage / CP Classification Types
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to add Prevailing Wage / CP Classification types.
data.body:
Adding Prevailing Wage / CP Classification types is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add Prevailing Wage / CP Classification types, you must have Super Admin access.

Here are the steps to add Prevailing Wage / CP Classification types:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin.

  2. The admin dropdown will appear, click Portal Admins.

  3. Scroll down to the Employee section, click PREVAILING WAGE / CP CLASSIFICATION.

  4. Click + Add Prevailing Wage.

  5. The Add Prevailing Wage pop-up will appear, select the Active Radio button if you want this new Prevailing Wage Type effective immediately.

  6. There are several mandatory fields marked with a red *, fill out the following fields:

    • Prevailing Wage Name *

    • Prevailing Wage Code *

    • Base Rate *

    • Fringe Rate (optional)

  7. Once all mandatory fields are entered, click Save.

data.title: How Do I See New FieldFlō Features
data.description: This article will show you how to see FieldFlō's newest features!
data.body:
Seeing the newest FieldFlō features is easy, this article will show you exactly how to do it!

Here are the steps to see new FieldFlō features:

  3. Now you can scroll and see all of the the newest FieldFlō features!

    Note: You can click on any of these features for a detailed overview.

data.title: How Do I Run A Change Order Report
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to run a change order report.
data.body:
Running a change order report is made easy with FieldFlō, this article will show you exactly how to do this!

Requirement

In order to run a change order report you must have Super Admin access.

Here are the steps to run a change order report:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin.

  2. The admin options will drop down, click Reporting Center.

  3. Under the General Reports, click Change Order Report.

  4. Select your Time period by selecting/unselecting the Entire Project Radio button. If unselected complete the Date From and Date To drop-downs to choose the timeframe.

  5. Choose which Work Order Types you would like to include by selecting/unselecting Radio buttons next to the Work Order Type.

  6. Choose which project Change Order Status's you need to include by selecting/unselecting Radio buttons next to the Change Order Status.

  7. Select which Projects you need to include in the report, click the Radio buttons next to each Project you need included. You can use the Search field to find individual projects.

  8. Click Run Report.

  9. Now you can see all Change Order data.

  10. (Optional) You can access and edit any of the Change Order Internal Notes by clicking the Edit hyperlink.

  11. (Optional) The notes pop-up will appear, if you edit the notes be sure to click Save.

  12. (Optional) You can go straight to the individual Change Order Form by clicking the Link To Form hyperlink.

  13. (Optional) You can export this report by clicking the Download CSV blue button.

data.title: How Do I Run An Incident Report
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of running an incident report.
data.body:
Running an incident report is made easy with FieldFlō, this article will show you exactly how to do this!

Requirement

In order to run an incident report, you must have Super Admin access.

Here are the steps to run an incident report:

  1. On the top right menu, click the Reporting Center icon.

  2. Under Safety Reports, click Incident Report.

  3. First select the Time Period by selecting the Radio buttons next to either of the following:

    • All Time

    • This Year

    • Last Year

    • Custom Range

      • If this option is selected, enter your Date From and Date To in the drop-downs

  4. Select the type of Incident Category/Type by selecting the Radio buttons next to the following:

    • All

    • Incidents

      • If this option is selected, select/unselect the Radio buttons next to the Incidents Types that you need to include.

    • Near Miss

      • If this option is selected, select/unselect the Radio buttons next to the Near Miss Types that you need to include.

    • Stop work

      • If this option is selected, select/unselect the Radio buttons next to the Stop Work Types that you need to include.

  5. Select which Projects you need to include, you can select the Radio buttons next to All Projects or Customize.

    Note: If you pick Customize, select/unselect radio buttons next to the projects you need to include.

  6. Once all of these steps are complete, click the blue Generate Report button.

  7. The Generating Report pop-up will appear. Click either Return to Export Page or Leave and be Notified, whichever you prefer.

data.title: How Do I Change The Language In FieldFlō
data.description: This article will show you the steps on how to switch FieldFlō to your preferred language.
data.body:
Changing the language within FieldFlō is very simple, this article will show you exactly how to do it!

Here are the steps to change the language in FieldFlō:

  1. Under your left main menu on the bottom, click the Select Language dropdown.

  2. Select your preferred Language.

data.title: How Do I Restore A Deleted Form
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to restore a form after it was deleted.
data.body:
Restoring a deleted form is made easy with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Requirement

In order to restore a deleted form, you must have the Restore Deleted Forms Role and Permission.

Here are the steps to restore a deleted form:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Scroll down to your forms and click the Deleted Forms tab.

  5. You can scroll to find the form you need to restore, you can also select the Type and Date drop-downs to narrow down your deleted form options.

  6. Once you have found the form you need to restore, click the Restore Form arrow to the right of the form.

  7. The RESTORE pop-up will appear, click YES.

  8. The NOTIFICATION pop-up will appear, click OK.

  9. Click the Active Forms tab, you can now work on your restored form.

data.title: How Do I Change The Project Manager On A Project
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to change the project manager on a project.
data.body:
Changing the project manager on a project is easy with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Requirement

In order to change a project manger on a project, you must have the Edit/Delete Projects Role and Permission.

Here are the steps to change a project manager on a project:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, click Project Details.

  5. Click the General Info tab.

  6. Click the Project Manager drop-down and select your new Project Manager.

  7. Once you've made all needed changes, scroll down and click Save.

data.title: How Do I See All Employees That Have Clocked In Today
data.description: This article will show you an easy way to see all employees that have clocked in today.
data.body:
Seeing all employees that have clocked in today is simple with FieldFlō, this article will show you exactly what to do!

Requirement

In order to see all employees that have clocked in today, you must have Super Admin access.

Here are the steps to see all employees who have clocked in today:

  1. On the left main menu, click Dashboard.

  2. Under the Projects tab, in the TODAY'S PROJECTS widget click Roll Call.

  3. Now you can see all employees that have clocked in today.

    Note: If you would like to see specific projects or employees that have clocked in today, click the Project or Employee drop-down to select which project or employee you need to see. Then click Filter to apply these options.

  4. (Optional) If you would like to export this information, click Download CSV.

data.title: How Do I Upload Client Documents
data.description: This article will guide you through the steps of adding documents to a clients profile.
data.body:
Uploading client documents is made easy with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the steps on how to do this!

Requirement

In order to upload a client document you will need the Edit Clients Role and Permission.

Here are the steps to upload client documents:

  1. On your left main menu, click CRM. Then click Clients.

  2. Find your client by typing the Client Name in the search bar, you can scroll to find your client, or you can filter your options with the blue + Filter button and select the filters you need.

  3. Once you find the client, click anywhere on the Client Name to open up their details.

  4. The Edit Client pop-out will appear, click Documents.

  5. Select + Add Folder to create a new folder or + Add Files to add a new document.

  6. Click Chose File to add your document.

  7. Choose who can access this document by selecting a Radio Button under Advanced Roles.

    • Regular: This option follows the roles and permissions that are already set up for each employee.

    • Super Admin Only: This option only allows super admins access to the document.

    • Super Admin +: This option allows super admins to access the document along with being able to give certain employees access with the blue + button.

  8. You can add additional employees to view this document by pressing the blue + button and select the employees (but these employees must be able to login and have the "View Clients" role and permissions).

  9. Once you added your document and chose your roles, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Change The Supervisor On A Project
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of changing the supervisor on a project.
data.body:
Changing a supervisor on a project is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Requirement

In order to change the supervisor on a project, you must have the Edit/Delete Projects Role and Permission.

Here are the steps to change the supervisor on a project:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, click Project Details.

  5. Click the General Info tab.

  6. Click the Supervisor drop-down and select your new supervisor.

  7. Scroll down and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add A Change Order To A Project
data.description: This article will show you the steps on how to add a change order to your project.
data.body:
Adding a change order to your project is made easy with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Here are the steps to add a change order to your project:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. In the Job Costing box on the right side, click View Details.

  5. Under the change order section, click + Change Order.

  6. The Change Order pop-up will appear, enter the Change Order Name, Change Order Type (Additional or Deduct), and the Actual Cost.

  7. Click Save.

data.title: How Do I Upload Employee Documents
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of adding documents to an employees profile.
data.body:
Uploading employee documents is simple with FieldFlō, this article will show you exactly how to do this!

Here are the steps to upload employee documents:

  1. On your left main menu, click Employees.

  2. Once you're in the employe module, you can find the employee you need by typing their name in the search bar or filter your options by the Status dropdown. If you would like additional filtering options click the blue + Filter button.

  3. Once you find the employee you need, click anywhere on the Employee name to open up their profile.

  4. The Edit Employee pop-out will appear, click Documents.

  5. To add a document to the profile, click the blue + Add Files button. You can also select + Add Folder to create a new document folder.

  6. Click Chose File to add your document.

  7. Choose who can access this document by selecting a Radio Button under Advanced Roles.

    • Regular: This option follows the roles and permissions that are already set up for each employee.

    • Super Admin Only: This option only allows super admins access to the document.

    • Super Admin +: This option allows super admins to access the document along with being able to give certain employees access with the blue + button.

  8. You can add additional employees to view this document by pressing the blue + button and select the employees.

  9. Once these steps are complete, click Save.

data.title: What Is The Expense Form Used For?
data.description: This article lists some of the ways the FieldFlō Expense form can be used.
data.body:
Definitions

Expense Form: A FieldFlō Stock Form used for recording and submitting costs, that may be reimbursable to an employee or for receipt tracking.

Information

Costs entered on the Expense Form are included in the Project's Job Costing.

Expense Form Uses

  • FieldFlō's Expense Form can be used to track project expenses associated with Parking, Hotels, Fuel, Materials, etc.

  • It can also be used to request reimbursement for a Vehicle or Phone allowance.

  • Entering and keeping receipts needed for Credit Card reconciliations is another great use of the Expense Form.

Important

Expense Types must be set up in Portal Admins before the Expense Form can be used properly.

Click Here for Instructions on How to Enter Expense Types

Additional Resources

The following articles contain additional helpful information associated with the Expense Form.

Click Here for Instructions on How to Fill out an Expense Form
Click Here for Instructions on How to Approve Expenses
Click Here for Instructions on How to Run an Expense Report

data.title: How Do I Export Payroll
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of exporting payroll.
data.body:
Running payroll reports is very easy with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Here are the steps to export payroll:

  1. On your left main menu, click Payroll.

  2. The payroll menu will appear, click Payroll Exports.

  3. There are 2 mandatory fields marked with a red *. First click the Type dropdown and chose the type of report you need to run, then select the Date From to chose the timeframe of the report.

  4. Select the Radio Button next to each project you need to include in the report.

    Note: You can filter your options by the following:

    • Status

      • All, Active Only, Closed Only, or On Hold Only

    • Client

    • Project Type

  5. Once you have your projects selected, select the Radio Button next to the Employees that you need included. Select/Unselect the Include Deleted Employees radio button, if selected the report will include deleted employees.

    Note: You can filter your employee options by All, Regular, and Temp employees.

  6. Once you have your desired projects and employees selected, click the blue Run Report button on the top right of your screen.

  7. The Generating Report pop-out will appear click either Return to Export Page or Leave and be Notified, whichever you prefer.

data.title: How Do I Add/Edit Pre-Built Proposal Paragraphs
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of adding and editing pre-built proposal paragraphs.
data.body:
Adding and editing pre-built proposal paragraphs is easy with FieldFlō, and this article will show you the exact steps on how to do that!

Requirement

In order to add and edit pre-build proposal paragraphs, you must have the Super Admin Role and Permission.

Here are the steps to add and edit a pre-built proposal paragraph:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin then click Portal Admins.

  2. Scroll down to the CRM section, click Paragraphs.

  3. On the top right click + Add Paragraph.

  4. There are a few mandatory fields that are marked with a red *, this includes the Name and the Text field. All other options are based on user preference.

  5. Once all fields are filled out, click Save.

  6. To edit an existing pre-built proposal paragraph, click on the 3 little dots next to the paragraph you need to edit. The admin dropdown will appear, click Edit.

  7. The Edit Paragraph pop-out will appear. Make the necessary changes and click save.

data.title: How Do I Run A Waste Report?
data.description: This article will show you the steps on how to run a wast report for your projects.
data.body:
Running a waste report for your projects is easy with FieldFlō, this article will explain step by step how do to do this!

Here are the steps to run a waste report:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin.

  2. The admin options will drop down, click Reporting Center.

  3. Once you're in the reporting center select Waste Report.

  4. Enter the Date From and Date to, this depicts the timeframe of the report.

  5. Select the Project dropdown and chose which projects you need to be included in the report.

  6. Lastly click Generate Report.

data.title: How Do I Access The FieldFlo Safety Academy
data.description: This article will walk you through how to access the FieldFlo Safety Academy
data.body:
The FieldFlo Safety Academy is a library full Safety Topics and can be used as Toolbox Talks for your Employees. This library has videos, documentation, and quizzes that can all be used as needed by you. This article will walk you through how to access it.

Information

If you are not seeing the FieldFlo Safety Academy, you may need to reach out to Customer Success via email: support@fieldflo.com and have this turned on for you portal.

Here are the steps to accessing the FieldFlo Safety Academy:

  1. On the left hand side of your screen, click Certification and then Trainings.

  2. Once you are on the Trainings page, you will see a few filters:

    • Only Active dropdown - This allows you to Filter the Trainings by their status.

    • All Sources dropdown - There are several "Sources" under this dropdown:

      • All Sources - Gives you a view of trainings from all sources.

      • My Trainings - This gives you a view to only see trainings that your company has created.

      • Stock Trainings - This gives you a view of FieldFlo Created Trainings.

      • Safety Academy - This gives you a View of all the FieldFlo Safety Academy Videos.

    • You can also Search for Trainings in the quick search Search Trainings field.

  3. All of the FieldFlo Safety Academy Trainings will live under the Safety Academy filter and are defaulted to Inactive.

  4. You will need to Activate any of the Trainings you would like to use by:

    • Finding the video and clicking on the Three Little Dots on the far right side of the video.

    • After the Admin Menu for the Training appears, click on Edit.

    • You will be taken to the specific Training's edit page.

    • Click on Certify.

    • Select yourself in the Name dropdown and enter your PIN.

    • Click on the Click to Enter Signature.

    • The Enter Your Signature popup will appear and you can add your signature.

    • Once you have added you signature, click OK.

    • Click Yes under Training Active.

    • Click Save & Close.

  5. The Training will now be available to deploy to all of your employees or select employees.

data.title: How Do I Edit Employee Roles
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to edit employee roles.
data.body:
Editing any employee role is very easy with FieldFlō, this article will show you exactly how to do this!

Here are the steps to edit employee roles:

  1. On your left main menu, click Employees.

  2. Once you're in the employees section, you can search for your employee in the search bar by typing the Name, ID, City, Phone Number, Union ID, or the last 4 of their SSN.

  3. Once you've found the employee, click anywhere on the Employee to edit their details.

  4. The edit employee window will appear, click Employee Roles.

  5. Now you are able to select/unselect the radio buttons next to each role and determine what roles you need on or off.

  6. Once you've made all needed changes, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add/Edit Stop Work Types For Projects?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to add and edit a stop work type for your project forms.
data.body:
Adding and editing a stop work type is simple within FieldFlo, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this.

Here are the steps for adding a stop work type:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin.

  2. The admin dropdown will appear, click Portal Admins.

  3. Scroll down to the safety section, click STOP WORK.

  4. To add a new stop work type, click the blue button + Add Stop Work Type.

  5. Click the Active radio button if you want this stop work type active immediately.

  6. Enter the Name of the stop work type.

  7. Select a Position from the position dropdown.

    Note: The position is determining the order of your stop work type, selecting "Latest" will put your new stop work type on the bottom of the list while selecting "1" will make it on the top of your list.

  8. When you've filled out all desired fields, click Save.

Here are the steps to edit a stop work type:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin.

  2. The admin dropdown will appear, click Portal Admins.

  3. Scroll down to the safety section, click STOP WORK.

  4. Find your stop work type that you need to edit. You can scroll to find your stop work type, you can search by the Name in the search bar or filter your options by Status.

  5. Once you find your desired stop work type, click the 3 Dots to the right of the stop work name.

  6. The 3 Dots dropdown will appear, click Edit.

  7. You can now change the Status, Name and Position of the stop work type.

    Note:

    • The position is determining the order of your stop work type, selecting "Latest" will put your new stop work type on the bottom of the list while selecting "1" will make it on the top of your list.

    • The following stop work types are preset by FieldFlo and the names cannot be changed, only the position can be changed:

      • Injury

      • First Aid

      • Property Damage

      • Spill

      • Vehicle Accident

      • Equipment Failure

      • Fire

      • Other

  8. Once all changes are made, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add/Edit Sub Contractors?
data.description: This article will guide you through the steps of adding and editing sub contractors.
data.body:
Adding and editing sub contractors is simple with FieldFlo, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do that!

Here are the steps to add a new sub contractor:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. On your projects page, click the 3 dots on the top right.

  3. The 3 dots dropdown will appear, select Sub Contractors.

  4. To add a new sub contractor, on the top right click the blue + Add New button.

  5. The add sub contractor pop-up will appear, enter the mandatory Name.

  6. (Optional) Enter the following Company info:

    • Adress

    • City, State, Zip

    • Business Phone, Business Fax

  7. (Optional) Enter the following Contact Info:

    • Name

    • Title, Phone

    • Email

  8. (Optional) To add more contacts, click the blue + Contact button.

  9. When all needed information is entered, click Save.

Here are the steps to edit an existing sub contractor:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. On your projects page, click the 3 dots on the top right.

  3. The 3 dots dropdown will appear, select Sub Contractors.

  4. To edit a sub contractor, click the 3 dots to the right of the sub contractor's name.

  5. The 3 dots dropdown will appear, click Edit.

  6. Now you are able to make changes to the following Company Info and Contact Info:

    • Name

    • Adress

    • City, State, Zip

    • Business Phone, Business Fax

    • Title, Phone

    • Email

  7. Once all desired changes are made, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add/Edit Incident Types For Employees?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of adding/editing incident types shown in the disciplinary action form.
data.body:
Adding and editing incident types for your employees is very easy with FieldFlo, this article will show you exactly what to do!

Here are the steps to add a new employee incident type:

  1. On your left main menu, click Employees.

  2. On the top right, click the 3 dots.

  3. The 3 dots dropdown will appear, select Incidents.

  4. To add a new incident type, on the top right click the blue + Add Incident Type button.

  5. Enter the new incident Name.

  6. Click Save.

Here are the steps to edit an employee incident type:

  1. On your left main menu, click Employees.

  2. On the top right, click the 3 dots.

  3. The 3 dots dropdown will appear, select Incidents.

  4. Find the incident type you need to edit by searching the Name in the search bar, or scroll to find your incident type.

  5. Once you find the incident type you need to edit, click the 3 dots next to the incident name.

  6. The 3 dots dropdown will appear, click Edit.

  7. You can now change the Name of the incident type.

  8. When you're done making changes, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add/Edit Phases?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of adding and editing phases.
data.body:
Adding and editing phases is easy with FieldFlo, this article will show you exactly how to do that!

Here are the steps to add a phase:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin.

  2. The admin dropdown will appear, click Portal Admins.

  3. Under the project section, select PHASES.

  4. On the top right corner, click the blue + Add Phase button.

  5. Select the Active radio button if you want this phase active immediately.

  6. Enter the Phase Name and Phase Code.

  7. Once all fields are filled out, click Save.

Here are the steps to edit a phase:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin.

  2. The admin dropdown will appear, click Portal Admins.

  3. Under the project section, select PHASES.

  4. To edit a phase, click the 3 dots next to the phase name.

  5. The 3 dots dropdown will appear, click Edit.

  6. Now you're able to make the desired changes.

  7. Once all changes are made, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add / Edit Materials For Waste Tracking?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of adding and editing material types for waste tracking.
data.body:
Adding and editing material types in FieldFlo is simple, this article will show you exactly how to do it!

Required

In order to Add and Edit Materials, you must have the Add / Edit Waste Portal Admin role enabled.

Information

Here are areas in FieldFlo where Materials will be used:

• Waste Load Out Form
• T&M Form
• Change Order Form


Here are the steps to adding materials for waste tracking:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin.

  2. The admin dropdown will appear, click Portal Admins.

  3. Scroll down until you see the waste section, click Materials.

  4. On the top right, click + Add Material.

  5. The add material pop-out will appear, enter the mandatory Name.

  6. (Optional) Enter:

    • Per Yard Cost

    • Per Ton Cost

    • Per Pound Cost or Credit

    • Per Load Cost

  7. When you're finished entering information, click Save.

Here are the steps to editing materials for waste tracking:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin.

  2. The admin dropdown will appear, click Portal Admins.

  3. Scroll down until you see the waste section, click Materials.

  4. To edit a material, click the 3 dots next to the material name.

  5. The 3 dots pop-out will appear, click Edit.

  6. Now you're able to make any changes to the following fields:

    • Name

    • Per Yard Cost

    • Per Ton Cost

    • Per Pound Cost or Credit

    • Per Load Cost

  7. When all changes are made, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add/Edit Categories For Equipment And Material For The Inventory Module?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of adding and editing your categories.
data.body:
Adding and editing categories for your inventory is easy with FieldFlo, this article will walk you through exactly how to do that!

Here are the steps to add categories for the inventory module:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin.

  2. The admin dropdown will appear, click Portal Admins.

  3. Scroll down until you see the inventory section, click Categories.

  4. To add new categories, on the top right click Add Category

  5. Click the Parent Category dropdown if you would like the new category to be a sub category for an existing one.

    Note: If you don't want any parent category, select No Parent Category.

  6. Enter the Category Name.

  7. Click Save.

Here are the steps to edit existing categories for the inventory module:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin.

  2. The admin dropdown will appear, click Portal Admins.

  3. Scroll down until you see the inventory section, click Categories.

  4. To edit a category, click the 3 dots next to the category name.

  5. The 3 dots pop-out will appear, click Edit.

  6. Make any changes to the Parent Category or Category Name.

  7. When you've made all desired changes, click Save.

data.title: Phone Version - How Do I Use “Same As Previous Day” For A Daily Timesheet?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of using the "Same As Previous Day" selection to fill out your daily timesheet on a phone.
data.body:
Starting a daily timesheet using the "Same As Previous Day" selection is easy with FieldFlo, this article will show you exactly how to do that!

Here are the steps for using the "Same As Previous Day" option to start your daily timesheet on your phone:

  1. On the top right, click three three lines

  2. One the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click the Projects module.

  3. You can scroll down to find your project or click on the blue + Filter button to search by Project Name, Project Number or any of the other fields you would like to search by.

  4. Once you found your project, click anywhere on the project to open up the details.

  5. Once you're in the project, scroll down and click the blue Start Day button to access your company's mandatory forms. This will include the daily timesheet.

  6. You will see all the mandatory forms, click the Daily Timesheet.

  7. On the top right, click the three little dots.

  8. The admin pop out will appear, select Same As Previous Day.

  9. The SAME AS PREVIOUS pop out will appear, first click the Select origin form dropdown and choose which daily timesheet's information you need to copy from.

    Note: Copying information from a previous timesheet will delete all entered items on the current timesheet

  10. Select the Copy Assets bubble if you have assets on the previous timesheet that you need to copy to your current timesheet.

  11. Click Submit.

  12. Now you will see all the employees, their phase, and position type was copied over from your previous timesheet to this current timesheet.

data.title: How Do I Use "Same As Previous Day" For A Daily Timesheet
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of using the "Same As Previous Day" selection to fill out your daily timesheet.
data.body:
Starting a daily timesheet using the "Same As Previous Day" selection is easy with FieldFlo, this article will show you exactly how to do that!

Here are the steps for using the "Same As Previous Day" option to start your daily timesheet:

  1. One the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click the Projects module.

  2. You can scroll down to find your Project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you have found the project click on the Project.

  4. Once you're in the project, scroll down and click the blue Start Day button to access your company's mandatory forms. This will include the daily timesheet.

  5. You will see all the mandatory forms, click the Daily Timesheet.

  6. On the top right, click the three little dots.

  7. The admin pop out will appear, select Same As Previous Day.

  8. The SAME AS PREVIOUS pop out will appear, first click the Select origin form dropdown and choose which daily timesheet's information you need to copy from.

    Note: Copying information from a previous timesheet will delete all entered items on the current timesheet

  9. Select the Copy Assets bubble if you have assets on the previous timesheet that you need to copy to your current timesheet.

  10. Click Submit.

  11. Now you will see all the employees, their phase, and position type was copied over from your previous timesheet to this current timesheet.

data.title: How Do I Renew a Certificate?
data.description: This article will cover how to renew a certificate in FieldFlo.
data.body:
Renewing a certificate in FieldFlo is easy, and this article will show you step by step how to do it.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have access to the Certification module to renew certificates.

Here are the steps to renewing a certificate in FieldFlo:

  1. From the FieldFlo dashboard, click on the Certification module, then click Certificates.

  2. Using the filters, locate the certificate you are wanting to renew.

  3. Click the three dots to the right of the certificate you are renewing, then click Renew.

  4. Enter the certificate's Valid From date, the Expiration Date, then click Choose File, and finally, click RENEW.

  5. Once the renewal is complete, you will receive a notification. Click OK.

data.title: How Do I Verify Time On A Supervisors Device
data.description: This article will walk you through how to verify time on a supervisors device.
data.body:
Verifying time on your supervisors device is simple with FieldFlo, this article will show you exactly how to do this!

Here are the steps to verify time on a supervisors device:

  1. The supervisor will access the project on the left main menu and click Projects.

  2. The supervisor can scroll down to find the project. Or filter the options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once the project is found, click on the Project.

  4. The supervisor will scroll down and click on the Daily Timesheet.

  5. Once the supervisor stops the time and is ready for verification, the supervisor will click the yellow Verify button next to the employee name on the timesheet.

  6. The supervisor will give the employee their device, fill out the "VERIFY YOUR WORKING DAY" pop up.

  7. Once all of these fields are entered, the supervisor will select the SUBMIT blue button.

  8. When the employee is verified, the employee name should turn Black and the green Verified box will appear next to their name.

data.title: How Do I Export Employees?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of exporting your employees.
data.body:
Exporting employees is easy within FieldFlo, this article will show you exactly how to do that!

Here are the steps to exporting your employees:

  1. On your left main menu, click Employees.

  2. On the top right, click the three little dots.

  3. After selecting the three little dots a pop out will appear, click Export Employees (CSV).

  4. Once your in your Export Employees section, select the Employee(s) you want to Export.

    Note : You can search the name of a specific employee by searching in the Selected Employees field and type the name of the employee, you can filter your options by their Status, or scroll to find your employees and click on the Radio button next to those employees.

  5. Once you have your desired employee(s) selected, on the top right click Export CSV.

data.title: How Do I Export Projects?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps to exporting projects.
data.body:
Exporting your projects is easy with FieldFlo, this article will walk you through exactly what to do!

Here are the steps to export projects:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. Click the three little dots on the top right.

  3. Select Export Projects (CSV).

  4. Once you're in the Export Projects page, select the Project(s) you want to export by clicking the Radio Button next to each project or click the blue Select all.

    Note: You can also search for a specific Project by clicking in the Selected Projects field and typing the name of the Project or you can filter your options by their Status, or Client.

  5. Once you have your desired Project(s) selected, on the top right click Export CSV.

data.title: How Do I Export Inventory
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps of exporting your inventory.
data.body:
Exporting your inventory is easy with FieldFlo, this article will show you exactly what to do.

Here are the steps to export your inventory:

  1. On your left main menu, click on Inventory.

  2. On the top right, click on the three little dots.

  3. Select Export CSV.

data.title: How Do I Return Items To The Warehouse
data.description: This article will go through the steps of returning your items back to your warehouse.
data.body:
Returning items to your warehouse is easy with FieldFlo, this article will show you exactly how to do that.

Here are the steps to returning items.

  1. On the left side main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your Project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Click on your Project.

  4. Scroll down and click the blue + Add Form button.

  5. Find the Warehouse Request Form and select the Radio button next to the form.

  6. Once you have the form selected, click Save.

  7. Click on the Warehouse Request Form.

  8. Click on the Request Type dropdown and select Return, then click Next.

  9. Select Request By Name and select your name.

  10. Select Enter Pin and enter your Pin to verify the request.

  11. Enter the Date Requested By.

    Note- This is the day you want the items returned by.

  12. Click Add Item.

  13. Enter the Item Name and any other details you need.

  14. To add more items, select the + Item blue button on the bottom.

  15. Once you have all your items added and are ready to submit, select Submit Request.

    Note- If you would like to come back to this Form and submit it later, you can select Save & Close.

data.title: How Do I Use Daily Scheduling?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to schedule employees/assets for a single day using FieldFlō's Daily Scheduling feature.
data.body:
Creating and sending a schedule for a single day is easy with FieldFlo, this article will show you exactly how to do this!

Required

In order to use the Scheduling module, you must have the Full Scheduling Access role enabled.

Here are the steps to send the schedule for a single day :

  1. On the left side main menu, select the Scheduling module.

  2. The Scheduling dropdown will appear, click Week.

  3. Select the Week you need to Schedule for and click Open.

  4. Click the Set Day dropdown and select which specific day you need to Schedule for.
    ​
    ​Note: This will change the interface to show hours instead of days.

  5. Select the Crew tab.

  6. Once you're in the crew view, you can use the buttons in the guide below to interact with the schedule:


    ​ - Click this icon to move forward one hour.
    ​
    ​ - Click this icon to move back one hour.
    ​
    ​ - Click this icon to move forward.
    ​
    ​ - Click this icon to move back 8 hours.


    ​Note: To return to the Week view, select All from the Set Day drop-down.​

  7. Find the employee or asset you need to schedule by scrolling, or you can use the Employee Filters or Asset Filters on the right hand side to quickly search and narrow down your list.
    ​
    ​Note: To clear filters for a fresh start, remove the Employee/Asset Filters radio button.
    ​Example:

  8. Schedule hours by clicking on the employee/asset's row. You can schedule multiple hours at once by clicking and dragging across multiple hours.
    ​
    ​30 Minute Schedule Example:


    ​Drag Function ​Example:

  9. After selecting hours, you have the following options to choose from and click Next:
    ​
    • Schedule New Project - You can select this option to generate a brand new project directly from this screen.
    ​
    • Schedule Existing Project - Select this option to schedule a project that is already entered in FieldFlo.
    ​
    • Add Placeholder - Select this option to schedule an employee for a placeholder project.
    ​
    ​Note: If the Schedule Existing Project option is used, you can link this employee's schedule to an asset by selecting the assets radio button underneath the "Do you also want to schedule:" section. To learn how to link assets to an employee, click the button below!
    ​

    How Do I Link Assets To An Employee For Scheduling?

  10. After clicking Next, configure the following options and click Save:
    ​
    • Start Time - Set Hrs, Mins, and AM/PM for the start time by selecting options from the drop-down.


    • End Time - Set Hrs, Mins, and AM/PM for the end time by selecting options from the drop-down.
    ​
