    • Break - Enter the employees break by selecting an option from the drop-down.
    ​
    ​ - Select Scheduling Notes to enter any notes you'd like the employees to see in their scheduling confirmation text.
    ​
    ​ - If a placeholder is being set up, select Placeholder Title and add the name of your place holder.
    ​
    • Employee Notes - If employees enter notes in their confirmation text for this day, they will appear here. Click Clear Notifications to acknowledge and clear the alert. Click Clear to permanently delete the note.

  11. (Optional) After configuring hours, you have the follow icons to adjust time:
    ​
    ​ - This icon copies the selected hours to another employee or asset.
    ​
    ​ - This icon moves the selected employee(s)/asset(s) hours to a different project.

    - If one day's hours is selected, you can click this icon to copy those hours to another day.
    ​
    ​ - This icon deletes the selected hours.
    ​
    ​Note: To use these icons, you must select which employees or assets hours will be effected by making sure their Hours are clicked and highlighted green. These icons will only effect the hours that are selected.
    ​Example:

  12. (Optional) You can send a confirmation text to employees individually by selecting the Radio buttons next to their name, and click the icon.
    ​
    ​Note: While using the icon, a text will send to all employees that are selected.
    ​Example:

  13. (Optional) You can send a confirmation text to all employees who are scheduled by clicking Ready SMS, Send Schedule, then click Yes.
    ​
    ​Note: Clicking Ready SMS will send a text to ALL EMPLOYEES who are scheduled across ALL PROJECTS.

  14. If is selected, the Send Schedule confirmation will appear, make sure the Radio button is selected next to the day you're sending Schedule for and click Yes.

data.title: How Do I Enter Landfills?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to add Landfills.
data.body:
It is very easy to enter Landfills in FieldFlo and this article will show you exactly what to do!

Here are the steps to add Landfills.

  1. On the left side, in the main menu click the Admin module.

  2. Under your Admin dropdown, click Portal Admins.

  3. Scroll down to the Waste section and select Landfills.

  4. To add Landfills, on the right side click the blue + Landfill button.

  5. The Add Landfill pop out will appear, fill out the Name.

    Note - The Name field is the only mandatory box to fill out, the rest of the fields are optional but recommended.

  6. Click Save to add the Landfill.

data.title: Android - How To Turn On Location Services
data.description: This article will walk you through how to turn on location services using an Android.
data.body:
Enabling location services on an Android is simple, here are the steps that show you exactly how to do it.

Information

Here is a short video walkthrough on "How to turn on Location Services for an Android device"

Here are the steps to turning on your location services for an Android device.

  1. Find your Settings app on your Android, tap it to open.

  2. Once you're in your Settings app, scroll down and select Location.

  3. Turn the Use Location switch on to enable your location.

data.title: Apple - How To Turn On Location Services
data.description: This article will show you the steps on turning on location services with an Apple device.
data.body:
Turning on location services on an Apple device is simple, here are the exact steps on how to do so.

Here are the steps to turning on location services for your Apple devices.

  1. First find your Settings app on your Apple Device, tap it to open.

  2. Next, scroll down to Privacy & Security and select it.

  3. Select Location Services.

  4. On the top, make sure the Location Services switch is on.

    Note - This switch will turn green when location services are on.

data.title: How Do I Print Schedules?
data.description: This article will show you exactly how to print out your schedule.
data.body:
Printing a schedule within FieldFlo is easy, here's how you do it using scheduling reports.

Here are the steps to printing a schedule:

  1. On your left Main Menu, click the Scheduling module.

  2. Once you select Scheduling a dropdown will appear, click Reports.

  3. First select the type of Schedule you want to print, then select what Week you'd like, lastly click Run Report.

  4. Select your preference, either Generate PDF or Generate XLSX. Now your schedule is ready to print.

data.title: How Do I Send Out Schedule?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to send out your schedule.
data.body:
Sending out your schedule is easy within FieldFlo, these are the steps to do so.

Here are the steps to send out a schedule.

  1. On the left side of your screen in the Main Menu, click Scheduling.

    Note : Before we send out Schedule, we need to set our scheduling preferences in the Settings dropdown.

  2. After selecting Scheduling the dropdown will appear, select Settings.

  3. Make sure your Settings are set so the Schedule sends by any of the methods listed below by selecting any/all of the bubbles:

    • SMS - This will send a Text to all employees that are scheduled.

    • Email - This will send an Email to all employees that are scheduled.

    • Confirmation - This will give the employee an option to enter their pin and confirm the schedule sent to them.

  4. After you have your Settings selected, make sure to click Save.

  5. On the left hand side of your screen in the Main Menu, click Scheduling and then click Week to access your Schedule.

  6. Once you have a completed Schedule and you are ready to send it, there are 2 ways to send the Schedule.

    • You can send it to all Employees on the Schedule by clicking Ready SMS.

    • Or you can send it to an individual Employee by clicking the Crew / Asset scheduling view, select the Employees bubble then click the phone icon.

data.title: How Can I See Which Projects Have Open Forms?
data.description: This article will show you how to use your main dashboard to see what projects have forms currently open.
data.body:
Information

In FieldFlo, you can receive notifications for all kinds of things. To learn how to setup notifications, click below:

How Do I Setup Notifications

Here are the steps the steps to see which projects have open forms.

  1. On the left hand side of you screen in the Main Menu and click Dashboard.

  2. Scroll down until you see the Forms widget.

  3. Select the Settings gear on the top right of the widget.

  4. The Forms Filter selections will appear:

    • Available Forms - Allows you to pick specific forms that you want to see.

    • Intervals - Allows you to narrow down your search results by time frame.

    • Form Status - Allows you to select whether a Form is Open or Closed.

    • Project Status - Allows you to see Active or Closed projects

  5. Once you have selected all the filters that you need, click Apply.

  6. Once you click Apply, the widget will refresh and will show you all of the forms based on your filtering.

    Note: You can click on any of the blue text for any of the forms to be taken right to the form.

data.title: How Do I Run an OSHA 300A Report?
data.description: This article will cover how to run an OSHA 300A Report and how to change the hours if necessary.
data.body:
Requirements

NOTE: You must have the roles and permissions to View OSHA Details and/or Add / Edit OSHA Details.

  1. From the FieldFlo Dashboard, navigate to the Safety Dashboard.

  2. Scroll down and locate the OSHA Stats widget, then select the year, period, establishment and projects, then click Generate OSHA Reports.

  3. To view the hours, click on 300A Hours/Summary. From here you can add additional hours, misc hours edit employee hours. When you are finished, click Confirm and Create Your 300A.

  4. Click Download 300A.

  5. Enter your PIN and click Download.

  6. Select whether you want to Return to Export Page or Leave and be Notified. If you select Leave and be Notified you will receive an email letting you know when it is ready.

  7. You can find completed reports in the Reporting Center from your notification bar.

data.title: How Do I Add Waste Haul Types?
data.description: Adding waste haul types in FieldFlo is easy, and this article will show you how to do it.
data.body:
Requirements

NOTE: You must have access to portal admins to add waste haul types.

Here are the steps to adding your waste haul types in FieldFlo:

  1. From the FieldFlo Dashboard, select Admin then Portal Admins.

  2. Scroll down to the Waste section and select Haulers.

  3. Select +Add Haul Type

  4. Enter the Name and press Save.

data.title: How Do I Add Waste Haulers?
data.description: Adding waste haulers is easy, and this article will show you how to do it.
data.body:
Requirements

NOTE: You must have access to portal admins to add waste haulers.

Here are the steps to adding your waste haulers in FieldFlo:

  1. From the FieldFlo Dashboard, select Admin then Portal Admins.

  2. Scroll down to the Waste section and select Haulers.

  3. Select +Add Hauler

  4. Enter the Name and press Save.

    NOTE: Address, phone number and per load cost are optional.

data.title: How Do I Set Up OSHA Establishments? (Multi-Office Portals Only)
data.description: This article will explain what OSHA Establishment Groups are and how to create them to use for OSHA 300 Log Reporting in FieldFlō.
data.body:
It is very easy to create Establishment Groups in FieldFlō. Establishments are used when running OSHA 300 Logs. You can create Establishments to combine information from your different Branch Offices or Locations.

Requirements

NOTE: Only Multi-Office FieldFlō Portals have the mini admin for OSHA reporting.

  • You must be a Super Admin to access OSHA Reporting.

Information

OSHA Establishment: In the context of OSHA 300 log reporting, an establishment is the unit for which an employer must maintain records of work-related injuries and illnesses.

In FieldFlō you can create Establishments by grouping your "Offices" together.

Here are the steps to setting up OSHA Establishments:

  1. On your left main menu click Admin

  2. Select Portal Admins.

  3. Scroll down to the Safety section and select OSHA Establishment Groups.

  4. Click thebutton at the top right of the screen.

  5. Name your Establishment Group.

  6. Select Offices/Branches to include in the Establishment Group.

  7. Enter an Address to show on your OSHA 300 Logs.

  8. Enter a SIC or NICS Code.

  9. Enter an Industry Description.

  10. Enter DART, ITIR, and LTIR values.

  11. Click Save.

data.title: How Do I Run an OSHA 300/301 Log Report?
data.description: Running an OSHA 300/301 Log Report is easy, and this article will show you how to do it.
data.body:
Requirements

NOTE: You must have the roles and permissions to View OSHA Details and/or Add / Edit OSHA Details.

Here are the steps to running an OSHA 300/301 Log Report?

  1. From the FieldFlo Dashboard, navigate to the Safety Dashboard.

  2. Scroll down and locate the OSHA Stats widget, then select the year, period, establishment and projects, then click Generate OSHA Reports.

  3. Select the desired projects and click Download 300/301 csv.

  4. Enter your PIN and click Download.

  5. Select whether you want to Return to Export Page or Leave and be Notified. If you select Leave and be Notified you will receive an email letting you know when it is ready.

  6. You can find completed reports in the Reporting Center from your notification bar.

data.title: How Do I Report An Incident
data.description: This article will show you how to report a recordable or reportable incident.
data.body:
FieldFlo has the ability to track all OSHA and non-OSHA related injuries or incidents for your records. You can gather all needed employee, witness, insurance information and more.

Information

For an incident form to be added to the OSHA Logs, you will need to make sure that you close out the form after completion. You will also be able to use the Mark As Complete circle at the right corner of each section to show an over completion percentage on the Safety Dashboard.

Here are the steps to report an incident.

  1. Click on Projects on the left menu.

  2. Filter to find your project and click to open.

  3. Click on Report Incident and select your incident type; Injury or Vehicle Accident, then save.

  4. Scroll to the bottom area of the project and click the Injury or Vehicle Form to open

  5. Click the radio button for yes or no for OSHA recordable

    1. All asterisk * and/or red circle O fields are mandatory to be filled out for the type of incident, recordable vs reportable.

  6. Fill out all fields needed by your company.

  7. Once all required fields are completed, click Save

data.title: How Do I Associate A Certificate With A Skill?
data.description: This article will cover how to associate Certifications with an Employee's designated Skill in FieldFlo.
data.body:
Setting needed Certifications for a Skill is simple with FieldFlō. This article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Information

• What is a Skill? - You can associate Skills to Employees to keep track of what tasks that employee is capable of doing. You can make Skills anything that makes the most sense for the type of work that your company performs. Skills are useful to dispatchers in the Scheduling Module because you can filter Employees by their "Skills."

• Skill Examples: Burner, Operator, Flagger, Saw Cutter, Company Approved Driver, Badgeable, etc.
​
• Why Associate a Certificate with a Skill? Associating a certificate with a Skill will allow you to compare which Certifications the Employee has, to which Certifications a selected Skill requires. You can view this information within the Employee's profile under the Employee Certs tab.

Here are the steps to set needed certifications for a skill:

  1. On your left main menu, click Admin then Portal Admins.

  2. Scroll down to the EMPLOYEE section and click SKILLS.

  3. Click on the Skill that you need to set certifications for.

  4. Now select the Radio buttons next to each needed certificate for that Skill. You can use the search field to find specific Certifications.

  5. Once all certificates are selected, click Save.

  6. Within an Employee's profile under the Employee Certs tab, if you select a Skill from the Skill Preview drop-down you can see which certificates the employee has compared to which certificates the Skill requires.

Note:

You can select the Need radio button to save what certificates the employee needs. This prevents you from having to check each Skill every time you want to verify if an employee has the certificates they need.

data.title: How Can I Update Emergency Details For Multiple Employees At One Time?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to update emergency details for multiple employees at one time.
data.body:
It is easy to add and update emergency details for multiple employees at one time by using FieldFlō's Import Tool.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have Super Admin Permissions to use FieldFlō's Import Tool.

Information

  • To download an Employee Template that contains your current Employee Details, select the Employees hyperlink from the Export Area section of the Import Tool.

Here are the steps on how to use the Import Tool to add and edit Employee Details:

  1. Click Admin on your left main menu. Then scroll down to and select Imports.

  2. Select the Employee Template from the Export section.

  3. When you are ready to import your updated template, select Employees from the "Select Area for Import" drop-down menu, choose your file, and select Import.

  4. Check Log for Errors.

  5. Correct any Errors on your Template and repeat Step 3.

Additional Information

If updating other Employee Details keep the following in mind:

  • All dates should be typed in format with 4 numbers for year. YYYY-mm-dd or mm/dd/YYYY or d.m.YYYY etc. (ie. 2020-10-30 or 10/30/2020 or 30.10.2020 etc.)

  • If you don't see any results following import then it means too many errors were found in your file. Please ensure you follow the template formats and have ID's listed for every item.

  • First and Last Name and Employee ID's are required fields. If employee with entered employee ID exists in database, it will be updated, otherwise it will be inserted as new.

  • Super admin, can login, active, US citizen, and temp labor fields will be set to "no" if not set to "yes".

  • Be aware that dates can be uploaded incorrectly depending on your excel file configuration, so please check Birth Date and Date Hired after import.

    If you need assistance please email Support@FieldFlo.com.

data.title: How Do I Edit Start and End Times On A Timesheet?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to change Start and End times on a Timesheet.
data.body:
It's easy to change the Start and Stop times on a Timesheet if you have the permissions to do so.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have the Can Edit Time permission to change Start and End times on a Timesheet.

Information

TIP: If the work day is not complete, only change your Start Time.

  • Entering an End Time before the day is over, will stop your clock and cause your project to no longer show on the Today's Projects widget.

  • To change only a Start Time, select the "Don't Change End Date and Time" radio button before clicking Submit.

Here are the steps to changing Start and End Times on a Timesheet:

  1. While in a Timesheet, select the radio buttons for the Employee(s) you would like to adjust the times for.

  2. Select the icon.

  3. The “Change Time For Selected” window will appear. Edit Start Time, End Time, and Break Time.

  4. Once you have made your changes, enter your PIN number and click Submit to update the times for all selected employees.

data.title: How Do I Use The Timesheet Adjuster?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to use the Timesheet Adjuster tool in FieldFlō.
data.body:
The Timesheet Adjuster is an efficient tool in the FieldFlo system, used to enter hours worked in the event that a timesheet was never created, the day has already passed, or if an employee was never added to the timesheet. It is particularly useful for changing dates on timesheets when direct date modification is not supported.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have the Timesheet Adjuster permission to access the Timesheet Adjuster tool.

Additionally, some timesheet settings, such as enabling advanced features or using the Timesheet Adjuster, require specific permissions and should be verified with your system administrator.

Information

There are 3 different ways to access the Timesheet Adjuster:

  1. Admin Module:

    1. Select Admin on your left main menu.

    2. From the Admin sub-menu, select Timesheet Adjuster.

  2. Project's Dashboard:

    1. Navigate to the Project.

    2. Select the at the top right of the Project's Dashboard.

    3. Select Timesheet Adjuster.

  3. Timesheet:

    1. Navigate to the Project and Open a Timesheet.

    2. Select the at the top right of the Timesheet.

    3. Select the Timesheet Adjuster from the drop-down menu.

Here are the steps on how to add or edit hours with the Timesheet Adjuster:

  1. Navigate to the Timesheet Adjuster from the Admin Module, Project's Dashboard, or Timesheet.

  2. Choose a project from the drop-down menu.

  3. Select the date that you would like to adjust the timesheet for.

  4. Select the radio buttons next to the name(s) of the employees you need to adjust hours for.

  5. Scroll down to the next section.

  6. Select Radio Buttons for Billable, Breaks taken, Injuries, and enter Notes, as needed.

  7. Enter total work time in hours and minutes.

  8. Select the Primary Position and Primary Phase (if applicable). You can add more

    positions if relevant, by clicking on + Add Position.

  9. Select the Save button to confirm your adjustments.

Note: The Timesheet Adjuster is best suited for making changes to past dates, as it cannot modify dates directly.

Information

NOTE: If adjusting hours for an employee who is already on the Timesheet, enter total hours worked. The Timesheet Adjuster will overwrite the original Timesheet hours.

Troubleshooting: If unable to change a timesheet date, recreate the timesheet using the Timesheet Adjuster and delete the incorrect one.

data.title: How Do I Create A Reach-out In The CRM?
data.description: This article will teach you how to track your CRM reach-outs to clients.
data.body:
Logging your CRM client reachouts has never been easier and you can do so in just a few simple steps.

Required

You must have the roles under CRM to view Leads or View Only Assigned Leads.

Information

Note: CRM Reachouts are logged by client under CRM - Clients

You can set up a Daily Notification for CRM Reachouts under the Gear Icon.

Here are the steps to setting up a Reachout:

  1. Click CRM on the left menu and Leads.

  2. Filter to find the lead and click within Lead to open.

  3. Under the Choose Client/s section, if a client is not listed, click Add Prospect Client. If a client is listed, go to step 5.

  4. Once the Add Prospect Client window opens, you can pull from existing client by typing a min. of 3 characters in the Client field or Create New by filling in the required information. Save once client info is entered.

  5. Click Setup and fill in required Reachout Information with User in the dropdown, date of Reachout, a reoccurrence if applicable and reason then Save.

  6. Once the client has been contacted, you can repeat steps 1-3 and click Contacted with Notes and Save.

data.title: How Do I Create An Inspection From A QR Code
data.description: In FieldFlo you can create an inspection by scanning a QR Code, and this article will walk you through how to do it.
data.body:
It is very easy to create an Inspection in FieldFlo and there are a number of ways to do it. This article will walk your through how to do it by scanning a QR Code.

Information

If you need to add an inspection type to a piece of equipment, click the button below:

How Do I Add An Inspection Type To Equipment?

If you don't know how to create an inspection, you can learn that by clicking this button:

How Do I Create An Inspection Form

If you would like to create an Inspection on the Project, click this button to learn how:

How Do I Complete an Inspection Form On A Project?

If you need to print your QR codes in bulk, click this button:

How Do I Download Equipment QR Codes In Bulk?

To pull QR Codes individually, click this button:

How Do I Download Equipment QR Codes? (Individually)

Here are the step to creating an Inspection from a QR Code:

  1. From the phone, use the camera feature to scan the QR Code for the equipment.

  2. Click Inspection from the list.

  3. Make sure your name is in the box and enter your PIN in the box and hit Login.

  4. Select the Project from the list and hit Create Form.

    • The type of inspection you select will autogenerate the inspection form to be filled out.

  5. The radio button for Ok, No, or N/A needs to be enabled for each question.

    • You can use N/A for the entire section.

    • When "No" is enabled, it will create a Corrective Action.

  6. Under the Corrective Action section, select the Assigned To person, enter comments or attachments, then enter Signature and Save.

data.title: How Do I Add Estimators or Sales Person to the CRM?
data.description: This article will show you how to get your Estimators and Salespeople to appear under CRM.
data.body:
You can add a Salesperson or Estimator as an dropdown option under CRM in a few quick steps.

Requirement

You must have the permission to view/edit roles to complete this task.

To learn how to update roles, click here.

Here are the steps to adding Estimators or Salespeople to the CRM:

  1. Click Employees on the left menu.

  2. Filter to find employee and Click anywhere to edit.

  3. Under Employee Details, enable the correct radio button for Estimator/Sales Person

  4. Click Save.

  5. Under CRM and Leads, you are able to add them to the below sections:

    • CRM Dashboard - Lead By Salesperson

      • This allows you to click the Active Lead number and go to that persons active leads page.

    • Main Lead Page - Filter Options for Sales Person and Estimator.

    • General Info - Salesperson

    • Job Walk - Estimator

data.title: How Do I Add Phases To My Project
data.description: This article will teach you how to add phases to a specific project.
data.body:
Adding phases to a project is simple with FieldFlō, this article will walk you through the exact steps on how to do this!

Required

In order to add phases to a project, you must have the Edit/Delete Project role enabled.

Here are the steps to add phases to your project:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you find your project, click anywhere on the Project.

  4. Once your project opens up, click the 3 Dots then click Phases.

  5. Click + Add Phase.

  6. Select the active Radio button, enter the Phase Name and Phase Code.

  7. Click Save.

  8. Now this phase will be available to choose from within this projects timesheet.

data.title: How Do I Report An Injury?
data.description: This article will help you report a recordable or reportable injury inside of FieldFlo.
data.body: FieldFlo has the ability to track all OSHA and non-OSHA related injuries or incidents for your records. You can gather all needed employee, witness, insurance information and more.

data.title: How Do I Add An Inspection Type To Equipment?
data.description: This article will show you how to add an inspection type to a piece of equipment.
data.body:
You can add a new inspection or multiple inspections to a piece of equipment in a few quick steps.

Information

To learn how to do an Inspection on a Project, click the button below:

How Do I Complete an Inspection Form On A Project?

To learn how to do an Inspection through a QR code, click this button:

How Do I Create An Inspection From A QR Code

Here are the steps to adding an Inspection Type to Equipment:

  1. Click Inventory on the left menu.

  2. Filter to find the piece of Equipment and click on the row to open.

  3. Under Item Details, scroll to Inspection Types.

  4. Click to Select at least one type of Inspection to add to your equipment.

  5. Click Save at the bottom of the screen.

data.title: How Do I Complete an Inspection Form On A Project?
data.description: This article will teach you how to complete an inspection form on a project.
data.body:
It is very easy to create an Inspection in FieldFlo and there are a number of ways to do it. This article will walk your through how to do it on the Project.

Information

If you need to add an inspection type to a piece of equipment, click the button below:

How Do I Add An Inspection Type To Equipment?

If you don't know how to create an inspection, you can learn that by clicking this button:

How Do I Create An Inspection Form

If you would like to create an Inspection by scanning a QR Code, click this button to learn how:

How Do I Create An Inspection From A QR Code

If you need to print your QR codes in bulk, click this button:

How Do I Download Equipment QR Codes In Bulk?

To pull QR Codes individually, click this button:

How Do I Download Equipment QR Codes? (Individually)

Here are the steps to completing an Inspection Form:

To complete an inspection from a project:

  1. Click Projects from the left menu.

  2. Filter to the needed project and click in the row to open.

  3. Click the +Add Form button, enable the radio button for Inspection Form and click Save.

  4. Click on the Inspection form under Active Forms.

  5. Inside the form, select the Supervisor/Auditor/Inspector from the list, Enter PIN and select the Type of Inspection.

    • The type of inspection you select will autogenerate the inspection form to be filled out.

  6. The radio button for Ok, No, or N/A needs to be enabled for each question.

    • You can use N/A for the entire section.

    • When "No" is enabled, it will create a Corrective Action.

  7. Under the Corrective Action section, select the Assigned To person, enter comments or attachments, then enter Signature and Save.

data.title: How Do I Pull Certificates on a Project Level?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to download certificates for employees listed as Inactive from a Project Level.
data.body:
This article will teach you how to download project level inactive employee certificates in just a few simple steps.

Information

If you do not use any filter options, it will run all active and inactive certificates for the project duration.

Any employee with access to see a project is able to pull this at the project level.

If you need to pull and download all Certificates, you can do so by clicking the button below:

How Do I Download Certificates for All Employees?

Historical preservation of certification records ensures you can verify when a certification was active or renewed, offering a complete view for audits or compliance checks.

Here are the steps to downloading active/inactive employee certificates from a project:

  1. Click on Projects on the left menu.

  2. Filter to find the needed project and click within the row to open.

  3. Click on the 3 dots in the top right corner and click Employee Certs.

    Note: There are several filters that can be applied when pulling your Certification package. To do this click the +Filter button. From here you can filter by:

    • Active Certs

    • Today's Timesheet Only

    • By person

    • By Cert Name

    If you would like to pull all the certifications, just leave the filter blank.

    Here are the examples of what each filter looks like:

    "Show Only Active Certs".

    "Show Only Today's Timesheet Employees".

    Use the Employee dropdown to select the employee(s) needed.

    Cert Name:

    Once the correct filter is in place and the needed cert or employee(s) are listed, you can use the Print button to generate a PDF for download.

data.title: (IOS App ONLY) How Do I Edit a Form That Was Started Offline?
data.description: If your employee is using FieldFlo Offline App on their iOS device, you can now see that data in live time with internet connection.
data.body:
You can now see your teams Active Forms live with internet connection, allowing you to edit them in just a few steps.

Information

Please remember you can only see Active forms on the Web URL in live time if your Supervisor/Foreman has internet connection.

How To Edit An Active Offline Form?

  1. Go to Projects on your left menu.

  2. Filter to find the project needed and click on any white space within the row.

  3. Scroll down to your Active Forms and look for the Mobile App icon.

  4. Click on the "Take Over" icon on the left side of the needed form.

  5. The Take Over popup will appear. If you want to make all future edits in the web app click "Yes". If you still want edits to be completed on the mobile app click "No".

  6. If you clicked yes, the Notification will appear that this Form has been converted to normal state. This means that going forward this form can only be edited on the Web Application.

  7. Click on the form to open and edit as needed.

data.title: How Do I Enable Project Details on a Custom Form?
data.description: This article will cover how to include project details on a custom form.
data.body:
Enabling a header to include project details for your custom forms is easy, and this article will show you how to do it.

Requirements

Note: You must have access to the Admin module to create and edit custom forms in the Form Builder.

Information

Enabling the PDF Header on your custom form will ensure the following project details are included:

  • Project Location

  • Project Name

  • Project Number

  • Job Address

  • Project Supervisor

  • Project Manager

Example:

Here are the steps to enabling project details for a custom form in FieldFlo:

  1. Select Admin from the left-side menu, then select Form Builder.

  2. Locate your form using the search field, then click the three dots on the right-hand side of the form, then edit.

  3. Select the three dots then select Form Settings.

  4. Under PDF Header ensure the Active button is selected, then select Save.

data.title: How Do I Reopen a Project?
data.description: This article will cover how to reopen a project in FieldFlo.
data.body:
Reopening a project in FieldFlo is easy, and this article will show you how to do it.

Here are the steps to reopening a project in FieldFlo:

  1. Click on the Projects module on the left-side main menu.

  2. Locate the project using the filters and click on the desired project.

    Note: Ensure the status filter is set to Closed or All.

  3. Click the three dots, then select Reopen Project.

  4. Confirm you would like to reopen the project by selecting Yes.

data.title: How Do I Create Categories for Equipment and Material
data.description: This article will walk you through how to create categories for equipment and material.
data.body:
In FieldFlō, it is very easy to create categories for equipment and material. This article will walk you through how to do it!

Requirements

NOTE: You must have access to Inventory Module. Also you need to have the Role and Permissions to Add Item and View Items.

Here Are The Steps To Create Categories For Equipment and Material

  1. On the left hand side of your screen click on the Inventory module.

  2. On the top right of the Inventory page, click the Three Little Dots.

  3. Click on Categories.

  4. On the Categories page in the top right of your screen, click on the blue + Add Category.

  5. The Add Category Pop-out will appear. Add the Category Name in the Category Name field and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add Or Edit A Piece Of Equipment / Material Item
data.description: This article will walk you through how to add or edit a piece of equipment / material item in FieldFlō
data.body:
It is super easy to add / edit a piece of equipment in FieldFlō, and this article will walk you through how to do it!

Requirements

NOTE: You must have access to Inventory Module. Also you need to have the Role and Permissions to Add Item and View Items.

Information

NOTE: If you need to know how to setup Categories, click here and you will be taken to the How Do I Create Categories for Equipment and Material to learn how.

How Do I Create Categories for Equipment and Material

Here Are The Steps To Add Or Edit A Piece Of Equipment

  1. On the left hand side of your screen click on the Inventory module.

  2. On the top right of the Inventory page, click the blue + Add Item button.

  3. The Item Details pop-out will appear. You must mark the equipment as Active by clicking on the Active radio button.

  4. There are several fields that are required to fill out and these have all been marked with a red *:

    • Item No

    • Item Name

    • Category

    • Asset Class

    NOTE: There are several other fields that you can fill out at your discretion, but the more information the better!

  5. Once you are done filling out all the information, go to the bottom left of your screen and click Save.

Here Are The Steps To Editing A Piece Of Equipment Or Material Item

  1. On the left hand side of your screen click on the Inventory module.

  2. On the Inventory page, find and click on the piece of equipment or material item that you would like to edit and click on it.

  3. Once the Item Detail pop-out appears, make your adjustments and on the bottom left, click Save.

data.title: How To Track Equipment Maintenance
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to easily track maintenance for your equipment.
data.body:
Tracking maintenance in FieldFlo is now easier than ever, and in this article, you will learn how to set those parameters so you can track them via the Equipment Dashboard.

Information

NOTE: If you want to learn how to set the maintenance types click the article below.

How Do I Set Up Maintenance Type

Here are the steps for tracking Maintenance:

  1. Click on the Inventory Module.
    ​

  2. Find the piece of equipment you would like to add maintenance to by using the filter

    option and once you find it click on it to open up the item.
    ​

  3. Then you will click on the Maintenance & Repair tab.
    ​

  4. In the top section, you will see information on the Odometer Reading. This information gets auto-filled whenever an inspection form is completed, and you can also manually update it on this screen.
    ​

  5. On the Maintenance tab, you will then select the type of maintenance you would like to track from the dropdown, enter the Triggered At, whether by miles or hours and press the + Add blue button.

data.title: How Do I Update Rental Information?
data.description: This article will teach you how to update the rental information for your rented inventory.
data.body:
You can add Rental, Renewal and Return Dates to your Rentals with fees and invoices in just a few steps.

Requirement

Note: You must have the roles of View and Add Items to update this section.

Information

To learn how to add a Daily Notification, click here.

If you aren't able to locate the Rental Info section, you will need to update your Asset Class to Rental for that item.

Here are the steps to updating your rental information:

  1. Click on Inventory from your left menu.

  2. Filter to find your inventory item by name or number and click within the row to open it.

  3. On the slide out window, click Rental Info.

  4. Fill in the information needed and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Setup Maintenance Types?
data.description: This article will cover how to add or edit maintenance types in FieldFlo.
data.body:
Adding or editing maintenance types for your equipment in FieldFlo is easy, and this article will walk you through how to do it.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have access to the Admin module.

Information

NOTE: If you need to know how to add a piece of equipment, please click the button below to learn:
​

How Do I Add Or Edit A Piece Of Equipment / Material Item

Here are the steps to Manage Maintenance Types

  1. Click on the Admin module from the menu on the left-hand side.

  2. Click Portal Admins.

  3. Scroll down and locate the Inventory section, then click on Maintenance Types.

  4. To add a new maintenance type, click +Add New

  5. The Add New Entry pop-up should appear. In the Name field, enter the name of the maintenance type and click Save.

    NOTE: If you need to edit an existing maintenance type, click on the three dots on the right-hand side, edit the name and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Give An Employee Access to View The Equipment Dashboard?
data.description: This article will walk your through how to give your employees access to view the Equipment Dashboard.
data.body:
It is very easy to give FieldFlō users access to view the Equipment Dashboard.

Requirement

Note: A User in FieldFlō is defined as someone who FieldFlō login access.

  • Users who need to see the Equipment Dashboard, need to also have either the View All Projects or View Assigned Projects permission.

Click the below button for more permission related information.

How Do I Edit Employee Roles

Here Are The Steps To Give An Employee Access to View the Equipment Dashboard :

  1. Click on Employee on the left main menu.

  2. Filter to find your employee and click on the row to open.

  3. Click on Employee Roles.

  4. Scroll down to the Warehouse Section, select the Can View Equipment Dashboard radio button and press Save.

data.title: How To Add A New Employee
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to enter an employee
data.body:
Entering a new employee is easy in FieldFlo, these steps will show you exactly how to do that!

Requirements

Note: To enter an employee you will need to have the roles and permission to do so.

Here are the steps on how to enter a new employee:

  1. Click on the Employee module on your left main menu.

  2. Click the + Add Employee blue button located on the right side of the screen.

  3. The pop-up window will appear and you will proceed to enter as much detail as possible for the employee. At a minimum, we recommend the following:

    • Mark them as Active

    • Enter PIN Number

    • Enter Employee ID (If applicable)

    • Enter Employee First Name

    • Enter Employee Last Name

    • Enter the Employee's Mobile Phone Number

  4. Once you are done entering the information, press the Save button.

data.title: How To Build A Task Hazard & Control Library
data.description: This article will walk you through how to build the task, hazard, and control library so you can use it on the PSI/JHA/SPA form in FieldFlo
data.body:
Is it easy to build your library of Task, Hazard, and Control measures in FieldFlo by following the next steps.

Here are the steps on how to build the Task, Hazard, and Control Library:

  1. On your left main menu click on Projects.

  2. Then click on the 3 dots located on the top right side of the screen.

  3. Click on Pre-Job Task Management.

  4. Click the button +Add Task to enter a new task.

  5. Once the pop-up window opens enter the Task name, Hazard, Control measures, and the Risk Rating dropdown.

  6. Once all information is entered, Click Save.

  7. To edit an existing Task click the 3 dots located on the right side of the task you would like to edit.

  8. The 3 dots dropdown will appear, click Edit.

  9. After you finish editing press Save.

data.title: How To Quick Transfer Equipment
data.description: This article will explain the steps on how to quickly transfer equipment in FieldFlo
data.body:
It is easy to transfer your equipment from job to job in FieldFlo, just follow these steps.

Requirements

Note: In order to quickly transfer a piece of equipment you must allow the quick transfer option on the item you would like to transfer selected and the Asset Class must be set up as Equipment.

Information

Note: You can only quick transfer equipment if the item is already checked out to a project. This will allow you to move the equipment from project to project.

Here are the steps on how to Quick Transfer equipment:

  1. Click on the Inventory Module on your left main menu.
    ​

2. Find the equipment you would like to transfer by using the filter/search engine.
​

3. Once you find the equipment you would like to transfer click the 3 dots located on the right side of the line item.

4. The menu for the equipment will open up and then you will click on the option: Quick Transfer

5. Once the pop-up window opens, you will be able to select the project the equipment is currently at, select the project you would like to transfer it to, and lastly, select the quantity you would like to transfer. Proceed to transfer by clicking on the red Transfer button.
​

Information

Note: Using this tool it will create the warehouse request for you and automatically close it out. The equipment will no longer be in Project A but instead, it will be in Project B, and on the record for Project A it will show that it was returned.

data.title: How Do I Set Up Unit Of Measure - UOM
data.description: This article will walk you through how to set up unit of measure - UOM in FieldFlo
data.body:
It is a simple process to set up and edit unit of measure, follow the steps below.

Information

Setting up UOM ( Unit of Measure) will help you organize your inventory and how you would like to make items in your inventory available.

For example Tape, you can set up the tape to be available in a unit of Rolls, Boxes, Pallets Each...

Here are the steps on how to add/edit unit of measure - UOM:

  1. Click on the Inventory Module located on your left main menu.

  2. Then you will click the 3 dots located on the right side of the screen.

3. Once the menu opens up you will click on UOM.

4. In the following screen, you will click the blue button to add a new UOM. + Add UOM.

5. Proceed to enter your desired UOM and press the Save button once you are done.

6. To edit or remove an existing UOM you will click 3 dots on the line item of the UOM you will like to edit or remove.

data.title: How Do I Create a Role Profile?
data.description: This article will go over how to create a role profile for your employees.
data.body:
Creating employee role profiles in FieldFlo is easy, and this article will show you how to do it. Adding role profiles to your employees will make selecting their roles and permissions quicker and easier.

Requirements

You must have access to the Employees module to create a role profile.

Here are the steps to create a role profile:

  1. Select the Employees module on the left-hand side.

  2. Select the three dots on the right side, then select Role Profiles.

  3. Select +Add Role Profile.

  4. Name your Role Profile, and select the roles and permissions you would like this profile to have.

  5. Once you are finished, scroll down to the bottom and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Change Project Start and End Dates?
data.description: This article will show you how to update your Project's Start and End Dates.
data.body:
Changing the Start and End Dates on your Projects is very easy to do in FieldFlō.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have Edit Project permissions to change Project dates.

Here are the steps to changing project Start and End dates:

  1. Navigate to the Project you would like to update from the Projects Module on your left main menu.

  2. On your Project's Dashboard click the Project Details hyperlink.

  3. The Start and End Date fields are at the bottom of the General Info tab of Project Details. Make changes and click Save.

data.title: How Can I Quickly Update Inventory Item Details for Multiple Items?
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how update multiple inventory items at once using the Import Tool.
data.body:
It is easy to add and update multiple Inventory item details at one time by using FieldFlō's Import Tool.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have Super Admin Permissions to use FieldFlō's Import Tool.

Information

  • To download a blank Inventory Template, select the Inventory hyperlink from the Available Templates section.

  • To download an Inventory Template that contains your current Inventory information select the Inventory hyperlink from the Export Area section.

Here are the steps on how to use the Import Tool to add and edit Inventory Item Details:

  1. Click Admin on your left main menu. Then scroll down to and select Imports.

  2. Select an Inventory Template from either section.

  3. When you are ready to import your updated template, select Inventory from the "Select Area for Import" drop-down menu.

  4. Check Log for Errors.

  5. Correct any Errors on your Excel File and repeat Step 3.

Additional Information

  • All dates should be typed in format with 4 numbers for year. YYYY-mm-dd or mm/dd/YYYY or d.m.YYYY etc.
    (ie. 2020-10-30 or 10/30/2020 or 30.10.2020 etc.)

  • If evolution daily rate up to, evolution weekly rate up to and evolution reset logic after fields are set to 0, item will be set to use company setup.

  • If they are empty, value already in those fields will stay.

  • If you want to change evolution fields, be aware that you must set all 3 fields. If one field is missing that will be considered as bad formatting.

  • If you don't see any results following import, it means too many errors were found in your file. Please ensure you follow the template formats and have ID numbers listed for every item.

  • Item Name and item number are required fields.

  • If item with entered item number exists in database, it will be updated, otherwise it will be inserted as new.

  • Possible values for Asset Class are: Equipment, Heavy Equipment, Tool, Respirators, Materials, Rentals and Consumable.

  • If value is any other, asset class will be set to Consumable.

    If you need assistance please email Support@FieldFlo.com.

data.title: How Do I Download Equipment QR Codes? (Individually)
data.description: This article will walk you through how to download Inventory/Equipment QR codes individually.
data.body:
It is easy to download a PDF of your Inventory/Equipment's QR Codes. The QR codes can then be printed on sticker or label paper and attached to your Inventory Items and Equipment.

Information

  • Equipment QR Codes are used as shortcuts to FieldFlō's Inspection Form.

  • Anyone listed as an Employee on your FieldFlō portal can complete an Inspection Form from a QR code.

  • Documents added to the Item's Inventory profile can be viewed from scanning the QR code.

You can also download QR codes in bulk. Click button below for instructions.

How To Download Equipment QR Codes In Bulk

Here are the steps to down Equipment/Inventory QR Codes Individually:

  1. Select Inventory on your left main menu.

  2. Find and Select the item that you would like the QR code for. The Item Details window will side out. The QR code is at the top. Select Download PDF.

  3. Below is an example of the QR code PDF.

data.title: How Do I Download Equipment QR Codes In Bulk?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to download Inventory/Equipment QR codes in bulk.
data.body:
It is easy to download a PDF of your Equipment's QR Codes. The QR codes can then be printed on sticker or label paper and attached to your Inventory Items and Equipment.

Information

  • Equipment QR Codes are used as shortcuts to FieldFlō's Inspection Form.

  • Anyone listed as an Employee on your FieldFlō portal can complete an Inspection Form from a QR code.

  • Documents added to the Equipment's profile can also be viewed from scanning a QR code.

You can also download QR codes individually. Click button below for instructions.

How Do I Download Equipment QR Codes? (Individually)

Here are the steps to downloading Equipment/Inventory QR codes:

  1. Select Inventory on your left main menu.

  2. Click the three dots at the top right of your screen and select Download QR Codes.

  3. Select an Asset Class, Status, and click Download. To download QR codes for Inactive items un-click the radio button next to Active Only.

  4. Below is an example of the Bulk QR Code PDF.

data.title: Can I Change The Amount Of Time To Be Alerted To Upcoming Certificate Expirations?
data.description: This article will show you how to change when you will be notified of upcoming Certificate expiration dates.
data.body:
You can absolutely adjust the amount of time to be alerted before a Certificate or License is set to expire.

Requirements

Note: You must have access to the Certifications Module to change this setting.

Information

This is a Global Setting that will effect all Certificates and Licenses. This alert cannot be customized per User, Employee, or Certificate.

Follow the steps below to change the number of days to be alerted of upcoming Certificate Expirations:

  1. On your left main menu, select the Certification module. This will reveal more options: Certificates, Trainings, and Certificate Maker. Select Certificates.

  2. On the Certificates page, click the three dots at the top right of your screen.

  3. Select Settings from the drop down menu. Enter the number of days you would like to be alerted before a certificate expires. Press Save.

data.title: How Do I Add a Task to the PSI/JHA Task Library?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to add Tasks, Hazards, and Controls to use on your PSI/JHA Forms.
data.body:
You can save your most commonly used Tasks, their associated Hazards, and the Controls used to minimize those Hazards in your FieldFlō Portal. Those Tasks, Hazards, and Controls can then be used on your PSI/JHA forms.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have Super Admin Permissions to Add/Edit items in your Task Library.

Information

The task library is held under the "Pre Job Task Management" section of the Project Module's three dots (portal admin).

We have preloaded a few Tasks on your portal as examples. You can edit or remove those tasks as needed.

Here are the steps to enter your Task, Hazards, and Controls:

  1. Select the Projects module form your left main menu.

  2. Click the 3 dots at the top right and select Pre Job Task Management.

  3. Click the blue + Add Task button on the top right.

  4. Enter your Task, Hazard, Control, and select a Risk Rating. Press Save.

  5. To edit a Task, Hazard, Control, or Risk Rating, simply click the Task Name. When the window slides out , make desired changes and press Save.

Additional Information

Tasks, Hazards, and Controls can also be added to your library by following this path: Admin>Portal Admin> (PSI/JHA) Tasks

data.title: How Do I Edit My Personal Information?
data.description: This article will show you how to update your personal information.
data.body:
Updating your personal information in FieldFlo is easy, and this article will show you how to do it.

Information

From your personal profile, you have the ability to update the following information:

  • First and Last name

  • Address

  • Phone number

  • Date of birth

  • PIN

  • Password

Here is how to edit your personal information in FieldFlo:

  1. From the FieldFlo Dashboard, select the My Account bubble in the bottom left corner

  2. When you have finished updating your information, click Save in the bottom right corner

data.title: How Do I Add Project Types?
data.description: This article will cover how to add Project Types in FieldFlo.
data.body:
Adding project types is easy, and this article will show you how to do it.

Requirements

NOTE: You must be have access to the 'Projects' module. If you do not see the 'Projects' module, please contact your Company Guru for assistance.

Here are the steps to add project types:

  1. Select the Projects module on the left-hand side.

  2. Select the three dots on the right-hand side, then select Project Type Management.

  3. Select +Add Project Type.

  4. Name your project type, then click Save when finished.

data.title: How Do I Create a Project?
data.description: This article will cover how to create a project.
data.body:
Creating a new project in FieldFlo is easy, and this article will show you how to do it.

Requirements

You must have access to the 'Projects' module and the permissions to 'Add Projects'. Please contact your Company Guru if you are not able to add a project.

Information

When creating a new project in FieldFlo, you have the ability to set up project templates that make this process quicker and easier. See the below article for a step by step process on creating project templates:

How Do I Create a Project Template?

Here are the steps to creating a project in FieldFlo:

  1. From the FieldFlo dashboard, select the Projects module

  2. Once you are in the Projects module, select Add Project in the top right corner

  3. Select a Project Template from the drop-down menu, or select No Template - Use Default

  4. Fill in necessary project information

    • Required fields are marked with an asterisk *

  5. Once you are finished, press Save at the bottom of the page

data.title: How Do I Create a Project Template?
data.description: This article will go over how to create project templates.
data.body:
It is easy to create project templates, and this article will show you how to do it. Project templates make adding new projects to FieldFlo quick and easy, by allowing the freedom to make items mandatory, not mandatory, visible or hidden.

Requirements

You must have access to the admin module to create a project template.

Here are the steps to creating a project template in FieldFlo:

  1. Select the Admin module, then select Portal Admins

  2. Select Project Templates

  3. Select Add Project Detail Settings

  4. Add in your Template Name

    • To make an item mandatory, click on Not Mandatory and the text will update to Mandatory

    • To make an item invisible, click on Visible and the text will update to Invisible

  5. When you have finished customizing your template, press Save at the bottom

data.title: How Do I Change My Company Guru?
data.description: This article will cover how to change your company guru.
data.body:
It is easy to change your company guru in FieldFlo, and we will show you how to do it step by step.

Requirements

NOTE: In order to change your company guru, you must be a SuperAdmin. Only SuperAdmins will have access to the company module.

Here are the steps to changing your company guru:

  1. On the left hand side of your screen on the main menu, click on Company.

  2. Scroll down to the 'Company Guru' section and select your new guru from the drop-down menu

    • Your new guru must have login access to be selected from the drop-down menu

  3. Once you are finished, press Save in the bottom right corner

data.title: How Do I Create a Scheduling Group?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to create Scheduling Groups.
data.body:
It is very easy to create a Group to use in the Scheduling Module within FieldFlō.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have "Full Scheduling Access" permissions to create Groups in Scheduling.

Information

Groups are used in the Scheduling Module to quickly Schedule multiple employees, who typically work together, to a project without having to select the employees individually.

Follow the steps below to create Scheduling Groups:

  1. Select Scheduling on your left main menu.

  2. Click on Settings.

  3. At the top of the Scheduling Settings page click the three dots and select Scheduling Groups.

  4. Click the blue button that says "+ Add Group".

  5. Enter a Group Name, select the Employee's names that you want added to this Group, and press Save to create the Group.

  6. You can Edit or Remove Groups by clicking the 3 dots adjacent to the Group name on the Scheduling Groups page.

data.title: How To Add Default Folder Structure To Projects
data.description: This article will walk you through how to add the default folder structure to a project.
data.body:
With just a few steps, you will be able to organize your project's documentation.

Here are the steps on how to add the default folder structure to projects:

  1. First find the project you would like to add the default folder structure. Click on Projects.

2. Search for your project by using the Filtering options.

  • Once you find the project click on it to go into it.

3. Proceed to click on the 3 dots located on the right side of your project dashboard to open up the project menu.

  • Click on Documents.

4. In the document management section click on the 3 dots located on the right side of the screen

  • Click on COPY DEFAULT FOLDER STRUCTURE.

NOTE: Your default folder structure will copy over, and you can now proceed to save any documentation pertaining to the project.

data.title: How To Set Up Default Folder Structure
data.description: This article will walk you through how to set up the Default Folder Structure.
data.body:
It is easy to create and customize your default folder structure; this will allow you to keep your project document vault organized.

Requirements

NOTE: To be able to access and manage the default folder structure you must be a Super Admin user.

Information

Creating a default folder structure will allow you to set up the folder structure across all projects with the same layout.

NOTE: These are empty folders that can then be added to each project to save documentation.

To learn how to add the default folder structure inside the project click on this link:

How To Add Default Folder Structure To My Project

Here are the steps to set up your default folder structure:

  1. Find the Company Module on your left main menu. Click on Company.

2. Once inside the Company Module, click on the three dots located on the top right side of the screen.

  • From the pop-up menu click on Default Folder Structure.

3. In the Default Folder Structure module you are able to add a new folder by clicking on the "Add New Folder" blue button.

  • You are also able to edit/delete the existing folders by clicking on the Pencil icon to edit or the Trashcan icon to delete.

data.title: How Do I Clear Schedule Notifications?
data.description: This article will show you how to remove a note or denied schedule notification.
data.body:
You can clear your Schedule Notifications from FieldFlo in just a few easy steps.

Requirements

Note: The employee role of Full Scheduling Access must be enabled for this process.

Here are the steps to remove scheduling notifications:

  1. Click on the Calendar Icon at the top of your portal screen.

  2. Click on the week showing the conflict.

  3. Scroll to Crew and click on the Notepad on the employee to open the conflict.

  4. On the open schedule, check Confirmation Status and/or Employee Notes for issue.

  5. Adjust the employee per the note if applicable.

  6. Click the radio bubble for Clear Notifications and click save.

  7. If an adjustment has been made, click on Crew tab.

  8. Click radio bubble beside employee and click send schedule icon.

data.title: How Do I See A Report of Employee Certificates?
data.description: This article will tell you how to run a report of all employee certificates.
data.body:
You can pull a report of all of your employees certificates and their status in just a few quick steps.

Requirements

Note: The employee roles of View Employees and View Certs must be enabled.

Here are the steps to run an employee certification report:

  1. Click Certification then Certificates on the left menu.

  2. Click Report on the right side of the screen.

  3. Click the option you want on how to be notified.

  4. Once the report is done, open Excel File.

  5. View your trainings in 2 different ways

    1. Training Matrix: Show you a key for the different certs and their status.

    2. Certificate Summary: Allows you to filter by name, cert or date.

data.title: How Do I Download Certificates for All Employees?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to download certificates for all employees .
data.body:
This article will teach you how to download a lot of all employee certificates in just a few simple steps.

Requirements

Note: You must have the roles of View Employees, Edit Certs and View Certs must be enabled in an employee to pull these certificates.

Information

If you would like to learn how to pull certificates based on a Project and who worked on the Project, click the button below:

How Do I Pull Certificates on a Project Level?

Here are the steps to downloading inactive employee certificates:

  1. Click on Certification then Certificates from the left menu.

    Note: Click on the +Filter button and change Status to Inactive.

    Add any additional filters (Employees, Cert Names, etc) needed.

    Note: You can pull a max of 100 certifications at a time. Scroll to the bottom of the page and change to view 100 items. Then scroll back to the top and click the Select All radio button

  2. Click the radio button next to the name(s) or click the button to the left of First Name to select all names/certificates on the page.

  3. Click the 3 dots at the end of the status row then select download to pdf or zip.

  4. You will need to repeat steps 5 & 6 for each page of items.

data.title: How Do I Use the CRM Approver Option for Proposals?
data.description: This article will show you how to set up the CRM Approver option for Proposals.
data.body:
FieldFlo allows you to decide who can approver your proposals inside of a Lead with just a few steps.

Requirements

Note: Only a Super Admin is able to make the changes needed to set up the CRM Approver functionality for Proposals.

Information

To learn how to set Employee Roles click here to see the steps.

Here are the steps to setting up a CRM Approver

  1. Click Company and scroll to the Other section and click CRM Proposal Approval Required and save.

  2. Set the employee role as CRM Approver and save.

Here are the steps needed for the Approve Proposal

  1. Once your proposal is ready, click the 3 dots and Approve Proposal.

  2. The CRM Approver will approve the proposal.

  3. Once approved, you can email or mark as sent and proceed with the Proposal process.

data.title: How Do I Share A Project Level Document To An External Person?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to share a file or folder to someone outside of your organization for a specific project.
data.body:
FieldFlō now allows you the ability to share a public link to a specific file or folder, created by you, externally with just a few steps.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have the employee role to Edit/Delete/Share Docs under the Document System

Information

If you need to learn how to set an employee roles, you can do so under step four of this article: How Do I Give My Employee Login Access To FieldFlō.

Here are the steps to sharing a project level document:

  1. Navigate to Projects on the left menu

  2. Search by Project Name or Number to find your project and click anywhere to open it

  3. Click on the 3 dots in the right corner and select Document

  4. Find your company created Folder or File (it will be grey), click the 3 dots at the end of the row and select Share Public Link

  5. Use the Dropdown to select the correct permission and click Create

  6. The below message will appear on your screen, you can click the X to navigate out of that screen

  7. You can now add the URL link to an email or message to send.

Information

The above steps can be followed to copy the link again or unshare link.

Any files or folder that have been previously shared will show a link icon listed in the Shared/Gallery/Offline column.

data.title: How Do I Find a List Of My Clients?
data.description: This article will allow you to export a list of your clients for review and updating.
data.body:
You are able to export a list of your clients in a few easy steps.

Requirement

Note: Only a Super Admin is able to access the import tool in FieldFlo.

Here are the steps to download a client list:

  1. Click Admin then Imports on the left menu.

  2. Under the Export Area click Clients.

  3. This will populate an Excel sheet for download.

data.title: How Do I Create A Weekly Timesheet?
data.description: This article will walk you through how to create a Weekly Timesheet.
data.body:
Sometimes you need to create a Weekly Timesheet, and with FieldFlō, this is very easy to do!

Requirements

Note: The user must have the Weekly Timesheet Role and Permission assigned to them in order for them to create a Weekly Timesheet.

Information

Submitting a Weekly Timesheet will create a closed Daily Timesheet. You can find and edit this Daily Timesheet in the Closed Form section of that specific Project.

Important

Note: After a Weekly Timesheets is Submitted, it can only be edited on the Daily Timesheet. Any edits to the Weekly Timesheet will not be reflected on Payroll Exports.

Here are the steps to creating a Weekly Timesheet

  1. On the left hand side of your screen, click on the Admin module and scroll down until you see Weekly Timesheet.

  2. Click Weekly Timesheet.

  3. Select the Employee that this Weekly Timesheet is for in the Employee Dropdown and select the Date from the Date From field and click the blue Start button.

  4. Click the blue + next to Projects

  5. A pop up will appear called "Add Projects". Go through the list and select all the Projects that you would like on this Employee's Weekly Timesheet.

  6. Once you have selected all of the Projects click Add.

  7. Now you can select the day for each of the Projects that you need to add time to and once the following field(s) are filled out for each day and Project, you can click the blue Submit Timesheet button:

    • Position

    • Start Time

    • End Time

    • Break

    Optional: If you need to split the time between two or more positions you can click on the blue + underneath the word "Note" and this will bring up an additional row to add the information.

  8. After you click the blue Submit Timesheet button, a pop up will appear called "Please Confirm". If everything is correct, click Yes.

data.title: How Do I Add More Than One Supervisor To A Project?
data.description: This article will walk you through adding more than one Supervisor to a project.
data.body:
Sometimes you need to have more than one supervisor assigned to a project and in FieldFlō, we have made this easy to do by following the steps below.

Requirements

Note: In order to add additional Supervisors to a project, you must have the Edit/Delete Projects role enabled.

Information

• Once Supervisors are added to a project, you can restrict their access and have them only be able to view project's that they are a Supervisor on. You can initiate this feature by changing their roles from View All Projects to View Assigned Projects.

Here are the steps to add more than one Supervisor to a project:

  1. On the left hand side of your screen click the Projects module.

  2. Find the project that you need to add an additional supervisor on and click on the project.

  3. Find the hyperlink that says Project Details and click on Project Details.

  4. On the Projects Details page, scroll down and click on the tab that says Assigned Personnel.

  5. Once on the Assigned Personnel tab, click in the Dropdown and select the employee or if you need to add more click + Add Employee. Once you are done adding employees click Save.

data.title: How Do I Export Project Photos
data.description: This article will walk you through exporting project photos.
data.body:
It is so easy to export project photos out of FieldFlō and this article will show you how!

Here are the steps to exporting project photos out of FieldFlō

  1. On the left hand side of your screen, Click on the Project module.

  2. Once on the Projects page, find the project that you want and click on the Project.

  3. Once inside the project click the 3 dots located on the top right side of the screen.

  4. A dropdown will appear. Click o Documents.

  5. Once on the Documents page, click on the folder called Form Images.

  6. Find the pictures that you want to download and click the radio button next to each of the photos that you want.

  7. Next click the 3 dots located underneath "List View", then click Download.

data.title: How Do I Upload Company Documents
data.description: This article covers how to upload company documents.
data.body:
This article covers how to upload company documents that your company has into FieldFlō making them available to all projects. It is easy to do. Just follow the steps below.

Requirements

Note: You must be setup as a super admin to upload Company Documents.

Information

Remember all of these docs flow over into every project

Here are the steps to see Company Documents

  1. On the left hand side of your screen, click on the Company module in the main menu.

  2. Once on the Company Page, click on the 3 dots on the top right of your screen.

  3. A dropdown will appear. Click on Company Documents.

  4. This will take you to the Company Documents page and you can click on +Add Folder (this will allow you to create a new folder) or click on + Add Files (this will allow you to upload files).

data.title: How Do I See Company Documents
data.description: This article covers how to see company documents.
data.body:
This article covers how to see company documents that your company has uploaded into FieldFlō making them available to all projects. It is easy to do. Just follow the steps below.

Requirements

Note: This only works for documents that have been uploaded in the Company Documents Library. If you want to learn "How To Upload Documents To The Company Library, click on this button below:

How Do I Upload Company Documents

Information

Remember all of these docs flow over into every project.

Here are the steps to see Company Documents

  1. On the left hand side of your screen, click on the Company module in the main menu.

  2. Once on the Company Page, click on the 3 dots on the top right of your screen.

  3. A dropdown will appear. Click on Company Documents.

  4. This will take you to the Company Documents page and you can click on any of the folders or documents to see them.

data.title: How Do I Require Employee Verification of Schedule?
data.description: This article will teach you how to require your employees to verify their schedules.
data.body:
Getting a confirmation of employee schedules has never been easier! With just a few steps, you can make sure that your employees know exactly where they need to be on a daily basis and have the employee verify that they are going to be there.

Requirements

Note: You must have Full Scheduling Access enabled in your employee details to view the Scheduling module.

  1. Click on Scheduling on the left menu and select Settings from the list.

  2. On the Settings page, you will need to enable the radio button by Confirmation.

  3. Click Save at the bottom of the page.

NOTE: By enabling Confirmation, several things will now happen when the schedule is sent.

  • Employees will have the option to Approve or Deny their schedule.

  • Your employees will have a color that corresponds to a status.

    • Click on the Crew/Asset View to show all employees.

      • White - No schedule sent or a change was made

      • Yellow - Pending approval

      • Red - Denied or Conflict

      • Green - Confirm

data.title: How Do I Enter An Inventory Budget for Job Costing
data.description: This article will walk you through how to enter a project's estimated inventory budget for Job Costing.
data.body:
It's easy to enter your estimated inventory budget on your projects and this article will walk you through the steps on how to do it!

Requirements

NOTE: In order to enter estimated inventory costs on a project you need to have access to the project, as well as Job Costing permissions. If you do not see the Job Costing Widget on your Project's Dashboard, please contact your Company's FieldFlō Guru and request Job Costing access.

Information

You might be wondering "what is Job Costing?" Job Costing is a module in FieldFlō where you can track your project costs and compare them to your estimate or budget. You can compare your Project's Estimated Costs vs. Actual Costs for Labor, Materials, Equipment, Waste, etc.


Here are the steps to entering estimated Inventory costs:

  1. Navigate to your project.

  2. Click the View Details hyperlink next to Job Costing on the Dashboard.

  3. Scroll down to Inventory Estimates section.

  4. Enter Budgets for Consumables, Materials, Tools, Equipment, Heavy Equipment, Respirators, and Rentals.

  5. Scroll down to bottom and click SAVE.

  6. Back on Project Dashboard, click Job Costing.

  7. View Inventory Estimates vs Actuals.

Actual inventory costs are automatically populated in the Job Costing module using data from the "Warehouse Request" forms and inventory Quick Transfers. This helps ensure that your cost tracking remains accurate and up-to-date.

data.title: How Do I Add Per Diem To A Project
data.description: This article will teach you how to set up and approve your hourly or daily Per Diem on your projects.
data.body:
FieldFlō allows you to auto apply your daily or hourly per diems on your job with just a few clicks as well as run reports for approvals. This article will walk you through what you need to do.

Requirements

Note: To update project details you must have the role to "Edit/Delete Projects".

Note: To pull the Per Diem Report, you must have "Can Run All Admin Reports".

  1. Click on Projects on the left side menu.

  2. Filter to find the correct project.

  3. Click on Project Details.

  4. Click on Per Diem, fill out the required information and click Save.

    1. Auto Apply to Timesheet means that everyone added to the timesheet will receive that amount.

  5. To pull the Per Diem Report, click Admin then Reporting Center.

  6. Under General Reports click Per Dem Report

  7. Enter Date From and click Generate

  8. This page is split into 2 sections, Project Summary which gives you the full amount being paid out to employees on a project and Project/Employee Summary which breaks down the employee and project and the daily or hourly amount given.

  9. You can click the Daily Rate amount, to update individual amounts to certain people on specific projects

  10. Update Per Diem to correct amount and click Submit.

  11. Once all amounts are confirmed, you can approve per diem.

  12. You can download CSV or PDF for your records.

data.title: How Do I Close or Put On Hold Multiple Projects?
data.description: This article will allow you to update a large number of projects to Closed or Put On Hold within your system.
data.body:
Being able to update multiple projects to a Closed or On Hold Status has never been easier. You can update that with just a few simple steps to help clean up your projects list and this article will walk you through how to do it.

Requirement

Note: In order to mass update projects you must have the Employee Roles to both Edit/Delete Project AND Close Project.

Here are the steps to close or put on hold multiple projects

  1. Click Projects on the left hand menu.

  2. At the bottom of the Projects page, change the view from 10 to 100 Items.

  3. Scroll through the list of Open Projects and select the Radio Buttons beside the jobs you need to put on hold or close.

  4. Once selected, click on the Three Dots and select the correct status you need the projects changed to.

  5. Click Yes to confirm you want to change the status.

  6. Click Ok on the notification for the number of projects that have been adjusted.

data.title: How Do I Inactivate/Activate Multiple Employee's?
data.description: This article will allow you to update a large group of employee's to active or inactive status within your system.
data.body:
In only a few clicks you can now activate or inactive multiple employees from your portal!

Requirements

Note: You will need the Employee Role to Edit Employee in order to mass update employee status

  1. Click on Employees on the left-hand menu.

  2. To filter an employee's status, update the Status dropdown to your need.

  3. Once you have filtered by the correct status, you can check the radio button next to each name individually, or, you can select the radio button at the top to select all employee's available.

  4. After selecting the employee's you want to inactivate/activate, select the three dots on the right-hand side and select Activate or Deactivate depending on your need.

  5. Select Yes to confirm the inactivation/activation of your employees.

  6. Select OK to clear the notification of the number of now active/inactive employees.

data.title: How Do I Auto-Populate Names On The Containment Log
data.description: This article will walk you through how to auto-populate employee names on the Containment Log. Names are transferred from the Timesheet.
data.body:
