It's easy to have Employee Names auto-populate on the Containment Log. This article will walk you though the steps to have employee names automatically from the Timesheet.

Requirements

Note: You must open a Timesheet and enter employee names. The Timesheet clock does not need to be started first.

Information

Names transferred from Timesheet will be highlighted in Pink. Pink will go away when log is Saved.

Click button below for instructions on how to fill out a Containment Log.

How to Complete a Containment Log

Here are the steps to automatically transfer Employee Names from the Timesheet to the Containment Log:

  1. Navigate to your Project.

  2. Select Start Day to add a Timesheet to Active Forms.

  3. Click on Timesheet to Open it.

  4. Add Employee's to Timesheet.

  5. Click 3 dots at the top right of your screen and select Back to Project.

  6. Open Containment Log.

  7. Select SAVE.

data.title: How Do I Complete A Containment Log
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps to completing FieldFlō's Containment Log.
data.body:
Completing FieldFlō's Containment log is very easy and article will walk you through the steps on how to do it!

Requirements

Note: To complete a FieldFlō's Containment Log you need the Roles/Permissions to Add/Edit Forms.

Information

FieldFlō's Containment Log can be digitally signed or PIN verified.

If your Company has set the Containment Log as a Mandatory Form, it will automatically show on your project when you click the Start Day button.
​
​Tip: You can learn how to auto populate employee names on your containment log by clicking this button:

Auto-populate Employee Names on Containment Log

Tip: The Same as Previous Feature is available on the Containment Log Form.

  • Select the 3 dots at the top right of your screen to apply information from the previous Containment Log.

Here are the steps to complete a Containment Log

  1. Navigate to your Project.

  2. Select the Button.

  3. Select bubble for Containment Log and click Save.

  4. Click on the Containment Log form.

  5. Fill-in the blanks.

    1. Label - Used to differentiate between other Cont. Logs in Closed Forms

    2. Work Area - Enter area where Containment is located

    3. Supervisor - Select Supervisor Name and Enter PIN

    4. Notes - Free Text Field for any information pertaining to Cont. Log

    5. Images - Attach/Upload Photos

    6. +Add Row - Adds rows for Employee Name entry

  6. Log Containment Entry Information: Employee Name, Resp. Type, Task, In/Out Times.

  7. Select bubble next to Name and then SMS phone icon to deploy verification text.

  8. Select Custom above Name field to enter non-employee entrant details and verification signature.

  9. You can also get Hand Signatures from Employees by changing the PIN field to a Signature Field.

  10. Click +Add Row to add additional entrants. Click Save to lock-in information and return to the Project.

  11. Close Containment Log by either clicking End Day or the Close Form icon.

data.title: How Do I Run A Job Costing Report
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to run a Job Costing report.
data.body:
Running a Job Cost report in FieldFlō is very easy. This article will walk you through the steps to running a report to view Job Costing Details in Excel format. With this report you can quickly compare your Estimated Costs vs Actual Costs for one or multiple projects at a time.

Requirements

The Job Costing Report is in the Reporting Center. To access the reporting center you must have the Role/Permission to Run all Admin Reports.

Information

Click the following button to view the steps on how to export a more detailed Job Costing report per Project:

How Do I Export Job Costing Estimates

Here are the steps to running a Job Costing Report:

  1. Click Admin on your Left Main Menu.

  2. The admin drop down will appear, scroll down and select Reporting Center.

  3. Select Job Costing Report.

  4. Select/Unselect radio buttons for Project Type and Projects to run the report for.

  5. On the top right, click Run Report.

data.title: How Do I Create And Send Messages
data.description: This article will walk you through all the steps to create and send messages from the Messaging Module.
data.body:
It is easy to create and send messages to your workforce from the FieldFlō messaging module. This article will walk you though the steps for creating and sending messages.

Requirements

Note: To use the Messaging Module you must have the Role/Permissions to "Create Messages".

Information

Messages can be deployed via Text message to all Employees with phone numbers in your FieldFlō portals.

Messages can also be deployed to User's Dashboards. Anyone with login access will be able to see these messages on their Main Dashboard.

Messages can be filtered by Type: Safety or Company.

Safety - messages that are related to Safety topics or Memos.

Company - any message that is not Safety related.

Tip: After message is Saved, Select View Message to view an example of your message.

Tip: Deploying messages to the Dashboard is great for Deadline reminders!

Here are the steps to creating and sending messages:

  1. Click Messages on your Left Main Menu.

  2. Use Search and Type Fields to filter previously created Messages.

  3. Click +Add Message.

  4. Enter message Subject and choose a Type.

  5. Click NEXT and select Message Content type: Text Block, Embed Video, Document, Link, Image, Title Block.

  6. Add additional Message Content Blocks as needed.

  7. Click NEXT.

  8. Select Deployment Types: SMS and/or Dashboard

    1. SMS - Sends text message to Employees

    2. Dashboard - Message is displayed on FieldFlo Dashboard for Users with Login access to see.

  9. Click Enroll Employee.

  10. Use Filters and select Employee Name Bubbles.

  11. Click ADD to add Employee Names to deployment list.

  12. Select Employee Name Radio Buttons and click Deploy to send message.

  13. Select the 3 little dotson your message to view, make edits, deploy to additional employees.

  14. Click Enroll/Enrolled to view read receipts.

  15. Return to Dashboard and scroll down to Message block to view messages deployed to Dashboard.

data.title: How Do I Default Labor Hours Widget to Mandays
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to change the default for the Labor Hours Widget to Mandays.
data.body:
It is very easy to change your Company Settings to default the Labor Hours Widget to Mandays.

Requirements

Note: You must have Super Admin Access to change this setting.

Information

Changing this setting will effect all projects on your FieldFlo portal.

Click the following button to learn how to toggle between Mandays and Labor Hours per Project:

Change Labor Hours to Mandays on Project's Dashboard

Here are the steps to defaulting all Project's Labor Hour Widgets to Mandays:

  1. Click Company on your Left Main Menu.

  2. Scroll to the bottom of Company Details and select the bubble for "Default to Mandays on Project Dashboard."

  3. Click Save to apply the change.

data.title: How Do I Change The Labor Hours Widget to Mandays
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to toggle between Labor Hours and Mandays on the Project's Dashboard.
data.body:
It is easy to change a project's Labor Hours Widget to display Mandays. The following article will walk you through the steps to view a project's Labors in Mandays instead.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have the Employee Role/Permission to "View Labor Hours Dashboard" to view the Labor Hours/Manday Widget.

Information

Mandays are calculated by dividing Labor Hours by 8.

8 Labor Hours = 1 Manday

Click the following button to view steps on how to default the Labor Hours Widget to Mandays.

Default Labor Widget to Mandays

Click the following button to learn how to enter a Labor Hour/Manday Budget.

How to Enter Labor Hour Budget

The following are the steps to change the Labor Hours Widget to Mandays:

  1. Navigate to a Project.

  2. Click on the Labor Hours Widget.

  3. Select Manday Bubble.

  4. View Mandays Bid, Actual, and Remaining.

  5. Click anywhere in Mandays Widget to return to Project's Dashboard.

data.title: How Do I Upload Document To Projects
data.description: This article explains how to upload documents to projects.
data.body:
It is easy to upload documents to projects within FieldFlo and this article will walk you through how to do it.

Requirements

Note: If you are trying to upload documents to FieldFlo Projects, you must have access to "Add Docs". If you do not have this access, you will have to reach out to your companies Super Admin for them to provide this access.

Information

You may be asking yourself what kind of documents you want to upload into FieldFlo. A couple of examples might be email communications, plans, photos etc.

Any of these items can be easily added by following the directions in this article.

Here are the steps to adding Documents to Projects in FieldFlo

  1. On the left hand side of your screen, click on the Projects Module.

  2. Find the project that you are looking for and click on the "Project".

  3. On the top right of the project, click the three little dots then click Documents.

  4. Once you are on the Document Management page of the project, you can either create folders by clicking +Add Folder or you can add the files by clicking +Add Files.

  5. If you click +Add Folders, the Add Folder pop out will appear. Enter the Folder Name and set the permissions for who should have access to the Folder. Then click Save.

  6. If you click +Add Files, the Add File pop out will appear and you can click Choose File and find the locate the files, photos etc., that you would like to add. You can also set the permissions for who should have access to these files here. Once done click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add Multiple Forms to a Project
data.description: This article will teach you how to enable multiple forms onto a specific project.
data.body:
In only a few clicks you will be able to add Multiples of either the Daily Timesheet and/or the PSI/JHA same form to your Project allowing labels for different Supervisors or Phases.

Requirement

Note: You must have the role to Edit/Delete Projects to adjust this project setting.

Information

Enabling multiple forms on a project will allow you to name each form by using the label.

Here Are the Steps to Setting Up Multiple Forms on a Project

  1. Click Projects on the left side of your screen.

  2. Filter to find the needed project and click on the Project.

  3. Click the Three Dots and select Details.

  4. Click on Settings under Project Details and select Yes in the dropdown under Allow Multiple Timesheets and/or Allow Multiple PSI/JHA.

  5. Click Save.

data.title: How Do I Enter Contract Values on Projects
data.description: This article will walk you through how to enter a project's contract value on FieldFlō.
data.body:
Entering a project's contract value is very easy and this article will walk you through the steps on how to do it!

Requirements

NOTE: In order to enter contract values on a project you need to have access to the project, permissions to view contract values, and access to the Job Costing module. If you do not see the Job Costing Widget on your Project's Dashboard, please contact your Company's FieldFlō Guru and request Job Costing access.

Information

You might be wondering what is Job Costing. Job Costing is a module in FieldFlō where you can track your project costs and compare them to your estimate or budget. You can compare your Project's Estimated Costs vs. Actual Costs for Labor, Materials, Equipment, Waste, etc.

Here are the steps to entering Contract Values:

  1. Navigate to your project.

  2. Click the View Details hyperlink next to Job Costing on the Dashboard.

  3. Click the field under Contract Value to enter dollar figure.

  4. Enter the project's contract value.

  5. Scroll to bottom of Job Costing and Click Save.

  6. On Project's Dashboard, to see detailed view of your Contract Value vs Current Project Cost, Click Job Costing widget.

data.title: How Do I Move Forms To a Different Project
data.description: This article will walk you through the steps on how to move forms from one project to another.
data.body:
It is very easy to move a Project's Form(s) to a different project. The following article will walk you through how to move one or multiple forms to a different project at the same time.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have the Employee Role/Permission to "Edit/Delete Closed Forms."

Forms can only be moved after they have been Closed.

Access to both the project with the forms that are to be moved and the project to which the forms are being moved is required.

Here are the steps to move completed forms to a different project:

  1. On your left main menu, click Projects.

  2. Search for your Project in the Quick Search Field.

  3. Click on the Project.

  4. From the Project Dashboard Click Closed Forms.

  5. Select the Bubbles next to the Form names that you would like to move to a different project.

  6. Select the red Move Forms button on the right side of your screen.

  7. Find the Project Name that you want to move the forms to.

  8. Select MOVE FORMS.

  9. A notification window will be displayed confirming that your forms were successfully moved.

data.title: How Do I Add a Form I Built to My Project?
data.description: This article will show you how to add your custom built form to your projects.
data.body:
In order to see the newly built form you just created, you will need to follow the below steps to make them available on your projects.

Information

If you would like to learn how to create custom forms for your company, you can email us at support@fieldflo.com to set up a training with your Customer Success Manager.

Here is a quick video that shows you how to make a form you built available to choose from on your Projects:
​


Here are your steps to adding your form to projects:

  1. On the left side of your screen click Projects.

  2. Click on your Three Admin Dots then select Global Forms Settings.

  3. Locate your custom built form and click the Radio Button under the Project Forms column to all the form to be used on the projects. If you would like to make the form Mandatory, click the radio button under the Mandatory Forms column."

  4. Click Save once you get all settings formatted.

data.title: How Do I Set Up Mandatory (Global) Forms on Projects
data.description: This article explains how you set up Global Form Settings that are required on a project at the start of every shift.
data.body:
Automatically setting up which forms will populate on all of your projects for your Supervisors to complete has never been easier.

Requirements

NOTE: In order to access Global Form Settings, you must have access as a Super Admin for your company.

Information

Global Form Settings will let you choose the mandatory forms and other forms that you would like to have available on all projects. With this option you won’t have to set up form settings every time a project is created. In the event that you would like a project to have different or additional forms from the ones selected on the Global Form Setting, you can do that using Project Level Form Settings. To set Project Level Form Settings, click here. FieldFlo provides two levels of form accessibility settings:

Information Global Form Settings will let you choose the mandatory forms and other forms that you would like to have available on all projects. With this option you won’t have to set up form settings every time a project is created. In the event that you would like a project to have different or additional forms from the ones selected on the Global Form Setting, you can do that using Project Level Form Settings. To set Project Level Form Settings, click here. FieldFlo provides two levels of form accessibility settings:

  • Global Form Settings: These settings apply to all projects by default, but individual forms can be excluded from specific projects.

  • Project-Level Form Settings: Forms can be explicitly included or excluded at the project level for finer control.

Here are the steps to set up Global Forms

  1. On the left hand side of your screen click Company.

  2. Under Company Detail, scroll down to the Other section, click the radio button to enable Default to Global Form Settings on New Projects then click Save.

  3. After saving your settings, click on Projects.

  4. Once in the project section you will click on the Three Dots (Admin Menu) and then click on Global Forms Setting.

  5. Once the window opens, click the radio button under the Mandatory Column of the form you want to require.

  6. Once you set your Mandatory Forms, you can scroll to the bottom and Save.

    FAQs about Global and Project-Level Form Settings

    What happens if I uncheck a form in Global Form Settings? If a form is deselected in Global Form Settings, it will no longer be accessible in projects relying solely on global defaults. However, the form will still be available in any project where it has been explicitly included via Project Level Form Settings. How does Global Form Settings work with Project-Level Form Settings? If all projects, except one target project, adhere to Global Form Settings, unselecting a form in the global settings will make it unavailable to all those projects. However, it will remain accessible in the target project if Project Level Form Settings are configured to include it. 7. If you wish to restrict a form to only one target project, locate the form in the Global Forms Setting and unselect the associated bubble (e.g., for the "Daily Field Report" form). 8. Scroll down and click Save to apply these restrictions. These changes ensure the form is excluded from other projects unless specified using Project Level Form Settings.

data.title: How Do I Set Up Project Level Form Settings
data.description: This article will teach how to set up Project Level Forms allowing you to have different or additional forms from the standard settings.
data.body:
FieldFlo makes it simple to manage and customize forms to suit your project's needs. This article will guide you specifically on setting up Project Level Form Settings while also giving you an overview of FieldFlo's form management capabilities.

Requirements

Note: In order to access Project Level Form Settings, you must have Edit/Delete Projects list as a role.

Information

Project Level Form Setting will let you customize the forms that you would like to have available on a specific project. With this option you can pick and choose the needed forms for a project. In the event that you would like to set up the same mandatory forms on all projects, you can do so with Global Form Setting. To set Global Form Settings, click here.

Additionally, FieldFlo provides two distinct levels of form settings to meet diverse user needs: Global Form Settings for overarching configurations across projects and Project-Level Form Settings for fine-tuned control within individual projects.

Here are the steps to set up Project Level Form Settings

  1. On your company dashboard left menu section you will find Projects and click on it.

  2. Filter to find the project needed and click Project that you want to add the Project Level Form Settings to.

  3. Once you are inside the project, click on Project Details.

  4. Once inside the Project Menu, you will need to click on Settings.

  5. Once you are inside the settings section, you will want to change the Form Settings to Project Level Form Settings. Scroll down until you see Form Settings and in the dropdown select Project Level Form Settings.

  6. Once completed, click Save

Additional Information About Form Management

FieldFlo also offers pre-created form templates that can simplify your workflow. Here are some important points to consider:

If you require a more tailored form, you have the option to create a new one rather than modifying an existing template. This approach preserves the standards set by the pre-created templates while allowing flexibility.

data.title: How Do I Give My Employee Login Access to FieldFlo?
data.description: This article will teach you how to give your employee access to FieldFlo.
data.body:
Giving an employee access to log into FieldFlō is simple if you follow the below steps.

Required

In order to give login access, you must have the Add Employee role enabled.

  1. Select Employees on the left side of your screen.

  2. Filter to find the employee in your Employee List and click in the Employee.

  3. Click the Radio Buttons for Active and Can Login and enter Email.

  4. Click on Employee Roles.

  5. To set your employees permissions either select a Role Profile in the dropdown or click the Radio Buttons for the items the employee needs access to.

  6. Click Save at the bottom.

  7. When the window reopens click Cancel.

  8. On that same employee, click on the Three Dots.

  9. On that dropdown, click Reset Password.

  10. Click Yes to confirm that you want to reset the password

  11. Click OK to confirm the notification

data.title: Template for "How Do I Create Articles In Intercom"
data.description: This article will explain how to create articles in Intercom. This is for internal use only
data.body:
It is easy to create articles for FieldFlo customers in Intercom and this article will walk you through exactly how to do it. Some items will require self judgment and have been detailed below. Remember every article should be written from the aspect of answering a customer's question.

Requirements (Should Use H1)

NOTE: The word "NOTE" should be bolded and the text should be normal sized and italicized.

The box color should be Red since this is a mandatory item.

Requirements call outs are at self discretion but should be thought through for every article.

Proper spacing is key. Make sure there is space between everything to make sure the article is easy to read and items are grouped together properly.

Information

This callout should be green and should be used for all general information or items that in general are helpful.

Items like definitions of fields or how we would recommend items to be used.

Text should be italicized.

Also this call out is where you should add links to other articles:

  1. Do this by clicking the Insert Button Icon

  2. Entering the Button Text

  3. Entering in the link

    Example Article

  4. You can also add Hyperlinks, but buttons are cleaner, so it is up to you

Information callouts are also at your discretion.

Here are the steps to writing an article in Intercom:

  1. Header for the "Here are the steps..." should be H1

  2. You should have a space between previous step and next step.

  3. All steps should have punctuation.

  4. Any time you are asking the customer to click on something make sure that you bold the text of the item that you are wanting them to click on.

    Example: On the left hand side of your screen you will see the Projects Module. Click on Projects.

  5. Videos can be added to articles.

  6. Videos need to show exactly what you are doing from start to finish.

  7. They also need to be published in Vimeo since that is the only thing that we have can be embedded into Intercom articles.

  8. CleanShotX is what we are using for screenshots.

  9. Pictures should be grouped and indented with the text they apply to.

  10. Pictures should be no wider than 550.

    • To adjust this, click on the picture and in the width field enter 550.

  11. Arrows used should be in this format and this color

    Note: The nice thing about CleanShotX is that it saves your settings from your previous session.

    • To adjust the arrow format, add your arrow to the screenshot by clicking on the arrow icon.

    • Once the arrow has been added to the screenshot, click on the arrow (arrow will be outlined in blue if you have selected it) and click arrow style icon. The Fancy Arrow should be selected

    • Adjust the thickness by click on the arrow (arrow will be outlined in blue if you have selected it) and then clicking on the Thickness Icon. The second option should be selected.

  12. Pictures should have rounded edges.

    • To do this click on:

      • Add Background Icon

      • Then click on Corners and enter 10 into the field.

data.title: How Do I Add Permits / Custom Notifications To A Project?
data.description: This article explains how to add Permits / Notifications to a Project.
data.body:
In only a few clicks you will be able to add Permits and Notifications to your Project. This allows you to be reminded of expiring permits, or this can be curated to anything you need to be notified about. This article will walk you through exactly how to do this!

Required

  • In order to add a Permit or Notification to a project, you must have the role to Edit/Delete Projects.
    ​

  • In order to receive email notifications for these permits, you must configure the "Permits / Notifications nearing expiration date" notification in your settings. To learn how to do this, click the link below!
    ​

    How Do I Setup Notifications?

Here are the steps for adding a Permit or Notification:

  1. Click Projects on your left main menu.

  2. Search by Project Name/Project Number to find your project, and click the Project to open it up.

  3. On the Project Dashboard click on Project Details.

  4. Click on Permits/Notifications on the left side of the screen then +Add Permit.

  5. Fill in the Required Permit Type/Name and all wanted information then click Save.
    ​
    ​Note: The Expiration Date entered here is the threshold for the "Permits / Notifications nearing expiration date" daily notification.

data.title: How Do I Enter Estimated Labor Hours
data.description: This article will walk you through how to enter a project's estimated labor hours or labor hour budget.
data.body:
It's easy to enter your estimated labor hours on your projects and this article will walk you through the steps on how to do it!

Requirements

NOTE: In order to enter estimated labor hours on a project you need to have access to the project, as well as Job Costing permissions. If you do not see the Job Costing Widget on your Project's Dashboard, please contact your Company's FieldFlō Guru and request Job Costing access.

Burden Rates will need to be set per Position to track Labor Costs.

Information

You might be wondering what is Job Costing. Job Costing is a module in FieldFlō where you can track your project costs and compare them to your estimate or budget. You can compare your Project's Estimated Costs vs. Actual Costs for Labor, Materials, Equipment, Waste, etc.


Here are the steps to entering estimated labor hours

  1. Navigate to your project.

  2. Click the View Details hyperlink next to Job Costing on the Dashboard.

  3. Click + Labor Estimate.

  4. Enter Labor Estimate per Position.

    NOTE: If Burden rate is not set Position Cost will display $0.00. Follow these steps to Set Position Burden Rate.

  5. Click Save.

  6. Scroll to bottom of Job Costing and Click Save.

  7. On Project's Dashboard, Click Labor Hours widget to see detailed view of your Labor Estimate vs. Actuals.

data.title: How Do I Submit New Ideas To FieldFlō
data.description: This article walks you through submitting new ideas to FieldFlō
data.body:
You may have an amazing idea that would make your FieldFlō experience even better. This article will walk you through how to submit your ideas to FieldFlō using Canny.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have access to the "Can Access FieldFlo Feedback System" or be a Super Admin.

Here are the steps to submitting an idea to FieldFlō:

  1. On the left hand side of your FieldFlō portal, scroll down and click FieldFlo.

  2. Underneath FieldFlo you will see Submit a Feature Idea! & Learn what's New! Click Submit a Feature Idea! & Learn what's New!

  3. You will be taken to the "Submit a feature idea!" screen.

  4. Scroll to the bottom and click the Submit your feature Idea now! button.

  5. On the Canny screen, you will see the all the categories. Click on the category that best supports your idea. (For this example we are going to use Payroll).

  6. On this screen you will want to fill out the:

    • Short, Descriptive Title

    • Description

    • Category

    • Attach Pictures

  7. When all the above is done, click Submit Idea.

data.title: How Do I Edit An Existing Certification
data.description: This article covers how to edit an existing certification.
data.body:
Certifications in FieldFlō can be easily edited and this article will walk you through exactly how to do this.

Requirements

NOTE: You must have access to the Certificates module or you must be a Super Admin.

Here are the steps to editing an existing Certificate

  1. On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click Certification.

  2. Underneath Certification, you will see Certificates. Click Certificates.

  3. Find the Certificate that you would like to edit. On the far right side of the Certificate you will see three little dots. Click the three little dots.

  4. In the pop-up menu you will see the word Edit. Click Edit.

  5. Once you click Edit, the Edit Certificate pop-out will appear. Now you're able to make the necessary changes.

  6. When all changes are made, scroll down and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Change Someone That Accidentally Marked Themselves As Injured
data.description: This article covers how to edit someone's answer if they accidentally marked themselves as injured.
data.body:
Sometimes employee's accidentally mark themselves as injured. This article walks you through exactly how to fix it.

Requirements

Note: You must have access to adjust timecards or you must be a Super Admin

Here are the steps to changing someone from injured to not injured:

  1. On the left hand side of your screen click Projects.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you have found the Project, click on the Project.

  4. Find the Daily Time Sheet that has the Employee that accidentally marked as injured and click on the Daily Timesheet.

    Note: The Daily Timesheet you are looking for may be in closed forms, so if the Daily Timesheet is no on the Open Forms tab, you will want to look on the closed forms tab as well.

  5. Find the Employee that has the + Injured and click on the Employee.

  6. The Employee details will expand and the on the far right side you will see the Injured? Edit hyperlink. Click the Edit hyperlink.

  7. The Change Injured For: Employee Name pop-up will appear. Click the radio button for No then click Submit.

data.title: How Do I Reset My Own PIN
data.description: This article walks you through how to reset your own PIN
data.body:
It is easy to reset your own PIN and this article will walk you through exactly how to do it.

Requirements

NOTE: In order to change your Employee PIN, you must be able to log into FieldFlō. If you do not have access to log into FieldFlō, you will need to contact your company's FieldFlō guru.

Information

You might be wondering, "What is a PIN?" A PIN is an employees Personal Identification Number. This number is what an employee will use as their Legal Signature when verifying:

  • Daily Timesheets

  • PSI / JHA / SPA

  • Inspection Forms

  • etc.

You may be wondering, "Who needs a PIN?" All employees need a PIN.

Or maybe you are asking, "How do I know what the PIN should be?" FieldFlo recommends that you use the last 4 digits for an employees Social Security. The reason(s) we recommend this are:

  • It is easier for Admins to set these up because they probably have access to this already

  • It is easier for an employee to remember

  • It is a legally bound number to the employee

  • It is less likely that an employee will be willing to share this confidential number with their fellow employees

Here are the steps to resetting your own PIN:

  1. Click on your image or blue circle in the bottom left corner and this will bring up your profile.

  2. Scroll down and click on "Edit Pin" at the bottom right of your screen.

  3. Enter your PIN and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Turn On The Full Version Of The Incident System Form
data.description: This article will walk you through how to turn on the full version of the Incident Form.
data.body:
FieldFlō has a full version of the Incident System Form and this article will walk you through turning this on for others.

Requirements

Note: You must be a Super Admin to turn this on for others.

Here are the steps to turning on the full version of the Incident System Form:

  1. On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click Employees.

  2. Search for the Employee in the Quick Search Field.

  3. Once you have found the Employee, click the 3 little dots and click Edit, or you can simply click on the Employee.

  4. On the left hand side of the Edit Employee screen, click Employee Roles.

  5. Under the Projects header, you will see the Incident System Full Form. Click the Radio Button next to Incident System Full Form.

  6. Lastly, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Create Custom Fields In FieldFlō
data.description: This article walks you through creating custom fields in FieldFlō.
data.body:
You can create 6 custom fields in FieldFlō's Project Settings. This article walks you through creating the custom fields.

Requirements

Note: You must be a Super Admin to add custom fields in FieldFlō.

Information

Note: You can only add up to 6 at this time. In the future, we may allow more but it is not possible at this time.

Here are the steps to adding custom fields in FieldFlō in Project Settings:

  1. On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click Company.

  2. Scroll down until you see the Project Settings header, and in the Custom Field Label fields, you can enter the name of the field.

  3. After you entered the name, select your Custom Field Section.

  4. After selecting Custom Field Sections, you will see drop-downs. Select the appropriate area within projects that you would like the field to be located on.

  5. Once you have completed the name and section, scroll down and click Save.

data.title: How Do I See A List Of Every Employee That Has Ever Worked On A Project
data.description: This article will walk you through exactly how to see every employee that has ever worked on a Project
data.body:
FieldFlō has lots of reporting capabilities. One of which, is how to see all the employees that have ever worked on a project. In order to see all them employees that have ever worked on a project you will need to access the Basic Report from the Payroll Export Module. This article will walk you through exactly how to pull this report!

Requirements

Note: You must have access to the Payroll Export Module.

Here are the steps to pull the Basic Report from the Payroll Export Module:

  1. On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click Payroll.

  2. You will see Payroll Exports appear. Click Payroll Exports.

  3. On the Payroll Reports screen you need to select "Basic Report" in the Type dropdown.

  4. Next you will need to select you date range by entering a date in the Date From and Date To fields.

  5. You can run this report for a specific Project or multiple Projects by entering the information in the Projects selection fields / drop-downs or by selecting a specific Project radio button.

  6. To see every Employee that has ever worked on a Project you need to leave all Employees selected.

  7. Lastly, click Run Report.

data.title: How Do I Turn On The FieldFlō Incident Management System (Beta)
data.description: This article covers exactly how to turn on the Incident Management System (Beta).
data.body:
FieldFlō has made it very easy to turn on the Incident Management System (Beta), and this Article will walk you through exactly what to do.

Requirements

Note: You must be a Super Admin in FieldFlō to turn this feature on.

Here are the steps to turning on the Incident Management System (Beta)

  1. On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click on Company.

  2. Once you are on the Company Details page, scroll down until you see Enable Incident System (BETA) and click the Radio Button to turn this on.

data.title: What Do I Do If An Employee Is Not Receiving Text Messages
data.description: This article will cover exactly what to do to ensure that employees are receiving text messages.
data.body:
If an employee is not receiving text message, there are several things that you can try. This article will walk you through exactly what to do.

NOTE: If the employee is receiving text messages but is not able to check-in on their device, the employee may have location services turned off. Here are a few options for getting this turned on based on the operating system of the device:

  • Android Devices: https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/3467281?hl=en

  • Apple Devices: https://support.apple.com/en-us/102647

NOTE: If sms messages fail 10 times in a row, then opt out will be auto selected. If selected, sms messages will no longer be sent to this phone number. If Opt Out is un-selected, then sms messages will resume sending again. Keep in mind, if 10 failed delivers in a row happen again, it will auto mark as Opt Out. If this happens the employee must contact his mobile carrier.

Here are the steps to take if any employee is not receiving text messages:

  1. The first thing you should do is check FieldFlo to see if the Employee has the "SMS Opt Out" radio button checked on their Employee profile.

    • On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click on Employees.

    • Find the Employee that is having the issue and click on the Employee.

    • Scroll down until you see "SMS Opt Out". If this is checked, uncheck it.

  2. The next thing you should do is check to see if the Employee has blocked the FieldFlo number on their phone. The FieldFlo phone number is 833.341.3939. If the number has been blocked, you will need to have the Employee unblock it.

  3. The next thing you should do is have the Employee save the FieldFlo number to their contact list. This will help the Employee avoid marking the number as "junk".

  4. If the Employee is still not receiving text messages, you should have the employee text the word "Unstop" to the FieldFlo number.

  5. If the above options have not worked, the Employee will need to contact their cell phone service provider and ask them to unblock messages coming from the FieldFlo number.

data.title: How Do I Show or Hide The Photo Gallery
data.description: This article walks you through showing or hiding your Photo Gallery.
data.body:
FieldFlo allows you to show or hide your company's Photo Gallery and this article walks you through exactly how to do this.

Here are the steps to show or hide the Photo Gallery:

  1. On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click on Company.

  2. Scroll all the way to the bottom section and check / uncheck the Radio button that says "Enable Project Gallery".

  3. Click Save.

data.title: How Do I Create An Inspection Form
data.description: This article walks you through creating your own Inspection Form.
data.body:
FieldFlo allows you to create your own custom inspection form, and this article will walk you through exactly what to do.

Here are the steps to creating an Inspection Form

  1. On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click Admin.

  2. Several items will appear under Admin. Scroll down and click Portal Admins.

  3. Once on the Portal Admins page, scroll down to the Safety section and click INSPECTION MGMT.

  4. On the top right of the Inspection MGMT page, click + Add Inspection .

  5. The Add Inspection Type pop out will appear and there are a few mandatory fields that are visibly marked with a red *. The mandatory fields are:

    • Name (this should be the description of the Inspection Form)

    • Type (the types available are Regular, Equipment and Inventory Item)

  6. Click Save.

    NOTE: FieldFlo recommends not to click the Active radio button until you have finished creating the Inspection Form.

  7. Now that you have finished adding the Inspection Type, click inside the Name field and type in the first few letters of your newly added Inspection Type and hit Enter on your keyboard.

  8. Once you find the Inspection Type, click the three little dots on the right hand side of the Inspection Type.

  9. The Inspection Type Admin will dropdown. Click Edit Section.

  10. Now you should be on the Inspection Sections page. Click + Add Section.

  11. The Add Inspection Section pop out will appear. Click inside the Name field to name your Inspection Section.

  12. Next, you need to add a Weight.
    ​NOTE: The total combined Weight of all the sections your create must total to 100. For example, if you have 4 sections, each section should have a Weight of 25.

  13. Click Save.

  14. Repeat these steps for all the Sections you have.

  15. Once you have finished adding all of your Sections, on the right hand side of each Section, you will see three little dots. Click the three little dots.

  16. The Admin dropdown will appear. Click Edit Questions.

  17. Now you are on the Inspection Section Questions page. Click + Add Questions.

  18. The Question field is mandatory and is visibly marked by a red *. Click inside the Question field and type in the Question you want to ask.

  19. Click Save.

  20. Repeat these steps for all the Questions you have.

  21. Once you have finished adding all of your Inspection Sections and Inspection Questions, go back to the Inspection MGMT page, find your newly created Inspection and click on the Inspection.

  22. The Edit Inspection pop out will appear. Click the Active radio button and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Find Reports?
data.description: This article will show you to where to find all reporting options.
data.body:
FieldFlō has many different types of reports that are ready to use. This article will walk you through exactly where to find them!

Required

In order to access reports in the Reporting Center, you must have the Run all admin Reports role enabled

Information

Learn how to run Payroll reports by clicking the button below!
​

How Do I Export Payroll?


Here are the steps to finding Reports:

  1. On the left hand side of your screen, click on the Admin module.

  2. Several items will dropdown below Admin. Scroll down and click on Reporting Center.

  3. When your Reporting Center is open, you're able to pick from the Reports given.

  4. Another option for finding Reports is to click the Reporting Center Icon at the top of your screen.

  5. This Reporting Center Icon will take you to the same Reporting Center and will have the same Report options.

data.title: How Do I Add / Edit A Certification Category
data.description: This article walks you through adding and editing Certification Categories.
data.body:
It is very easy to add or edit Certification Categories and this article will walk you through exactly how to do it!

Here are the steps to adding a Certification Category

  1. On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click on Certification.

  2. The Certification module will expand. Click on Certificates.

  3. You will be taken to the Certificates page. On the top right of the Certificates page, click the three little dots.

  4. The admin dropdown will appear. Click Cert Names.

  5. Click the + Add Cert Name button.

  6. Enter the Cert Name in the Cert Name field and click Save.

Here are the steps to editing a Certification Category

  1. On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click on Certification.

  2. The Certification module will expand. Click on Certificates.

  3. You will be taken to the Certificates page. On the top right of the Certificates page, click the three little dots.

  4. The Admin dropdown will appear. Click Cert Names.

  5. Find the Certification Name that you want to change by searching the name in the search bar or scroll to find the Certificate. Click on the three little dots on the right hand side of the Certification Name that you want to edit.

  6. The Certification Name admin dropdown will appear. Click Edit.

  7. Edit the Cert Name and click Save.

data.title: How To Setup The FieldFlo Offline Application
data.description: This article will walk you through setting up the FieldFlo Offline Application.
data.body:
It is very easy to setup the FieldFlo offline app, and this article walks you through exactly what to do.

Information

NOTE: The FieldFlo offline application can be dowloaded from either the:

Android App Store
Apple App Store

NOTE: This allows Supervisors / Foreman / Superintendents to fill out paperwork offline and will upload the data to your Company's FieldFlo portal once the device has internet service.

Here are the steps to setting up the FieldFlo Offline Application

  1. After you have downloaded the FieldFlo offline application to your device, you will be asked for your company's QR Code.

  2. On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click Company module.

  3. Once on the Company Details page, scroll down and scan the Set Data for Mobile App QR Code.

    Note- The first time the app is used it will need to download a lot of data, so it is best to do this when your device is on WiFi. It can take several minutes to download this data if there is a lot of data to download.

data.title: How Do I Setup Email Notifications For Closed Forms
data.description: This article walks through setting up email notifications for Closed Forms.
data.body:
Email Notifications for Closed Forms can be very useful and this article will walk you through how to receive these!

Here are the steps to setup email notifications for Closed Forms

  1. On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click the Projects module.

  2. On the top right of the Project module, click the three little dots.

  3. The Admin menu will dropdown. Click on Global Forms Settings.

  4. The Global Forms Settings pop out will appear and next to each of the forms, you will see a radio button for Closed Form Settings. Click the Closed Form Settings radio button.

  5. Just to the right of the Closed Form Settings radio button you will see a gear, click the Gear to setup Email Notifications for the form.

  6. Another Closed Form Settings pop out will appear, follow the steps given.

    Note:

    Step 1- This step is selecting the format of the Email Notification that is sent, you can edit Email Templates in your Admin section in FieldFlo.

    Step 2- This step is selecting who will receive the Email Notification, you can chose by Email groups, Key Project Personnel, and your Admins. You can edit Email groups under your Admin section in FieldFlo, also can edit Key Project Personnel and Admin access under the Employee section.

    View Restrictions- This sets up who can view these Closed Forms.

  7. Scroll down and click Save.

  8. Once you have clicked save, you will be taken back to the Global Forms Settings pop out. Repeat step 5 and step 6 for each of the forms you want to receive Email Notifications for.

  9. After you are done with the setup for all of your forms, scroll to the bottom of the Global Forms Setting pop out and click Save.

data.title: How Do I Add Union Skill Levels
data.description: This article walks you through adding Union Skill Levels.
data.body:
FieldFlo makes it easy to add Union Skill Levels, and this article walks you through what to do.

Here are the steps for adding Union Skill Levels

  1. On the left side, in the main menu click the Employee module.

  2. On the top right of the screen click the Three Little Dots.

  3. The Employee Admin menu will appear. Click Union Skill Levels.

  4. You will be taken to the Union Skill Levels page. Click the blue + Union Add Skill Levels button.

  5. The Add Union Skill Levels pop out will appear. Enter a Union Skill Level in the Union Skill Level field and enter the Description in the Description field.

  6. Click the blue Save button.

data.title: How Do I Add A Position Group
data.description: This article will walk you through how to add a Position Group.
data.body:
Position Groups are convenient because they allow you to group positions together. You can then choose which groups are available on each project, which will narrow down the list of positions you have to choose from. It is very easy to add a Position Group in FieldFlo and this article covers exactly what you need to do!

Required

In order to add Position Groups, you must have the Edit Employee role enabled.

Here are the steps to add a Position Group:

  1. On the left side, in the main menu click the Employee module.

  2. On the top right of the screen click the Three Little Dots.

  3. The Employee Admin menu will appear. Click Positions.

  4. Click on the blue Positions Groups button.

  5. You will be taken to the Positions Groups page. Click + Add Groups

  6. The Add Groups pop out will appear. Enter the Group Name in the Group Name field.

  7. Click the Add Position dropdown and select all of the Positions you want to add to the Position Group.

  8. Once you have selected all of the positions you want added to the Position Group, click the blue Save button.

data.title: How Do I Add A Position
data.description: This article walks you through how to add a Positions.
data.body:
It is very easy to add a Position in FieldFlo and this article covers exactly what you need to do!

Here are the steps to add a Positions :

  1. On the left side, in the main menu click the Employee module.

  2. On the top right of the screen click the Three Little Dots.

  3. The Employee Admin menu will appear. Click Positions.

  4. Click on the blue + Add Positions button.

  5. The Add Positions pop out will appear. Click the Active radio button, then enter the Position Name in the Position Name field.

  6. Fill out any information in any of the other fields that may apply:

    1. Position Code / Cost Code

    2. Misc Code

    3. Misc Code 2

    4. Burden Hourly Rate

    Note - (Optional) You can also select the Omit from overtime calculation radio button if you do not want this Position to have overtime calculated. Example: This is great to use if you are creating PTO , Vacation, Drive Time, Misc. Non Work, Sick or Holiday type Positions.

  7. Click Save to add your Position

data.title: How Do I Add Skills
data.description: This article covers how to add Skills in FieldFlo
data.body:
FieldFlo makes it easy to add Skills, and this article walks you through what to do.

Here are the steps for adding Skills

  1. On the left side, in the main menu click the Employee module.

  2. On the top right of the screen click the Three Little Dots.

  3. The Employee Admin menu will appear. Click Skills.

  4. You will be taken to the Skills page. Click the blue + Add Skill button.

  5. The Add Skill pop out will appear. Click the Active radio button, then enter the Skill Name in the Skill Name field.

    Note - (Optional) you can select radio buttons next to each of the certifications that this skill applies to, but this is not required.

  6. Scroll to the bottom and click the blue Save button.

data.title: How Do I Setup Notifications?
data.description: This article explains how to setup notifications from FieldFlo,
data.body:
FieldFlo can send you notifications via email, and this article explains exactly where to go and how to start receiving these.

Information

  • The Daily Notifications section send out emails from FieldFlo twice a day. Once at 7:05am and once at 7:05pm.

  • The Instant Notifications section send out instant emails from FieldFlo.

Here are the steps to setting up notifications

  1. On your company dashboard on the top right side of the screen find the Gear icon and click on the Gear icon.

  2. You will be taken to the Settings page. Click the Radio button next to each item that you want to receive email notifications from FieldFlo on.

  3. Once you have chosen your notifications click on the blue Save button and you will start receiving email notifications from FieldFlo.

data.title: How Do I Create A Closeout Report
data.description: This article will walk you through creating a Close Out Document.
data.body:
FieldFlo has made it very easy for you to create Closeout Report, and this article will walk you through exactly what to do.

Here are the steps to creating a Closeout Report

  1. One the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click the Projects module.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you have found the project click on the Project.

  4. If the Project is complete, you have uploaded any needed Project documents, you are ready to close the project and you are ready to generate a Closeout Report, click the Three Little Dots on the top right of your screen.

  5. The Project Admin menu will appear. Click Close Project.

  6. The Please Confirm? popup will appear. Click the Yes & Create Closeout Report button.

  7. You will be taken to the Generate Closeout Report - Step 1 page. Click the Radio Button next to each portion that you want to include in you Closeout Report. Examples: Daily Forms, Permits, Certifications, any documents that you have uploaded in the document vault of a project, etc.

    Note - You may want to upload a photo of you choosing to change the cover page, but note that the picture must be a JPG and must fit the following specifications: 1500px x 750px - max 6MB.

  8. Now that you have selected everything that you want to include, click the blue GO TO NEXT STEP button.

  9. You will be taken to the Generate Closeout Report - Step 2 page. Review your COVER PAGE & TABLE OF CONTENTS.

  10. If everything looks good, enter your Email Address in the Enter Email Addresses field.

  11. Click on the blue Submit button and FieldFlo will send you an email letting you know that the closeout document is ready for download.

  12. After a few minutes check your email. Once you receive the email from FieldFlo, click on the email link that will take you back to the project in FieldFlo.

  13. Click the Three Little Dots on the top right of your screen, and click on Closeout Report.

  14. The CLOSEOUT REPORT ALREADY EXISTS popup will appear. Click the Download Current button.

  15. After your download finished you will be able to save it to your device and send it to your clients.

data.title: How Do I Add Cost Types To The Expense Form Dropdown?
data.description: This article explains how to add cost types to the Expense Form dropdown.
data.body:
Adding Cost Types allows you to complete an Expense Form with specific types of company costs. After these cost types are entered, they will show up in the "Cost Type" drop-down while completing an Expense Form. It is very easy to add cost types in FieldFlo, and this article explains exactly what to do!

Required

In order to add new Cost Types, you must have the Job Costing Estimate role enabled.

Here are the steps to adding cost types to the Expense Form Dropdown:

  1. Click Admin on your left main menu.

  2. From the Admin dropdown, Click Portal Admins.

  3. Scroll down to the Expense section, select Cost Types.

  4. From here, you can see all of the existing cost type options, and if you want to add new cost types click the blue + Add Cost Type button.

  5. The Add Cost Type pop out will appear.
    ​Note - You will need to enter the required fields :

    a. Code

    b. Name

  6. Click Save.

    Now your new cost type(s) will be options while completing the Expense Form:

data.title: How Do I Change My Company's Logo
data.description: This article explains how to change your company's logo.
data.body:
It's very easy in FieldFlo to change your company's logo, and this article will walk you through how.

Here are the steps to changing your company's logo

  1. Click Company on the left main menu.

  2. Scroll down where you see the "Logo" section.

  3. Click "Choose File" and choose your jpg file of your Logo.

data.title: How Do I Send Closed Forms?
data.description: This article covers how to send closed forms.
data.body:
FieldFlo makes it easy to send closed forms, and this article will walk you through what to do!

Here are the steps to send open forms

  1. One the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click the Projects module.

  2. You can scroll down to find your project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you have found the project click on the Project.

  4. To see your Closed Forms, click the Closed Forms tab.

  5. You can filter for specific forms by the Type dropdown, by Label or the Date dropdown.

  6. Select the Radio Button next to each of the forms that you want to send or you can click the Radio Button on the left side above the forms to select all of them.

  7. After you have selected all the closed forms that you want to send, click the blue Send Form button.

  8. The Send Forms menu will appear and you can select an Email Group in the Email Group dropdown, or you can add a Custom Email in the Add Email Field and click the + button to add more emails individually.

  9. You will then select a Template in the Template dropdown.

  10. Click Send.

data.title: How Do I Send Open Forms?
data.description: This article covers how to send open forms.
data.body:
FieldFlo makes it easy to send open forms, and this article will walk you through what to do!

Here are the steps to send open forms

  1. One the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click the Projects module.

  2. You can scroll down to find your Project. Or filter your options by Project Name, Project Number or Client Name. If you would like more filtering options, click the blue + Filter button and select any of the additional filters you may want.

  3. Once you have found the project click on the Project.

  4. If you want to send an individual open form click the Envelope icon on the right side of the open form

  5. The Send Forms menu will appear and you can select an Email Group in the Email Group dropdown, or you can add a Custom Email in the Add Email Field and click the + button.

  6. You will then select a Template in the Template dropdown.

  7. Click Send.

  8. If you want to send multiple open forms, click the Radio Button on the left hand side next to every open form you want to send.

  9. Once you have selected the open forms you want to send, click the three little dots on the right side just above all the open forms.

  10. Click Send Forms.

  11. The Send Forms menu will appear and you can select an Email Group in the Email Group dropdown, or you can add a Custom Email in the Add Email Field and click the + button.

  12. You will then select a Template in the Template dropdown.

  13. Click Send.

data.title: Phone Version - How Do I Fill Out An Expense Form?
data.description: This article covers how to fill out an expense form.
data.body:
It is easy to fill out an expense form and this article will walk you through exactly what to do!

Here are the steps to fill out an Expense Form

  1. After you log in you will see the FieldFlo Dashboard. Click the three lines on the top left to expand your menu.

  2. One the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click the Projects module.

  3. You can scroll down to find your project or click on the blue + Filter button to search by Project Name, Project Number or any of the other fields you would like to search by.

  4. Once you found your project, click anywhere on the project to open up the details.

  5. On the bottom of your screen, click the blue + button to add your form.

  6. Find the Expense Form and select Radio Button just to the left of the form.

  7. Scroll to the bottom and click Save.

  8. Click on the Expense Form.

  9. The Date field is not editable and is set as the date you open the form.

  10. Depending on what your company requires, enter the appropriate information in the SS (Social Security Number) / ID (Employee ID).

  11. In the Employee dropdown select the Employee that this form needs to be submitted.

  12. Click + Add Row. (Click the + Add Row as many times as needed for every expense that needs to be submitted)

  13. After adding all the rows that you need, several field will appear. Fill out all the information in each of the fields that is needed:

    1. Purchase Date

    2. Project Type

    3. Cost Type

    4. Cost

    5. Reimbursable

    6. Purchase From

    7. Receipt #

    8. Description

  14. Add a picture of the receipt by clicking Choose File.

  15. After all the rows have been filled out, click Save all. Now your Expense form is complete

data.title: Phone Version - How Do I Open Daily Forms?
data.description: This article walks Supervisors / Foreman / Superintendents through opening Mandatory Daily Forms
data.body:
It is easy in FieldFlo for Supervisors / Foreman / Superintendents to open daily forms. This article will walk Supervisors / Foreman / Superintendents through doing it!

Here are the steps to filling out Daily Forms

  1. After you log in you will see the FieldFlo Dashboard. Click on the three lines on the top left to expand the menu.

  2. Click on the Projects module.

  3. To find your project you may scroll down and look for it or you may press the + Filter button and enter the Project Name, Project Number or any other field you would like to search by.

  4. Once you find your project, click on the name to go into the project and see the project information.

  5. Click on the blue Start Day button to open up the mandatory forms you must complete set by your company for this project.

  6. If you need additional forms you may click the blue + a window will open. You will have the ability to select and add any additional forms you may need for this project.

    Note : When adding additional forms, select the bubble to the left of the form name. When you have all your forms you need selected, scroll down and hit the blue Save button.

  7. Any forms that appear red have required fields that are incomplete.


    ​Note : These forms will turn white when fully completed, before you stop your project and click End Day, all of these mandatory forms should not be red.

data.title: Phone Version - How Do I Fill Out A Waste Load Out Form
data.description: This article explains how to fill out a Waste Load Out Form
data.body:
It is easy to fill out a Waste Load Out Form in FieldFlo and this article will explain how to do it!

Here are the steps to filling out a Waste Load Out Form

  1. One the left hand side of your screen click the threes lines on the top.

  2. Click the Projects module.

  3. Find the project you need to fill out a Waste Load Out Form on by clicking on the x Filter button. This will drop down your filter options.

  4. Search for your project by Project Name or by Project Number.

  5. Once you have found the project click on the Project.

  6. On the bottom of your screen, click the blue + button.

  7. Find the Waste Load Out Form and select the Radio Button just to the left of the form.

  8. Scroll to the bottom and click Save.

  9. Click on the Waste Load Out Form.

  10. Select the date in the Creation Date dropdown.

  11. Select the Supervisor in the Supervisor dropdown.

  12. Click the + New Load button. This will add Load 1 to your form.

  13. Under each of the loads you have added, there will be an information section. Enter in as much information as you can about each load in each of the provided fields.

  14. You can add a picture of the manifest by clicking on the Choose File button under the Images section.

  15. Click the Save All button.

  16. If you have multiple loads, you can click the + New Load to add as many loads as you need or you can make a copy of the load you just created and update the necessary information and add new manifest pictures to each copy.

  17. To copy a load, go to the Create Multiple Copies of this load dropdown and select # of loads you wish to create.

  18. Once you have finished creating all of your loads, make sure to click the Save All button.

data.title: How Do I Create An Email Template
data.description: This article covers creating an email template.
data.body:
It is very easy to create an email template in FieldFlo and this article will walk you through exactly what you need to do it.

Here are the steps to creating an email template

  1. On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click the Admin Module.

  2. Underneath the Admin module several options will appear. Click Email Templates.

  3. You will be taken to the Email Templates page. Click the + Add Templates button.

  4. Fill out the fields that are required. These fields are notated with a red *

    Note : The required are:

    1. From Email

    2. From Name

    3. Subject

  5. (Optional) You can double click any of the options listed in the brackets "{}".

    • Note : All of the options are:

      • {LINKS} - This one must be added to your email if you want forms from FieldFlo to attach

      • {FORM DETAILS}

      • {LOGO}

      • {CLIENT COMPANY}

      • {OUR COMPANY}

      • {DATE}

      • {SUPERVISOR}

      • {MY NAME}

      • {MESSAGE}

  6. After filling out all needed fields, click Save.

data.title: How Do I Deactivate A Client
data.description: This article will cover everything you need to know to deactivate a client
data.body:
It is very easy to deactivate a client, and this article will walk you through exactly what to do!

Here are the steps to deactivating a client

  1. On the left side of your screen in the main menu click the CRM module.

  2. Right under the CRM, you will see Leads and Clients appear. Click Clients.

  3. Search for the Client in the Client Name quick search field and hit Enter on your keyboard.

  4. Once you find your client, click the three little dots on the far right side of any client to access the admin section.

  5. A dropdown will appear. Click Edit.

  6. The Edit Client pop out will appear and you should uncheck the Active radio button.

  7. Click Save on the bottom left of the pop out.

data.title: How Do I Create A New Client
data.description: This article covers creating a new client in FieldFlo.
data.body:
This article will cover everything that you need to know about creating a new client in FieldFlo.

Here are the steps to creating a new client in FieldFlo

  1. On the left side of your screen in the main menu click the CRM module

  2. Right under the CRM, you will see Leads and Clients appear. Click Clients.

  3. On the top right you will see the + Add Clients button. Click the + Add Clients button.

  4. The Add Client pop out will appear.

  5. Click the Active radio button. This will activate the new customer.

  6. There are several fields that are required. These fields are notated with a red *

  7. The following fields are required:

    • Company Name

    • Address

    • City

    • Zip

    • Contact Name

  8. Once these are filled out, you can click Save, which is located on the bottom left of the pop out.

data.title: How Do I Create Email Groups?
data.description: This article covers creating email groups.
data.body:
Creating emails groups is easy to do, and this article will show you exactly how to do it.

Here are the steps to creating email groups

  1. On the left hand side of your screen in the main menu, click the Admin Module.

  2. Underneath the Admin module several options will appear. Click Email Groups.

  3. You will be taken to the Email Groups page. Click the + Add Group button.

  4. The only required field marked by a red * is the Group Name. Enter a Group Name in the Group Name field.

  5. You can now add employee's directly from FieldFlo through the Add Employee Email dropdown, or you can add custom email(s) by entering the email address in the Add Custom Email field and click the Add Email.

  6. Once all the emails have been added, click the Save button.

data.title: Phone Version - How To Stop Time On A Daily Timesheet
data.description: This article will cover everything you need to know about starting employee's time on a Daily Timesheet.
data.body:
Stopping time on a Daily Timesheet is easy to accomplish. This article will walk you through everything you need to know about stopping a Daily Timesheet!

Requirements

NOTE: The access that you need is typically the access that is provided to Supervisors / Foreman.

Information

FieldFlo recommends that you have your employees verify their time via the SMS text message option. If you want to learn how to send employees text messages so they can verify their time using SMS verification, click the button below to be taken to the "How To Send An Employee A SMS Text Verification For The Daily Timesheet" article:

How To Send An Employee A SMS Text Verification For The Daily Timesheet

If you want to learn how to have an employee verify from the Supervisor's device, click the button below to be taken to the "How Can Employees Verify Their Time From A Supervisor's Device" article:

How Do I Verify Time On A Supervisors Device

Here are the steps to stopping time on a Daily Timesheet:

  1. Click on the Three Lines in the top left corner of your screen which will expand the Main Menu. Then click the Projects module.

  2. Now that you are on the Projects module page, click the + Filter button.

  3. You can search for the Project multiple ways from the Filter. Enter the relevant information into which ever filter you want to use or combination of filters and hit Enter on your keyboard.

  4. Click on the Project.

  5. Click on the Daily Timesheet.

  6. Click the Select All radio button to stop time for all Employees or you can click the Radio Button next to each Employee to stop their time individually.

  7. Click the Stop button.

  8. The "STOP CLOCK FOR ALL" popup will appear (if you clicked the Select All radio button). Click the "Did they take a break?" dropdown and select the amount of break time.

    NOTE: This is for non-paid break time.

  9. Click the "I verify the information above is correct" radio button.

  10. Enter your PIN and click Submit.

  11. Once all of the Employees' time has been stopped, all Employees will be orange and the Verify button will appear.

data.title: Phone Version - How To Send An Employee A SMS Text Verification For The Daily Timesheet
data.description: This article will cover everything you need to know about sending an employee a text message for SMS verification on a Daily Timesheet.
data.body:
It's very easy to send a text message for employee's to verify their time on a Daily Timesheet using the SMS verification. This article will walk you through everything you need to know so that you can send these text messages which will allow your employees to verify their time on a Daily Timesheet.

Requirements

NOTE: The employee must allow text messages to be sent to their personal device.

NOTE: The employee must have their phone number listed on their employee profile in FieldFlo. Your company's Admin or Guru will have access to check the employee profiles. The Admin or Guru can also add these phone numbers if they are missing.

Information

FieldFlo does recommend that you have employees verify their time on a Daily Timesheet using the SMS verification method. This is the best way to make sure that the employees themselves are verifying their time.

Here are the steps to send an employee a SMS text verification for the Daily Timesheet

Click the video below to watch "How To Send An Employee A SMS Text Verification For the Daily Timesheet".

  1. Click on the Three Lines in the top left corner of your screen which will expand the Main Menu. Then click the Projects module.

  2. Now that you are on the Projects module page, click the + Filter button.

  3. You can search for the Project multiple ways by using Filters. Enter the relevant information into the each of the Filter fields you want to use hit Enter on your keyboard.

  4. Click on the Project.

  5. Click on the Daily Timesheet.

  6. Before we can send SMS verification we need to stop time on the timesheet, to do this select the Radio button on the top left of employees to select all employees or select the employee's individual Radio Button to stop time individually.

  7. At the bottom, Click Stop.

  8. Fill out the Stop Clock For All verification and click Submit.

  9. Once you stop the time, all employees should turn yellow.

  10. Click the Select All radio button to send a SMS verification for all Employees or you can click the Radio Button next to each Employee to send a SMS verification individually.

  11. Once you have your Employees selected, click the SMS phone icon to send your SMS verification.

  12. The Send Text Message pop up will appear, click YES to send SMS.

  13. Once the SMS is sent, the employees should have this red SMS SENT box next to their name.

    Note: If the SMS was unable to send, you will be notified and the employee will not have this SMS SENT box next to their name.

  14. When employees verified their time, the employee name should be black with a green Verified box next to their name.

data.title: Phone Version - How To Start Time On A Daily Timesheet for the First Time
data.description: This article will cover everything you need to know about starting time on a Daily Timesheet for the first time from a Phone.
data.body:
It is super easy to start a Daily Timesheet, and this article will walk you through everything you need to know to start a Daily Timesheet in FieldFlo for the first time on a Project!

Requirements

NOTE: The access that you need is typically the access that is provided to Supervisors / Foreman.

NOTE: You must have access to Projects and adding Project Forms.

Information

FieldFlo recommends that you have your employees verify their time via the SMS text message option. If you want to learn how to send employees text messages so they can verify their time using SMS verification, click the button below to be taken to the "How To Send An Employee A SMS Text Verification For The Daily Timesheet" article:

How To Send An Employee A SMS Text Verification For The Daily Timesheet

If you want to learn how to start time and copy a Daily Timesheet from a previous day click on this button below to be taken to the "How Do I Use “Same As Previous Day” For A Daily Timesheet?" article:

How Do I Use “Same As Previous Day” For A Daily Timesheet?

If you want to learn how to stop time on a Daily Timesheet, click on this button below to be taken to the "How To Stop Time on a Daily Time Sheet" article:

How To Stop Time On A Daily Timesheet

Here are the steps to start a Daily Timesheet on a Project for the first time

  1. Click on the Three Lines in the top left corner of your screen which will expand the Main Menu. Then click the Projects module.

  2. Now that you are on the Projects module page, click the + Filter button.

  3. You can search for the Project multiple ways from the Filter. Enter the relevant information into which ever filter you want to use or combination of filters and hit Enter on your keyboard.

  4. Click on the Project.

  5. Click Start Day. This will bring in all of mandatory forms for the day that your company has picked for you to complete, including the Daily Time Sheet.

  6. A popup will appear that asks "Are you sure you want to start you day in project:..." Click Yes.

  7. Click on the Daily Timesheet.

  8. Now that the Daily Timesheet is open, click inside the Foreman / Superintendent Signature dropdown.

  9. From the dropdown, select your Supervisor or Foreman or Superintendent.

  10. (OPTIONAL) If the Supervisor or Foreman or Superintendent that you selected should be added to the Daily Timesheet, click the blue hyperlink "Add to timesheet".

  11. On the bottom right of your screen you should see a little person with a +. Click the blue Add Employee(s) button.

  12. The Add Employees screen will popup and you can either filter Employees by clicking in the Filter Employee field or you can click the Radio Button next to every Employee that you want to add to the timesheet.

  13. Now that your Employee have been added to the Daily Timesheet, make sure to select a Position and Phase for each Employee by clicking the Select Position and Select Phase dropdown.

    NOTE: Position is ALWAYS Required. Phases depends on your company setup and may not be available.

  14. Now you can click the Select All radio button if you want to start the time for all Employees at the same time or you can select the Employees individually by clicking the Radio Button next to each Employee.

  15. Once you have selected all the Employees that you want to start click the green START button.

  16. The "Please Confirm?" popup will appear saying, "This action will start timer for selected employees Are you sure?" Click Yes.

  17. When the Employees time has started the Employees will turn green.

data.title: How Do I Reset A PIN
data.description: This article will cover everything you need to know about resetting a PIN for an employee.
data.body:
It is easy to reset an employee's PIN and this article will explain exactly how to do it!

Requirements

NOTE: In order to change Employee PIN(s), you must be an Admin or Guru at your company and have access to the Employee module on the left hand side of your screen in the main menu.

Information

You might be wondering, "What is a PIN?" A PIN is an employees Personal Identification Number. This number is what an employee will use as their Legal Signature when verifying:

  • Daily Timesheets

  • PSI / JHA / SPA

  • Inspection Forms

  • etc.

You may be wondering, "Who needs a PIN?" All employees need a PIN.

Or maybe you are asking, "How do I know what the PIN should be?" FieldFlo recommends that you use the last 4 digits for an employees Social Security. The reason(s) we recommend this are:

  • It is easier for Admins to set these up because they probably have access to this already

  • It is easier for an employee to remember

  • It is a legally bound number to the employee

  • It is less likely that an employee will be willing to share this confidential number with their fellow employees

Here are the steps to resetting a PIN:

Click this Video to watch the "How Do I Reset A PIN" video:

  1. Click on the Employees module (located on the left hand side of your screen in the main menu).

  2. Now that you are on the Employees module page, click inside the Employee Quick Search field. Type in the name of the employee you are needing to change the password for and hit Enter on your keyboard.

  3. On the right hand side of the employee that you are needing to change the password for, are three little dots. Click three little dots and then click Reset PIN.
